story:
SUMMARY

My name is John Yates.  I am a complex guy with a lot of interests and passions.  But one of my primary passions is collecting, playing, and sharing pinball machines with others.  I’ve been obsessed with pinball since I was in 3rd grade.  One of my friends at church had two pinball machines in his basement, and I was quickly addicted.  Ever since, I have loved pinball.  I feel something deeply nostalgic and visceral when playing pinball.  I have been buying, selling, and trading pinball machines for 28 years, since I was 19.  


This campaign represents the culmination of 28 years of learning, searching, collecting, financial struggle and preparation.  I have finally reached the point where my dream is within reach – to open a Pinball Museum where the public can come to play pinball and share my love of the game.  I have amassed a collection of 150 of the best pinball machines spanning 70 years.  I’ve launched two arcade museums, both of which are surviving and pleasing visitors every week.  I have found the perfect building for my dream.  Now I just need some financial help in order to purchase and renovate the building for this Pinball Museum.  


Contributors to this campaign will be responsible for making this Pinball Museum possible.  I will freely supply all of my time and talents, as well as the cream of my pinball collection.  I will hire a local contractor to do a few things I can’t, but  I will personally work full-time doing all of the work on the building that I’m capable of, and will personally rebuild and restore every pinball machine that will go inside.  I did 90+% of the work renovating and launching Arcadia, my main arcade museum,  This included all framing, electrical, plumbing, HVAC, tile, painting, as well as all of the work on the games themselves.


But without contributions, I’m afraid I can’t stretch myself any thinner financially.  I’ve already poured my life and every penny I’ve earned since college graduation into acquiring the games, buildings, and skills needed.  And I have borrowed all I can to make the other two arcade museums possible and keep their doors open.   


WHAT WE NEED

I’m only attempting to raise the money needed to purchase and renovate the building that will house this Pinball Museum.  I am not asking for a dime to fund my time or effort, nor any money for any pinball machines that will go inside.  I will give all of that.  The pinball machines I have earmarked for the museum and already own have a retail value of over $100k.  


I am seeking to raise $52,380 to make this project a reality.  This money will be spent as follows (some exact, some approximate estimates):  

  • $ 30,000 to purchase and close on the building
  • $ 6,271 to replace all of the windows with new ones that match the style, but are double-paned and high-efficiency. The current windows are beautiful, but rotten and inefficient
  • $ 5,234 to repair / replace the facia, soffets, gutters, and edges of the roof which are rotted out
  • $ 3,500 for a spiral staircase and other construction materials to allow access to the full basement, which we can also fill with games
  • $ 2,500 to re-plumb the building (needed badly), replace the water heater with a tankless, move the toilet, and modify the bathroom slightly
  • $ 2,500 to either strip and refinish the floor or purchase and install new carpet
  • $ 1,500 for miscellaneous new fixtures, electrical supplies, switches, doors, door hardware, locks, security system, etc
  • $ 600 for supplies needed to repair and refinish the historic, awesome entry door
  • $ 275 for a new custom chimney cap including installation


WHAT YOU WILL GET

We have all kinds of perks to offer contributors to this project.  And let me say right off the bat, these perks will never expire (as long as I'm alive and in business).


For the top perk, we can offer a restored arcade game or pinball machine. Other top perks include free lodging in our just-launched Arcade-themed BnB, called Hotel Arcadia.  This hotel suite rents for between $199 and $249 per night, and offers two huge HD movie / gaming setups, 4 full-sized video games with over 800 games you can play for free, an Addams Family pinball for 25 cents per play, and a fun Kids’ Loft where your kids can play games and sleep in their own “secret hideaway.”  If you live a long ways away and are not sure when you can make it to central Illinois, have no fear.  Your free night in Arcadia will never expire.  Just come when you can.


Another perk we can offer is a free play party for you and your friends at Pinball Paradise, once it’s open.  Of course we will have T-Shirts available from Arcadia, Pinball Paradise, and Hotel Arcadia for smaller donations.  And anyone who donates at least $25 will get a certificate for a roll of quarters to get them started on their next visit to Pinball Paradise.

I do not have logos designed yet for Pinball Paradise or Hotel Arcadia.  If any of you are graphic designers and would like to help me by offering suggestions for logos, I would be thrilled.  I am not a graphic designer.  You can email ideas to vintagevideogames.com@gmail.com.


If we do not reach our financial goal with this campaign, the funds that are raised will still be used for building and launching Pinball Paradise.  We will NOT use the funds for anything different.  Pinball Paradise WILL happen…it is just a matter of how soon we’re able to complete it.  If we raise all of the funds needed, we will open Pinball Paradise by May 2016 and possibly sooner.  If we do not raise all of the needed funds, it will take longer, proportionally to how short we fall of our goal.   


THE IMPACT

This museum is needed.  Pinball was born and raised in Illinois, and there are pitifully few places left in Illinois where the public can play pinball.  Sure, there are lots of wealthy pinball collectors with great collections in their basements.  But if you don’t have an extra $10k to spend on a modern pinball machine, there is almost no where you can go anymore to enjoy pinball, or to show your kids what you grew up playing.  The one large pinball arcade in southern IL closed its doors in 2015.  Arcadia (my arcade museum) has a handful of pinball machines available for play, but it only scratches the surface and leaves vast eras of great games untouched.


Where can you play a classic Magic Town, Wizard, Captain Fantastic, Skylab, Gorgar, Space Invaders, High Speed, Comet, Earthshaker, Batman pinball?  Nowhere.  Your contribution will result in the opening of a place with about 40 playable pinball machines (to start, more later) from the 1950s through the 2000s.  And we will be open weekly as long as I’m alive (I’m 47).  

Pinball Paradise is very conveniently located for travelers, as well.  McLean, IL is right along Interstate 55, exactly halfway between Chicago and St. Louis.  It is also, amazingly, right on historic Route 66!  We have travelers literally from all over the world driving by this building every day as they trek down ole' 66 from Chicago to California! There is a world-class airport in Bloomington, just 15 miles from Pinball Paradise.


I can deliver and make this Pinball Museum happen with your contributions.  I have a track record of taking projects like this from conception to completion by sheer force of will.  


Look at my primary arcade museum, Arcadia.  Here is what the building looked like before I started the renovation:  https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.611171515677751.1073741827.609860809142155&type=3

Here are some pictures during the renovation: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.61118...

It took me years to do, but I transformed this shambles of a building into a completely renovated, modern, top notch space with 70+ restored, fully working arcade games.  It took an immense amount of time, energy, and money, but I made it happen (by God’s grace and with His help).  


Another big arcade project I have completed is Hotel Arcadia (mentioned above).  You can see all the details at airbnb, the booking agent for the place.  Just go to http://www.airbnb.com, and search for McLean, IL and you will find Hotel Arcadia.  This was another massive project where I had to transform a wreck of a building into a new, modern, high-tech, arcade themed hotel suite with kitchen, full bath, game room, kids’ loft, and movie room.  It took two years and lots of money and work, but I made it happen.  


Another project that I have at least completed phase 1 of is the Route 66 Arcade Museum, which is just 5 miles down the road from Arcadia.  I have big plans to expand this museum after Pinball Paradise is completed.


The reason I am attempting to raise funds using crowdfunding for the first time, is so that I can complete this project more quickly.  I am fairly confident that I could make this dream happen one way or another eventually on my own.  But I am not getting any younger, and I have a lot more plans after Pinball Paradise.  I don’t want to have to spend 2 or 3 (or more) years getting it off the ground, but would love to have it done by May and be able to see people playing and enjoying pinball there this summer.


HURDLES TO OVERCOME

There really aren’t any significant hurdles to be overcome in bringing this project to completion other than finances.  I am already in the process of purchasing the building.  It is zoned properly for this use.  It already has the necessary utilities and a sound HVAC system.  It is a good, solid building with no serious issues to address.  I have already invested almost $100k in all of the pinball machines and parts needed to fill the museum when completed.  And there is nothing needing to be done that I have not already done in the past.  It just comes down to how long it takes to come up with the money needed for the building and repairs.  And I really don’t need very much money, as you can see above.  We can do this!


If you will help me with a contribution, you will be keeping pinball alive in Illinois by opening a place where anyone can play the best pinballs from the last 50 years.  We have hosted several Pinball tournaments at Arcadia, and this will continue and expand at Pinball Paradise.  I will also immortalize the top 40 contributors on a plaque that will be hung inside Pinball Paradise for all time. 

I promise to be accountable for every dollar donated, and will show how the money is spent as it is spent.  I will not, like others who have solicited donations for arcade related projects, simply take the money and buy a bunch of new games for my personal collection.  That is offensive, deceitful, and wrong.  


CONCLUSION

If you aren’t in a position to help with a donation, I understand.  But you can still help in several ways.  Please share this campaign with others you know who might be interested and able to make a contribution.  You can also visit Arcadia: America’s Playable Arcade Museum and contribute simply by playing some of our games.  We can slowly earn the money we need, one quarter at a time!  Finally, you could stay at Hotel Arcadia, or tell your friends about it.  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5308078


It really won’t take much from each contributor to meet this goal and get Pinball Paradise open.  Thank you so much for your time and help.  I really appreciate every one of you. Keep on Flippin’!!!

But without contributions, I’m afraid I can’t stretch myself any thinner financially.  I’ve already poured my life and every penny I’ve earned since college graduation into acquiring the games, buildings, and skills needed.  And I have borrowed all I can to make the other two arcade museums possible and keep their doors open.   

WHAT WE NEED

I’m only attempting to raise the money needed to purchase and renovate the building that will house this Pinball Museum.  I am not asking for a dime to fund my time or effort, nor any money for any pinball machines that will go inside.  I will give all of that.  The pinball machines I have earmarked for the museum and already own have a retail value of over $100k.  
I am seeking to raise $52,380 to make this project a reality.  This money will be spent as follows (some exact, some approximate estimates):  

$ 30,000 to purchase and close on the building
$ 6,271 to replace all of the windows with new ones that match the 
style, but are double-paned and high-efficiency. The current windows are
 beautiful, but rotten and inefficient

$ 5,234 to repair / replace the facia, soffets, gutters, and edges of the roof which are rotted out
$ 3,500 for a spiral staircase and other construction materials to 
allow access to the full basement, which we can also fill with games
$ 2,500 to re-plumb the building (needed badly), replace the water heater with a tankless, move the toilet, and modify the bathroom slightly
$ 2,500 to either strip and refinish the floor or purchase and install new carpet
$ 1,500 for miscellaneous new fixtures, electrical supplies, switches, doors, door hardware, locks, security system, etc
$ 600 for supplies needed to repair and refinish the historic, awesome entry door
$ 275 for a new custom chimney cap including installation


WHAT YOU WILL GET

We have all kinds of perks to offer contributors to this project.  And let me say right off the bat, these perks will never expire (as long as I'm alive and in business).
For the top perk, we can offer a restored arcade game or pinball machine. Other top perks include free lodging in our just-launched Arcade-themed BnB, called Hotel Arcadia.  This hotel suite rents for between $199 and $249 per night, and offers two huge HD movie / gaming setups, 4 full-sized video games with over 800 games you can play for free, an Addams Family pinball for 25 cents per play, and a fun Kids’ Loft where your kids can play games and sleep in their own “secret hideaway.”  If you live a long ways away and are not sure when you can make it to central Illinois, have no fear.  Your free night in Arcadia will never expire.  Just come when you can.
Another perk we can offer is a free play party for you and your friends at Pinball Paradise, once it’s open.  Of course we will have T-Shirts available from Arcadia, Pinball Paradise, and Hotel Arcadia for smaller donations.  And anyone who donates at least $25 will get a certificate for a roll of quarters to get them started on their next visit to Pinball Paradise.
I do not have logos designed yet for Pinball Paradise or Hotel Arcadia.  If any of you are graphic designers and would like to help me by offering suggestions for logos, I would be thrilled.  I am not a graphic designer.  You can email ideas to vintagevideogames.com@gmail.com.
If we do not reach our financial goal with this campaign, the funds that are raised will still be used for building and launching Pinball Paradise.  We will NOT use the funds for anything different.  Pinball Paradise WILL happen…it is just a matter of how soon we’re able to complete it.  If we raise all of the funds needed, we will open Pinball Paradise by May 2016 and possibly sooner.  If we do not raise all of the needed funds, it will take longer, proportionally to how short we fall of our goal.   

THE IMPACT

This museum is needed.  Pinball was born and raised in Illinois, and there are pitifully few places left in Illinois where the public can play pinball.  Sure, there are lots of wealthy pinball collectors with great collections in their basements.  But if you don’t have an extra $10k to spend on a modern pinball machine, there is almost no where you can go anymore to enjoy pinball, or to show your kids what you grew up playing.  The one large pinball arcade in southern IL closed its doors in 2015.  Arcadia (my arcade museum) has a handful of pinball machines available for play, but it only scratches the surface and leaves vast eras of great games untouched.
Where can you play a classic Magic Town, Wizard, Captain Fantastic, Skylab, Gorgar, Space Invaders, High Speed, Comet, Earthshaker, Batman pinball?  Nowhere.  Your contribution will result in the opening of a place with about 40 playable pinball machines (to start, more later) from the 1950s through the 2000s.  And we will be open weekly as long as I’m alive (I’m 47).  
Pinball Paradise is very conveniently located for travelers, as well.  McLean, IL is right along Interstate 55, exactly halfway between Chicago and St. Louis.  It is also, amazingly, right on historic Route 66!  We have travelers literally from all over the world driving by this building every day as they trek down ole' 66 from Chicago to California! There is a world-class airport in Bloomington, just 15 miles from Pinball Paradise. 
I can deliver and make this Pinball Museum happen with your contributions.  I have a track record of taking projects like this from conception to completion by sheer force of will.  
Look at my primary arcade museum, Arcadia.  Here is what the building looked like before I started the renovation:  https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.611171515677751.1073741827.609860809142155&type=3
Here are some pictures during the renovation: https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.61118...
It took me years to do, but I transformed this shambles of a building into a completely renovated, modern, top notch space with 70+ restored, fully working arcade games.  It took an immense amount of time, energy, and money, but I made it happen (by God’s grace and with His help).  
Another big arcade project I have completed is Hotel Arcadia (mentioned above).  You can see all the details at airbnb, the booking agent for the place.  Just go to http://www.airbnb.com, and search for McLean, IL and you will find Hotel Arcadia.  This was another massive project where I had to transform a wreck of a building into a new, modern, high-tech, arcade themed hotel suite with kitchen, full bath, game room, kids’ loft, and movie room.  It took two years and lots of money and work, but I made it happen.  
Another project that I have at least completed phase 1 of is the Route 66 Arcade Museum, which is just 5 miles down the road from Arcadia.  I have big plans to expand this museum after Pinball Paradise is completed.
The reason I am attempting to raise funds using crowdfunding for the first time, is so that I can complete this project more quickly.  I am fairly confident that I could make this dream happen one way or another eventually on my own.  But I am not getting any younger, and I have a lot more plans after Pinball Paradise.  I don’t want to have to spend 2 or 3 (or more) years getting it off the ground, but would love to have it done by May and be able to see people playing and enjoying pinball there this summer.


HURDLES TO OVERCOME

There really aren’t any significant hurdles to be overcome in bringing this project to completion other than finances.  I am already in the process of purchasing the building.  It is zoned properly for this use.  It already has the necessary utilities and a sound HVAC system.  It is a good, solid building with no serious issues to address.  I have already invested almost $100k in all of the pinball machines and parts needed to fill the museum when completed.  And there is nothing needing to be done that I have not already done in the past.  It just comes down to how long it takes to come up with the money needed for the building and repairs.  And I really don’t need very much money, as you can see above.  We can do this!
If you will help me with a contribution, you will be keeping pinball alive in Illinois by opening a place where anyone can play the best pinballs from the last 50 years.  We have hosted several Pinball tournaments at Arcadia, and this will continue and expand at Pinball Paradise.  I will also immortalize the top 40 contributors on a plaque that will be hung inside Pinball Paradise for all time.  
I promise to be accountable for every dollar donated, and will show how the money is spent as it is spent.  I will not, like others who have solicited donations for arcade related projects, simply take the money and buy a bunch of new games for my personal collection.  That is offensive, deceitful, and wrong.  

CONCLUSION

If you aren’t in a position to help with a donation, I understand.  But you can still help in several ways.  Please share this campaign with others you know who might be interested and able to make a contribution.  You can also visit Arcadia: America’s Playable Arcade Museum and contribute simply by playing some of our games.  We can slowly earn the money we need, one quarter at a time!  Finally, you could stay at Hotel Arcadia, or tell your friends about it.  https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/5308078
It really won’t take much from each contributor to meet this goal and get Pinball Paradise open.  Thank you so much for your time and help.  I really appreciate every one of you. Keep on Flippin’!!!

story:
Short Summary

One Controller To Rule Them All!

Gone are the days that you need a dedicated controller for every console you own. Gone are the excuses from your friends when they say ... "yeah I would totally whoop your butt ...but we can't play cause I only have one controller". Lady-gamers and gentle-gamers  CONTROL THE WAY YOU PLAY with the Infinity Controller.

What We Need & What You Get

All I have currently is my idea, books filled with research, the drive and passion of a thoroughbred race horse, a patent and a website. That's good and all but it's time to bring that idea into reality and into your hands. We need love and support but also what everyone comes to Indiegogo for...MONEY so that we can hire engineers to create prototypes and then hire a manufacturer to mass produce and distribution and staff...Whoa! Talk about star-up lifestyle! Anyways sounds complicated but I've already done the research you don't have to worry about that. As far as what you get well your going to have to check out our perks for that!

The Impact

 So I know so far it's been a fun read and a fun video right? That's because I suffer from being ridiculously positive the truth is that I've been working non-stop on this idea for over a year. I dropped out of college cause I couldn't stop thinking about creating a business and taking life by the horns. It hasn't been easy but that's why it's worth pursuing. The Impact is that I guarantee if funded this will be one of the biggest companies involved in the gaming industry .

Risks & Challenges

 The only real risk is failing but I don't see that happening and even when you "fail" the only real failure is not learning anything from the experience. There will be many challenges though but businesses especially start ups are always challenged and it's needed to help make them grow stronger and smarter. We live in the best time in our history to start a business, there isn't a challenge that we can't overcome. If Tesla can beat the auto industry and thier attempts to seize their growth then theres really nothing stopping us from succeeding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you that would love to contribute but can't financially then it's ok because all you have to do is visit and support us across all our social media platforms and spread the word like mayo on a slice of bread!

story:
Hi People!

My name is Andrew, i'm 32 years old and i'm from Israel. I've founded a small company named "OGAT3d", We specialize in 3D movies, 3D design and animation.

For games development the name will change to "OGAT Entertainment".

 i'm  a 3d animator,modeler, designer and writer over 7 years. 

Making games allways was my childhood dream! In our company we are working on an equal footing like family! We work hard, on concept, design, models, animations, environments. but we can't do this game alone without your help!  we need you to make real mind blowing product!

Three  3d modelers, two character animators, level  designer and programmer.

I and my small but experienced team  began to develop "Dead Fault" triple-A hardcore horror, CO-OP,first person view game for PC and next gen consoles (XBOX One, Playstation 4). 
 Game based on "Unreal Engine 4" and supports Virtual Reality (VR) technology for a total immersion in the atmosphere of the game!


We all grew on those games and movies like: "Silent hill" and the "Evil Dead trilogy", They all inspired us with its atmosphere!


The past few months we worked on the game models, animation, some game environment, and few enemies without financial support. We sure, we can make great triple-A horror game in less time  and very high quality of visual effects and rich in content! 

Why?

  Because this is our dream! This is what we love, and we want to scare the c*** out of you! :))


Here some  of the game details:

Little part of the enemies models which will be used:


The game contains: bad language, gore, violence, sexual scenes, sliced body parts and many many more! 


If you missed for an old school hardcore horror, without censore... YOU are in the right place  my friends!


Also game will contain physx, fully destructible elements, environments ,body parts, dynamic blood splashes and many many more!




THE SHORT GAME STORY:

The story is about one guy, named Josh... An ordinary guy , without super powers and not a super hero. Just a simple car mechanic, living his boring life,he has no wife, no children, has just few friends,all his entertainment is sitting in a local bar and watching some TV...


But one day,a strange car accident changed his life!


Josh woke up in the hospital, Strange sounds came to his ears, strange and frightening faceless people were in the room! Thank God, they did not know that he can see them! These were fallen souls, demons and unknown creatures from underworld. after returning home, Josh began to look for his father.

His father Thomas, was a Priest but he left the home and became an archaeologist when Josh was just a little boy.

Thomas, in the past few years lived in a cabin in the mountains and was learning deeper about an ancient scroll that he found earlier in his life.

Josh decided that he, his own father is the only right person that can help him to solve the mysterious encounter with those creatures from the hospital.

Josh found out where is the cabin, and that was the beginning of Josh's  journey into the unknown!


                                                   



Day / Night Cycle:




Dynamic Weather, Wind:



We will NOT surrender, will NOT rest until we will make this game come to life! First of all, for YOU my friends!!!

WE NEED YOU, YOUR HELP, AND YOUR SUPPORT!

If we will get the goal here, on indiegogo, we will start the development of the game immediately! 

We promise to create the game in 18 months.

After 6-7 months demo will be ready, alpha test after 12 months and beta after 16 months.


Even if we will not manage to collect enough money for the creation of the game and the development, we will use what we got anyway for game marketing, game materials,  models, trailers, cinematics to find another ways to get investments and make it happen anyway!


The new materials will be shown to you all within the development and a progress of the game creation!

!!! Love you all !!!

story:
Click the button above to download the gameplay demo for PC!

 

The Steam version of the game will be distributed by Black Shell Media. 

What the Press Thinks:

Early concept art of Cecil and Egor

 

Egor packs a real punch with his trust Antibody Arm Cannon!

Cecil is the brains of the operation, really. 

All of the level select, upgrades, and message notifications are managed within this PC in the main menu! 

  • We're a newly formed Games Studio from the UK. 
  • This is our first commercial release, and it's already been accepted onto all 4 major gaming platforms! 
  • You're not just helping fund "Between Heartbeats", you're helping us build a studio so we can release more games in future!

We really appreciate all of you taking the time to even read this page, we truly do. 

Ultimately, we have to be frank with what we need, here. However, it isn't just about what WE need, it's also about what goodies YOU'LL get in return for your generosity! Yay for stuff in exchange for money! 

 

 The "Laser Shot" attachment for the Thwackpack; an upgrade in game.

Here's a breakdown of what will happen if we make more money than our goal!

Some concept art of the veins.

From our point of view, this project is everything we've studied for at University the past 3 years. We've gone from being Students of Games Design to registering as a Business and getting accepted onto all 4 major platforms (Xbox One, PS4, Wii U, and Steam) before we even started our final year. It's our dream to have a studio we've built with a strong community following like you wonderful people reading this right now. 

  • We feel that as a Games Studio we'll be able to provide fun, unique game concepts at affordable prices for people all across the world. As we said earlier; by funding this project and ensuring it's release to happen as soon as possible, we can get working on more games right away! 
  • We've won competitions as a games team in the past, gained awards, exhibited at events like EGX (the biggest UK games Expo), worked at getting projects made alongside working part time and studying at University, and put every ounce of ourselves into making it this far. We just need a bit of financial assistance to cross the final hurdle.
  • We promise to include any of the backers in mailing lists (if they wish) for vital feedback on future projects, QA Testing, or even just to keep you up to date with the happenings at the studio. We don't see you as a source of money, we see you as investors and it's only right that we treat you (and your opinions) with the utmost respect.

Not everything runs smoothly. We might hit a snag later down the line where a level just doesn't feel right, or there's an annoying bug in the code that takes a week to figure out it's just a typo, but we're more than qualified and prepared to give it our all and not let anything stand in our way. 

  • We're former games design students. The majority of the team have 5+ years of experience in multiple aspects of game design and development.
  • We've carefully derived project schedules, design documents, milestone targets and all sorts of other preliminary things to help us stay on track throughout the project's development cycle.
  • We're dedicating as much of our time as possible to bringing this project to life. 
  • For us to succeed as a Studio, we need to make our games and our players (that's you lovely lot) as prioritised as possible. Throughout every step of the journey, be it development, business related, or otherwise, the project's quality and your satisfaction will always be our number 1 consideration. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If money is tight or you just simply don't feel that pledging to this project is something you'd benefit from, then you can still help us out: 

  • Spread the word with your friends and family! Everyone knows a gamer, right?
  • Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to help spread the word of our campaign!
  • Take to Social Media! Tweet, post Status Updates, do Blog Entries! Anything where you can include our project name and link would seriously put a smile on our face.

That's about it, really! We really appreciate all of you taking the time to read through this and listen to what we have to say. Have a lovely day, folks! 

Back our HeadTalker!

We're also on HeadTalker. It's a free backing system that will extend our campaign's social media reach. We'd love it if you could back us on there, too! https://headtalker.com/campaigns/between-heartb...

 

Thanks again for reading this, folks. We truly appreciate it.

Take to Social Media! Tweet, post Status Updates, do Blog Entries! Anything where you can include our project name and link would seriously put a smile on our face.

That's about it, really! We really appreciate all of you taking the time to read through this and listen to what we have to say. Have a lovely day, folks! Back our HeadTalker!We're also on HeadTalker. It's a free backing system that will extend our campaign's social media reach. We'd love it if you could back us on there, too! https://headtalker.com/campaigns/between-heartb... Thanks again for reading this, folks. We truly appreciate it.

story:
About Me

My name is Alex and I’m a 17-year-old high school graduate. I currently live in Los Angeles, CA and am a student at Santa Monica College.

About 3 months ago, I had an exciting new idea for a business. I’d just returned a video game to GameStop and was frustrated that the money I got back was only a small percentage of what I paid for the game. I paid $60 when I bought the game and only received $20 when I returned it. I looked back over the years and realized that

I came out unsatisfied every time I returned a game to the store I bought it from. I was tired of not being fully compensated for my games, even when those games were released very recently.

The devaluation of most games in stores is very quick. Many games drop in price in less than 2 months after their release date.

That’s why I decided to start SaphFyre.

 

SaphFyre’s Effect On the Gaming Community

See this?

This is an example of the people at the top of the big corporations running game store chains. They are busy smiling with their calculators as they count all the extra money they have made off of average people like you and me.

On their way to the bank, they are laughing at how people are forced to continue buying games from their stores at full price and then return them for less than half the value.

Most games lose a significant amount of value in stores within two months of their release date. This leaves little time for users to try them out and decide whether they want to keep or return the games. If they need more time and decide to return a game, they will be forced to return it for a fraction of what they bought it for. Stores use this unfair method to add an extra boost to their already huge annual profits.

If you’ve ever bought and returned a video game before, you’ve likely been through this unsatisfying process.

Large corporations in the gaming and retail industry don’t care about giving their customers a good buying experience. The upward arrow is the only thing that matters to them, even if it means they will leave customers unsatisfied:

Gaming fanatics worldwide have been taken advantage of for far too long. This includes many children in middle and lower class families who spend a lot of time saving up to buy video games. If a child doesn’t like a game, they are forced to either keep it or return it for an insignificant amount of money. The money they get back is usually not enough to buy a replacement game to meet their needs.

These families work hard to ensure they and their children have comfort and recreation. However, their hard-earned money continues to go into the hands of greedy corporations who want to milk as many dollars out of them as they can. They keep buying games and cannot get back all, or even most, of the money they spent in the event of a return.

Gamers who want to buy games without waiting months for prices to drop have been left with no solution, until now. Our goal is to put a stop to this exploitation of gaming customers.

We want to create a service where gamers everywhere have a longer amount of time to try out their games before they lose value. If people choose not to keep a game, they have the option to be fully compensated for their games for a longer period of time. On SaphFyre, this period of time will be the 6 months following a specific game’s release date. This means that games will hold their high initial value for 6 months before they are dropped to their lower store price.

SaphFyre will allow all gaming fanatics to get their full money’s worth in the event that they want to get rid of a game they don’t like. No more getting ripped off by the big-name stores!

 

 

How SaphFyre Works

With a SaphFyre membership, you can try out a game for a long period of time to see if you want to keep it. If you choose not to keep the game, you will still have the opportunity to get your full money’s worth.

Instead of returning the game to a store and getting back a fraction of what you paid for it, you could bring it on SaphFyre for trade. The SaphFyre website, once completed, will allow all users to find other users who have put the games they want to receive out for trade. A user who puts out a game for trade will by fully compensated for their game in the form of other games.

For example, if you decide to trade a game that you paid $60 for at a store, you can trade that game for another game worth $60 on SaphFyre, two $30 games, a $45 game with a $15 game, and so on.

When putting a game out for trade, a member will make a public list of the game(s) they want in return for their game. This is so that users are only matched with people who are interested in the games they put out for trade and are willing to trade with them.

SaphFyre will have a user-friendly match-making system to facilitate users easily finding suitable trade partners. I hope to make this same service available for DVD and Blu-ray movies.

 

 

Avoid Scams With SaphFyre

It is common for many trading services to suffer from a lot of scams. However, SaphFyre has a solution to this.

Once two members have agreed to a trade, each trader will directly ship the game to a shipping address provided by the other trader. SaphFyre will require that both users agree to receive their games on a specified date.

If one member does not follow through with their trade, that member’s account will be locked until they compensate the other user. The locked member will have the option to send the game they agreed to send or compensate the other user through a PayPal deposit.

This way, there is little motivation for users to attempt a scam and game-trading will be a simple, trusted process. People can trade their games without concern and have one less thing to worry about in their day-to-day lives.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Below is our plan for each member’s SaphFyre home page. This is the first screen people will see when they log in:

 

 

Here is what a typical trading process will look like on SaphFyre:

 

 

What You Get In Return

A complex e-commerce website, like SaphFyre, requires extensive web development. Think of websites like eBay and Amazon. These are websites that require a lot of development and troubleshooting to be created and maintained.

The cost of creating a website like SaphFyre is typically much higher than your general, run-of-the-mill website that you can make on Weebly. That is why I hope to reach a goal of $50,000 in raised funds toward the development of SaphFyre.

The purpose of raising funds is to hire professional web developers in order to create the website with all the proper features to ensure the satisfaction of future SaphFyre members.

With your help, the SaphFyre website will be under development in the coming months. I hope to begin launch by late 2017.

Your contributions will not go unnoticed! I am very grateful for any contribution you decide to make, regardless of the amount.

There will be 6 Tiers of perks that are available for contributors. Tiers 1 thru 4 will be delivered to contributors by January 2017. Tiers 5 and 6 will be delivered to contributors after the SaphFyre website has been successfully funded and launched. We are estimating this time to be December 2017.

 

 

Perk Tiers 1, 2, and 3

Tiers 1, 2, and 3 are mainly beneficial for contributors who would like to participate in the concept of game trading on SaphFyre and are considering being a future member of the website. These perks include free memberships and discounts. There will be two types of memberships on SaphFyre, Regular and Premium. Both membership types are offered for a variety of different time periods, depending on what the user chooses.

 

Here are the options for future SaphFyre Membership:

 

 

Perk Tiers 4, 5, and 6

There will also be perks that will recognize contributors and allow people to see how much they’ve helped me accomplish my goal. These perks consist of social media shout-outs, a “Thank You” note, and a SaphFyre webpage and video listing and recognizing all contributors as appreciation.

 

 

No Matter the Final Number, We’ll Keep SaphFyre Going

Even if we do not reach our final goal of $50,000, I will contact web developers and have them begin work on the SaphFyre e-commerce website.

Without reaching our full goal, we may have to cut some of the features that we planned to add to the SaphFyre website. For example, we may have to wait longer until we add the movie trading feature or a Reward Center to the website. Please note that if this occurs, we may have to temporarily cancel Perk Tier 3 until a later time.

However, I will use any amount that I receive from your contributions for the development of the website, even if it means that some features will be limited and the website will be more basic in its early stages.

 

 

I Can’t Do It Alone

I truly believe that SaphFyre will be a major contributor to the satisfaction of the gaming community, a real game changer. This is a concept that will appeal to many people who love video games.

However, I need your help to make SaphFyre a reality.

I am putting a lot of faith into this project and hope that, with your help, I can begin my career as an aspiring entrepreneur, looking to contribute and make the world a better place.

SaphFyre is a service that would be helpful to gaming fanatics all around the globe. It would put an end to the lack of satisfaction one gets when returning a game to the store.

Please contribute to this campaign if you want to help me achieve my goal of improving the gaming experience for people worldwide!

 

 

Risks & Challenges In The Business World

I have been passionate about being an entrepreneur since I was very young. I always believed I would enjoy and be able to handle being the person who makes the rules and goes against all odds. I didn’t want to follow the herd.

In a society where many of us are taught to follow a certain one-size-fits-all path, I would like to experience something different. I want more than a 9-to-5 office job. I want to be able to contribute to a large community in a meaningful way, and enjoy the exciting journey as it happens. I feel that SaphFyre is my way to contribute to the community and express my ideas.

I realize that the process may not entirely go as I planned, but I am looking forward to the challenge of starting a business with all of my contributors as my co-founders.

I hope that you are interested in being a part of this exciting journey with me in the realm of business.

Let’s work together and make life better for gamers everywhere!

 

 

Many Ways To Contribute

Even if you cannot make a financial contribution to this campaign, there are still other ways you can greatly support our goal if you are interested.

Spreading the word about our campaign is every bit as important as the funds. If you use social media, you can make a quick post showing the value of our campaign to the people you connect with.

Please post on as many different websites as you can to get the most publicity for our campaign and convince others to join our movement.

I recommend any post on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Instagram, Reddit, Pinterest, Google+ and/or LinkedIn. These are widely used websites that will ensure that a large number of people will view our campaign and consider contributing to it.

If you regularly make videos for an audience on YouTube or another website, you could also have briefly introduce the SaphFyre campaign to your viewers at the beginning or end of your video. The same could be done during a live stream on Twitch.tv or another network.

If you cannot post about our campaign on social media but are still interested supporting it, the quickest and simplest way you could help let others know about our goal is to use the Indiegogo share tools.

Let’s start this movement together and liberate the gaming community once and for all!
story_txt: About MeMy name is Alex and I’m a 17-year-old high school graduate. I’d just returned a video game to GameStop and was frustrated that the money I got back was only a small percentage of what I paid for the game. I paid $60 when I bought the game and only received $20 when I returned it. I looked back over the years and realized thatI came out unsatisfied every time I returned a game to the store I bought it from. I was tired of not being fully compensated for my games, even when those games were released very recently.The devaluation of most games in stores is very quick. story:
YO! I mean... HEY YOU! Are you tired of supporting greedy game developers who are always "Nickle and Diming" you with their EXTREME freemium-based games? Tired of having to pay for every little feature, in a game? TA-DA! Heresy Studios is an upcoming game, and website development team. We are SOLELY DEVOTED, to pleasing our fans by bringing them cool, easy-to-play games whilst NOT trying to get you to spend, spend, spend, with no end, through freemium-based games that serve no other purpose than to get in to your pockets!

We care much less about getting into your pockets, and MUCH MORE about getting into your hearts and minds by delivering you awesomeness on a golden platter! Of course being an indie development team, monetary support is highly APPRECIATED but here at Heresy Studios we refuse to HOUND you for every penny we can get, unlike some other developers.

An AWESOME gaming experience is what we want our fans to have so when you support us in ANY way, you bring us closer to delivering awesomeness unto YOU!

Hi, We Are Heresy Studios

 

We started this team little over a year ago with a group of students all who were passionate about making games. As time past a lot of these people lost interest but a few of us didn't of course and we're here today enjoying making entertaining games for YOU, our players. 

I know that our main projects will be entertaining to the vast majority of gamers out there, we just need to create the games. None of us here can make the super quality 3D artwork/models that will be used in these games and part of this campaign will be set to outsourcing the work we can't do ourselves.

An example of one of our games is here:

http://www.heresystudios.com/Play/Colourbreak/I...

 

 http://www.heresystudios.com/play/

Check out our "Play" page, this page will be updated and made better as more content is ready to show.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I've started this campaign off with a $5000 goal, Of course raising more than this would be twice as helpful if not more. But if we don't raise this goal we won't give up. If we raised half then we just prioritize those funds to be as helpful to us as possible. 

The purpose of this goal is to use websites like Freelancer.com and Upwork to hire freelancers online at a decent price to get artwork for the games, hiring them for different skills, which can be found on these sites and USD is the most popular currency for them.

Some of perks include free early access to the bigger projects, A VIP pass to some projects which includes the early access and in-game features like bonuses and extra loot (Depends on the game).

 

The Impact

The impact of our plans will one day reach the entirety of the world. It won't change global warming and our target is of course Gamers but alongside games we are going to be creating apps, novels, and movies. We're going to effect many different areas of the entertainment industry although our main focus is on the gaming side of things. If you are a gamer or know someone that is, then supporting us will be superb because of the perks you get, if you have early access to one of our games but you don't play games then I think you've just found the perfect gift for a gamer!

We're not talking about small 2D simple games on a mobile phone to be sold on google play store. Although we will be doing this to also try and gain funds depending on the success of this campaign. Our ultimate goal is the 3 main systems; PC, Xbox and Playstation. Even if the games remain digital copies and not discs they will still be sent to these platforms, we will have an impact on the Gaming Community and by supporting us today you'll help not just me and my team meet our goals and conquer our dreams but you'll be helping bring a fresh face to gaming.

​

Risks & Challenges

The perfect example for obstacles we have faced would be the amount of people we've come across with superb abilities and the conversation rolls around to "I won't work for free." Yet we do really understand and to overcome this we are trying to raise the funds to complete our first big projects sooner rather than later. That way we would be able to say "Ok here's your wages and keep up the good work."

Being let down is one of the most devastating things we at Heresy Studios have experienced throughout this whole venture, heavily relying on someone that personally can't afford to commit the time and do everything they've said they will is crucifying and again having funds can completely cut down on this situation. Once we our first projects are on the shelf, we will be able to pay the people we need and properly build this team into the beauty that it can be!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

So you've made it to the bottom of the campaign,

Firstly, Thank You so much for reading this. We hope we haven't completely failed to catch your interest as this is our first time trying an Indiegogo Crowdfunding campaign and we've done a bit of research, yet the main thing we've noticed is, "You'll never know until you try," so here we are trying.

If you feel like you can't contribute financially that is absolutely fine but maybe you can share this campaign? Use Indiegogo's sharing (Because Indiegogo told me to tell you to use their tools so why not?) 

Spread the word about Heresy Studios, Have a look at our website, Keep your eyes open for updates and play the games we release!

Again I thank you so much for reading and I hope to receive your help!

 

Other Links Of Interest:

Our Website: http://www.heresystudios.com 

Facebook Page: http://www.facebook.com/heresystudiosltd

Gamejolt Dashboard: http://gamejolt.com/profile/heresystudios/579952

If you feel like you can't contribute financially that is absolutely fine but maybe you can share this campaign? Use Indiegogo's sharing (Because Indiegogo told me to tell you to use their tools so why not?)

story:
Edit: March 2016.

We Are Live. Open beta is free and unlimited for all at http://spindle.pl !


----------------------------------------------


Hi! We are a group of larp players and designers from Poland and Denmark. And here is our campaign: by larpers, for larpers. We have started it with the prospect of new scenarios being created: better, more interesting, and more polished than ever before. And so that all of us (yes, you too!) can play them later. :)

We are gathering funds to finish Spindle – an app supporting larp writing in all of its stages, from designing the plot to printing out elaborate character sheets. Spindle is a tool which will let Game Masters from all over the world create larps faster, more efficiently, and with less editing-related mistakes. That also includes you, as well as the authors of your favourite game!

During the campaign you may buy larp tickets with a discount (and give their authors access to Spindle), get Spindle for your own projects, or simply support the idea of creating mistake-free games.

We need 5000 Euros. The money raised will be used to develop our app as an efficient and useful tool. The more money we raise, the better Spindle can be – more convenient and comprehensive.

If you decide to support us:

Spindle will hit the Internet in the first quarter of 2016. Its basic version (for games with up to 15 character sheets) will be free and available for everyone.

The more money is raised, the more functions the app will have.

During the campaign, the more advanced subscriptions (16+ character sheets), designed for making bigger games, will be 30% cheaper. Such a subscription gives authors the access to various functions customized for their games.

Every larp ticket bought during the campaign will not only be cheaper, but it will also give the authors who donated it an advanced, month-long subscription to Spindle. This way you can help the authors by making it easier for them: they can create the game using the app in 2016, which means the upcoming larp season will be pretty exciting!

By supporting this campaign you support well-written larps – and the whole community

 You all must be wondering: how does Spindle work and look like, exactly? If yes, here is a short presentation. Of course, it is not a fully-developed app yet. However, we wanted to show you how easy and helpful it will be to create a larp with us. If you have any questions, doubts, or ideas – please leave a comment, we will answer it ASAP.

When we came up with Spindle and started working on it, we thought about all those larps we had created or taken part in. The misspellings, wrong names, plot inconsistencies, missing or wrong info, badly-edited text... We do not like it. Nobody does. But these are the things that happen even to the best of us when we are tired from writing, or when we work with so many players that we just cannot remember them all.

That is why Spindle was born: because we believe that we can make larps better. And that you can help us to achieve that.

SPINDLE is a complete tool for writing and managing larp scenarios, from designing plot to generating character handouts. It is aimed at delivering a set of handouts which are:

  • flexible – their structure can be completely customized for your larpas complex as necessary,

  • free of bugs – thanks to intelligent plot info management,

  • visually attractive – with well-designed templates and styles,

  • created in the most work-costefficient way as possible.


SPINDLE is the first IT tool to operate on various parts of larp scenario content which understands their meaning.

  • If you assign a character to a plot, their handout will be automatically updated, with plot info inserted into the right spots,

  • If you change the character playing a particular role, the content of their handout will follow,

  • You can be sure that character handouts have complete info about plots they are taking part in: consistent, sufficient, and free of bugs.


If you change something in a particular plot, all characters involved in it will be updated.

If you change something in one character, all other characters sharing this info will be updated as well.

SPINDLE fully embraces the idea that there is no sense in writing the same thing more than once.

SPINDLE connects plot content to characters while offering separate interfaces optimized for both elements. By handling independent edition by multiple authors, it makes dividing larpwrights' roles possible. One author can design plot and mark which info should be present in the handouts, another can prepare a well-written text for character info, while both are benefiting from the synergy of their work.

With SPINDLE, you can stop worrying about formatting handouts, graphical design, and typography. Style templates allow you to focus on content, while styling and generating handouts will be done automatically. Just one click and you can download ready-to-print, or send by e-mail, handouts in a .pdf file.




Spindle will never limit access to any of your scenarios. Even if you resigned from using paid plan, and your scenario is exceeding limitations of a free, bronze plan. In such case you will still be able to print or download handouts or export whole scenario as editable .doc file. Further edition will become available at any moment, when you get back to a plan suited to the scale of your game. This means, that if you need to use our paid plans, you can purchase them only for as long, as you will be using them.

To learn more, click&watch presentations



Professional larps have their unique requirements which need to be reflected in their IT tool. SPINDLE has a rich set of tools for big events – but it is also flexible in customization. Using our professional plan will allow you to:

  • enable features like: integrated task managing, auto assigning functions,

  • generating handouts based on a character form filled by the player, supporting communication between authors, and many more,

  • using a package of maintenance work hours to develop new tools designed to suit your needs and accessible exclusively to you,

  • have personal contact with SPINDLE, available by phone,

  • reach coaching support from SPINDLE via teleconference or in your workspace,


What if we cannot achieve the goal?

As larpers, we feel that Spindle is something we could really use when writing games. We want to develop it regardless of the support we get. However, its availability and functions depend on the money raised.

If we do not reach the goal, we will keep the raised money to develop Spindle. All the perks will be delivered as promised. Our partners who donate tickets to their larps will get their Spindle subscriptions.


Spindle is developed by larpers with unique experience

Maciej Wanicki, software engineer and creator of IT tools for larps, like player- tracking, GPS-based system for a Hunger Games-inspired larp TheGame, and a multiple-player spaceship simulator Space Quest.

Claus Raasted Herløvsen, worldwide known larpwright, co-organizer of Knudepunkt conferences, author of many larp publications and books, as well as the College of Wizardry and Fairweather Manor larps. 

Krzysztof Maj, professional manager with a large experience in creating strategic partnerships. Also, co-author of larps like the Witcher School and Old Town.

Kamil Bartczak, larpwright and co-author of methodology which led to the creation of SPINDLE. Professional application architect and IT analyst, co-author of Geas larp series.


Here is how you can support larps with only 45 seconds of your time:

  • Help us make some noise! Tell your larper friends about this project. Write on a forum, text your friend, call them, talk to them face-to-face. It really works!
  • Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to show the Spindle campaign to your friends on Facebook and/or Twitter.
  • Got any other ideas for people to talk about Spindle? Surprise us! We love surprises. :)

In case of any questions, please mail us at: bartczak.kamil@gmail.com

Thank you. Sharing is caring.
story_txt:

story:
Omniverse:  The collection of every single universe, multiverse, megaverse, dimension (alternate or pocket) and realm.



                                    
Our Mission  
Offer a fully immersive experience by using top of the line Virtual Reality and gaming equipment for a memorable, exhilarating, heart pounding video game experience.






Location

In the heart of vibrant Fort Collins, CO  you will find a cool place to meet up with your friends to try the latest technological developments in VR. Choose your preference of either Xbox One or PlayStation 4. Too exhausted running on the virtual treadmill? No problem. Kick your feet up and relax on a comfy couch while you continue playing on one of many lounge stations equipped with all the goods. 



Equipment





 Overall Budget




Total of $50,000 to start this awesome local business. The bulk of the funds would be for purchasing the necessary equipment for making Omniverse a legit place to chill and play games.

 Real estate is for leasing property space in Fort Collins.  

Game Consoles/Games pretty much speaks for itself, the VR equipment would be practically worthless without the content by Xbox and Playstion, so providing that quality content is a necessity.

 Interior is very important. This really brings the whole arcade lounge atmosphere to life. My plans are to make it a very dim lit environment to enhance the focus to the gaming experience.

This really is a huge passion of mine. I'm a total gamer nerd at heart so I plan to open this business regardless of what happens here, but any support is extremely appreciated to help make my dream of opening this place a reality.

Thanks for viewing
