story:
STORY DRIVEN OPEN WORLD
ACTION-ADVENTURE

The world is ruled by a secret society called the Illuminati. For a long time they have been working on a global master plan to decimate the human population with the goal to create something they called "a new balance". Their latest project involves the mass production of antimatter in secret underground laboratories, which is used to create weapons of mass destruction.

You will step into the role of Alex, who's task is to prevent the production of antimatter by sabotaging the facilities and extract the source material: gold. Because these secret underground facilities are hidden from the outside world, you'll have to find them first. As they are spread all over the world, some locations like the Crimea (Black Sea) and Sinai (Egypt) are pretty challenging to visit.

While you're making your journey through areas that can be hostile or closed off, you'll need to make certain decisions about using violence to complete the quests. As in real life, aggression is noted and the area with its people (NPCs), will respond to that accordingly. As Alex, you'll not be be able to solely shoot your way through, stealth or diplomacy and problem-solving without violence are also crucial to finish the mission.

The organization that is sending you off to these far locations will back you up financially and technically, but demand certain things in return. At some point you will wonder if all the things that you do are as noble as one thought they would be.


FEATURES & MECHANICS

» OPEN WORLD

There's really not that much strict linearity found in DeadlyMatter, you'll be able to roam free within the boundaries of the map. The given quests will bring you to various locations, but often you'll decide how and when to get there. All buildings and structures can be explored, though some areas might be sealed until certain quests are completed.

» REAL WORLD LOCATIONS

We are very keen on replicating real world locations in DeadlyMatter as accurate as possible. It's very likely that if you enter a certain building in DeadlyMatter you'll be able to trace it back in virtual globe/map application like Google Earth or in real life. Our first map release will be a representation of 16km² of the Crimean Peninsula at the Black Sea, including; mountainous terrain, vast grasslands, forests, small to medium sized towns, industrial areas, highways and a sea port.

» THIRD & FIRST PERSON

DeadlyMatter can be played in third-person and first-person, with a mouse & keyboard or a controller.

» HEALTH SYSTEM

Control not only health & stamina, but also blood level, blood sugar level, hydration, stomach content, oxygen saturation and endurance. Only eating & drinking to stay alive is not enough, you'll also need to take care of what you're eating and drinking; food & drinks contain water, carbs, proteins and vitamins. A balanced diet results in a healthier and fitter avatar and certain food will help to heal injuries faster.

» VEHICLES

Vehicles play an important role in DeadlyMatter. Avoiding walking long distances is one thing, but you're also able to move things from one place to another (as a movable stash). For now the only maintenance a car needs is fuel, but this may be further developed when the demand is there. Driving a vehicle can be done with keyboard, mouse & keyboard or a controller.

» WEAPONS

You'll find and use all kinds of weapons in DeadlyMatter. Not only firearms and melee weapons, but also poison or hand crafted explosion devices. Simple weapon customization will be available and can only be done at certain locations on the map.

» NPC INTERACTION

Interacting with NPCs by using the RPG-style dialogue system is an important part of the game play in DeadlyMatter.

» CRAFTING

A simple crafting system will be implemented and vary from creating poisonous food to hand-crafted explosion devices.

» BUYING OR LOOTING

You can loot buildings for food and weapons, but expect habitants defending their property. Or you can buy your necessities, and avoid getting shot at or be wanted by police.

» INVENTORY SYSTEM

A simple inventory system keeps your stuff at hand, though don't expect to be able to put a whole arsenal in your backpack. The use of stashes around the map or vehicles can overcome the limitations of the size of your carried inventory.

» ENGINE

We have been developing our own custom engine (Momentum), which is originally based on the open source game engine Torque 3D. As we have full control over the source does it serve DeadlyMatter well enough, but on the other hand takes it huge efforts to keep it updated with present-day standards and technologies. If we manage to get enough budget then we will make an attempt to migrate DeadlyMatter to a different game engine. This will greatly improve performance as well render quality, but also create support for multiple platforms.

MULTIPLAYER OPEN WORLD SHOOTER

Be a lone wolf or create and join factions on maps that represent real world locations. Take up arms, or be stealthy and sneaky in order to win the missions.

The main quests of the multiplayer missions mostly involve antimatter. This material is extremely explosive and will wipe out the whole map if it detonates due to shocking or damaging the antimatter containers (traps). So one needs to be careful when handling a weapon or explosive near, or driving a truck loaded with these containers, because everybody loses when it all goes wrong.

Beside main quests will there be side quests that may unlock weapons or vehicles within the mission when achieved. It's not mandatory to take up any quest; you can explore and stay alive in an open world with or without joining or battling against other players.

This part will only developed with more then 50% funding!

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

For some time we have been developing DeadlyMatter without any budget. We are extremely enthusiastic in what we do and have the drive to make it the finished and independently developed game even without the money! Though the lack of any budget forces us to take jobs and projects that provide us the monthly income to make a living; this keeps on delaying the development of DeadlyMatter. Further does the lack of budget have consequences for the quality of the game, as we would like to hire the people that are specialized in certain fields of profession this game needs.

 

Your direct support is needed to:

  • expand our team and get more things done
  • get us to work on the game full-time
  • speed up the development
  • migrate to a different game engine
  • release DeadlyMatter to Windows PC and Linux PC (Mac OS and Xbox are stretched goals)
  • add VR support
  • add multiplayer map(s) and set up servers
  • get proper first person characters modeled & rigged
  • replace and extend animations
  • replace and add more vehicles
  • polish up the graphics and improve quality
  • develop AI and add more NPCs
  • hire a freelance writer and voice actors
  • improve and extend the inventory system
  • get it on Steam as early access
  • collect the rest of the additional budget with sales on Steam

 

WHY WOULD YOU FUND THIS GAME?

If you look closely you'll see there aren't that many games that are similar to DeadlyMatter. Especially as an indie-game it will stand out with its unique combination of game mechanics. Surely there are AAA games out there that do share the same kind of concepts, but as an independent developer we will have certainly less restrictions in the art direction and storyline. Furthermore are we working with a small team and anyone who's interested or involved in DeadlyMatter will be able to directly contact us with questions, comments or requests.

From a player's point of view you might be interested getting your hands on another game that's somewhat in-line with Half-Life or S.T.A.L.K.E.R.. DeadlyMatter will certainly give you a different experience, but it will contain similar elements; and we're absolutely convinced there aren't enough games that do nowadays! Hopefully you are to, then this is the game for you!

OUR STRECHED GOALS

Our $100.000 goal will be mainly used to get you play DeadlyMatter on Steam as quickly as possible. We really don't want to keep you waiting for years until it's all finished so we going to release is as an early access game. To get DeadlyMatter fully developed according our initial plans without making compromises and within a reasonable time scope; we would need more than that. We will focus on the here & now first and be realistic in what can be achieved. Indiegogo can be the opportunity for us to accelerate the development process, extend and improve the quality of the game. Every dollar on top the initial goal will speed up the development time, contribute to more features and better graphics.

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL?

We have chosen for flexible funding because this game is already pretty far in development and we have a working prototype. With less budget we will be able to eventually release the game, but the quality and its features will be different from what we are trying to achieve. All the perks will be delivered regardless the outcome of this campaign. DeadlyMatter will then most likely not be migrated to a different game engine (with less then 100k funding). Further would it reduce the chance of of being released to Steam; the game will then be distributed as single player for Windows PC only.

REFUND

If the amount of funding turns out much too low and/or the team won't be able to finish this project properly before the delivery date, then we will offer a refund to all the backers. Note that physical perks like t-shirts, stickers etc. aren't included and the amount may differ.

 

DEVELOPMENT PLAN

» 2015 AND STEAM GREENLIGHT

DeadlyMatter has been Greenlit on Steam last year in 12 days, on #8 with 74% yes votes.

2015 was also a year that some amount of games that were released as early access and didn't meet up with the expectations of players. We raised our standards and went on further developing the game, but also further developing the game engine; with the goal to get a decent working product. Bug fixing and optimization are high priority but also truly demand a lot of time and effort.

The reality of indie game development: Due to circumstances were we unable to work full-time on this project. We had to take on jobs and unrelated projects to make a living for our selves. Despite our immense devotion is it impossible to realize this project fully, while working part-time, within a reasonable scope and without any budget.

» ROADMAP 2016-2018

The estimation of the time of delivery of any game is pretty tricky when working with a small team. If we're going to reach stretched goals with our campaign, then things will be done faster because we would be able to expand our team. But when we need to say goodbye to team members and/or we don't have enough budget; the development may be delayed. Therefore are the dates in the road-map below a rough estimation.

SO HOW WILL THIS MONEY BE USED?

We truly wished that 100% of the funding would go into development. But this is not the case as you can see in the diagram below:

This is a rough estimation! It's a daunting task to predict how much tax we paid after a year; so is the prediction of the production costs of the perks. The main goal for this campaign is to get you to play DeadlyMatter as quickly as possible; therefore all the funding that goes into "Development" will serve this goal.

 

WHO IS WE?

I am Nils Eikeleboom, the father of this game and the founder of Studio DimSum. As long as I can remember I'm into to game design; starting off with board games since when I was able to draw; and stepped over to the digital realm when I got my hands on my first computer: a Commodore 64. After the introduction of the PC I was completely hooked and the plans to build games never left my head ever since. I'm born & raised in the Netherlands but I'm living in Shanghai (China) for almost 7 years now. I studied graphic design at the academy of art and ended my career as art director before I started my private company and left my fatherland in 2009.

The idea for DeadlyMatter originated in 2012 but it started to get shape after 2 years of preparation (including development the storyline). I wanted to synthesize my passions for open world & adventure games, science & fiction and ancient events & places into one big world with a storyline, that not only will amaze you once you're in it, but also triggers you to be the researcher & explorer like I am. It's my ultimate drive to create hermetic world and capture you in it for a moment in time, giving you an experience to remember without locking you up or holding you down. Here is where my passion for game development will shine and here is where my adverse for linearity will show. I'll will always make an attempt to not only give you the freedom to roam within what's possible to build, but also try to give you the control over time as well (whenever it's feasible).

Except for the serious coding part and animations, are the most¹ things you see & hear in DeadlyMatter coming from my head, hands and mouth. As a control freak and disciplined workaholic I'll have a hand in everything regarding this project, but also have true respect for professionals that do their things better then me.


[Shanghai by night]

I'm gladly working together with other professionals, and I'm very grateful we're building this together. The size of the team varies from time to time, but it always remained to be small and dynamic. As team members & partners come and go, I'll stay on this "ship" under any circumstance. If it happens to sink, then I'll go under with it, no question about it. To make this project a success we need devoted team members, but we also need you!!!

Holding up my hand was never my thing. I believe in hard work and earning the things in life without taking advantage of anyone. The development of the game has taken so long up till no, because of that belief; and I worked on projects that were not related to gaming, just to keep the business going. A crowd funding campaign like this only crossed my mind, because it's essential now in order to complete the game with its initial concept.

I believe in a fair & sustainable business without exploiting or harm anyone or the environment. I refuse to do business with parties that are involved in gambling or illegal activities, exploit people or the environment, or conduct their biz in a unsustainable way. In DeadlyMatter I'll let you take up against the Illuminati; this is also how I stand in my personal "real" life.

Nils Eikelenboom
Founder of Studio DimSum

¹ : If there's not enough knowledge or takes simply too much time, we will acquire 3rd party code & assets, but those will never enter the game without giving it a personal touch and ensuring maximum quality possible.

 

PERKS

» THE GAME

The digital copy, the flash-drive version and the boxed version will be released as early access and will require an internet connection top receive updates & upgrades in the feature. If we don't reach the goal of this campaign then DeadlyMatter will be only released for Windows PC. If you do not own a Windows PC but want to get the game as a perk, then please keep in mind there's a change you'll not be able to play it. When we don't meet our goal but there's a reasonable budget we will release the game for Linux PC and Mac OS as well. With enough budget to work with, we will aim to release on Xbox, beside Windows PC and Linux PC and Mac OS.

Estimated Windows PC system requirements:

MINIMUM

· OS: Windows 7 (SP1)
· Processor: Intel® Core™ i5 or AMD Phenom II X4 with at least 2,5 GHz
· Memory: 4 GB RAM
· Graphics: GeForce 460 / Radeon HD 5850
· DirectX: Version 11
· Network: Broadband Internet connection
· Storage: 5 GB available space

RECOMMENDED

· OS: Windows 7 (SP1), Windows 10
· Processor: Intel® Core™ i7 or AMD Phenom II X6 with at least 3,5 GHz
· Memory: 8 GB RAM
· Graphics: GeForce 660 / Radeon HD 6970
· DirectX: Version 11
· Network: Broadband Internet connection
· Storage: 10 GB available space

These specs aren't fixed and may change in the future.

 

» T-SHIRTS

T-shirt “Deadly Yellow”
100% cotton with color print
available sizes: S / M / L / XL

T-shirt “Deadly Brown”
100% cotton with color print
available sizes: S / M / L / XL

T-shirt “Dark Matter”
100% cotton with color print
available sizes: S / M / L / XL

Note: The final design & colors may look or appear different

 

» IN-GAME BILLBOARD

Lease your own in-game billboard for your brand, company, group (such as a band etc.) or as a individual. Each map will contain 100 billboards and the ads are displayed randomly each time a new day starts. To make sure the style is in-line with the game, will the ads be designed by a professional graphic designer with years of experience in marketing communications. We will make sure your brand or corporate identity is implemented accordingly and offer 3 different design proposals to choose from. The duration of the lease contract will be 365 days, starting from the 1st day of appearance in the official beta release of DeadlyMatter.

Read & understand this before getting this perk: We will not add advertising for criminal, political, religious, unethical or highly unsustainable organizations or individuals. We will certainly not advertise for companies or people that are involved in gambling, controlled substances, abuse of people and animals, pollution, suppression or any other unethical activities. This page is not the place for all the legal and other details, so please contact us for further information before getting this perk now. We will conduct a screening when we think it's necessary. Refunds after refusal by us are only paid within 30 days after the campaign ends, and the amount will be reduced with the costs of Indiegogo and money transfers.

 

» ANTIMATTER TRAP (CONTAINER)

A antimatter trap is a container designed to hold antimatter material within a force field. For DeadlyMatter we developed a portable trap to make it able to transport antimatter (in the game!). It’s made from robust metal, glass, ceramic and polymer material components and it holds a battery as a power backup. It’s one of the icons from the game, so for our dearest backer are we going to have one made as an awesome wannahave.

AMT Mark I : A real sized antimatter trap

A 1:1 model of the antimatter trap made from metal, glass, ceramic and polymeric materials. It contains a glowing light source that runs on a rechargeable battery (power cable included). A shock warning system will be installed to give an audio signal when the container receives sudden shocks or when the power cable gets disconnected. The trap comes with a wooden crate, suitable for shipping, a quick reference guide and a user manual.

Please contact us for more details!

WARNING: These traps are not tested with antimatter material. Do not use these containers to store any antimatter, nor bring it in contact with. You’re strongly advised only to use these objects for decoration / show-off purposes only. We cannot be held responsible for any catastrophe, disaster or damage caused directly or indirectly by these objects and/or its content whatsoever.

 

RISKS

Understand that the development of a video game is a risky business. We have managed to keep on developing without any budget for some time now, but we cannot look into the future. As with any business are there numerous factors that can have a big influence on the development and/or delivery time, as well can lead (for example) bankruptcy, sickness or death to termination of this project.

A video game is software and may contain bugs or cause issues on specific operating systems and/or with specific hardware. It's not 100% guaranteed that DeadlyMatter can/will run on your computer or console.

Further understand that the delivery of rewards or perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed.

 

CONNECT

There are many ways to connect with us (A-Z)

  • Facebook
  • Forums
  • Google+
  • IndieDB
  • Instagram
  • LinkedIn
  • Pinterest
  • Soundcloud
  • Steam Page
  • Steam Group
  • Twitter
  • YouTube
  • Website
story_txt:
STORY DRIVEN OPEN WORLD 
  ACTION-ADVENTURE

The world is ruled by a secret society called the Illuminati. For a long time they have been working on a global master plan to decimate the human population with the goal to create something they called "a new balance". Their latest project involves the mass production of antimatter in secret underground laboratories, which is used to create weapons of mass destruction.
You will step into the role of Alex, who's task is to prevent the production of antimatter by sabotaging the facilities and extract the source material: gold. Because these secret underground facilities are hidden from the outside world, you'll have to find them first. As they are spread all over the world, some locations like the Crimea (Black Sea) and Sinai (Egypt) are pretty challenging to visit.
While you're making your journey through areas that can be hostile or closed off, you'll need to make certain decisions about using violence to complete the quests. As in real life, aggression is noted and the area with its people (NPCs), will respond to that accordingly. As Alex, you'll not be be able to solely shoot your way through, stealth or diplomacy and problem-solving without violence are also crucial to finish the mission.
The organization that is sending you off to these far locations will back you up financially and technically, but demand certain things in return. At some point you will wonder if all the things that you do are as noble as one thought they would be.


FEATURES & MECHANICS

» OPEN WORLD
There's really not that much strict linearity found in DeadlyMatter, you'll be able to roam free within the boundaries of the map. The given quests will bring you to various locations, but often you'll decide how and when to get there. All buildings and structures can be explored, though some areas might be sealed until certain quests are completed.

» REAL WORLD LOCATIONS
We are very keen on replicating real world locations in DeadlyMatter as accurate as possible. It's very likely that if you enter a certain building in DeadlyMatter you'll be able to trace it back in virtual globe/map application like Google Earth or in real life. Our first map release will be a representation of 16km² of the Crimean Peninsula at the Black Sea, including; mountainous terrain, vast grasslands, forests, small to medium sized towns, industrial areas, highways and a sea port.

» THIRD & FIRST PERSON
DeadlyMatter can be played in third-person and first-person, with a mouse & keyboard or a controller.
» HEALTH SYSTEM
Control not only health & stamina, but also blood level, blood sugar level, hydration, stomach content, oxygen saturation and endurance. Only eating & drinking to stay alive is not enough, you'll also need to take care of what you're eating and drinking; food & drinks contain water, carbs, proteins and vitamins. A balanced diet results in a healthier and fitter avatar and certain food will help to heal injuries faster.

» VEHICLES
Vehicles play an important role in DeadlyMatter. Avoiding walking long distances is one thing, but you're also able to move things from one place to another (as a movable stash). For now the only maintenance a car needs is fuel, but this may be further developed when the demand is there. Driving a vehicle can be done with keyboard, mouse & keyboard or a controller.

» WEAPONS
You'll find and use all kinds of weapons in DeadlyMatter. Not only firearms and melee weapons, but also poison or hand crafted explosion devices. Simple weapon customization will be available and can only be done at certain locations on the map.

» NPC INTERACTION
Interacting with NPCs by using the RPG-style dialogue system is an important part of the game play in DeadlyMatter.

» CRAFTING
A simple crafting system will be implemented and vary from creating poisonous food to hand-crafted explosion devices.
» BUYING OR LOOTING
You can loot buildings for food and weapons, but expect habitants defending their property. Or you can buy your necessities, and avoid getting shot at or be wanted by police.

» INVENTORY SYSTEM
A simple inventory system keeps your stuff at hand, though don't expect to be able to put a whole arsenal in your backpack. The use of stashes around the map or vehicles can overcome the limitations of the size of your carried inventory.
» ENGINE
We have been developing our own custom engine (Momentum), which is originally based on the open source game engine Torque 3D. As we have full control over the source does it serve DeadlyMatter well enough, but on the other hand takes it huge efforts to keep it updated with present-day standards and technologies. If we manage to get enough budget then we will make an attempt to migrate DeadlyMatter to a different game engine. This will greatly improve performance as well render quality, but also create support for multiple platforms. 
MULTIPLAYER OPEN WORLD SHOOTER
Be a lone wolf or create and join factions on maps that represent real world locations. Take up arms, or be stealthy and sneaky in order to win the missions.
The main quests of the multiplayer missions mostly involve antimatter. This material is extremely explosive and will wipe out the whole map if it detonates due to shocking or damaging the antimatter containers (traps). So one needs to be careful when handling a weapon or explosive near, or driving a truck loaded with these containers, because everybody loses when it all goes wrong.
Beside main quests will there be side quests that may unlock weapons or vehicles within the mission when achieved. It's not mandatory to take up any quest; you can explore and stay alive in an open world with or without joining or battling against other players.
This part will only developed with more then 50% funding!







 
WHY INDIEGOGO?
For some time we have been developing DeadlyMatter without any budget. We are extremely enthusiastic in what we do and have the drive to make it the finished and independently developed game even without the money! Though the lack of any budget forces us to take jobs and projects that provide us the monthly income to make a living; this keeps on delaying the development of DeadlyMatter. Further does the lack of budget have consequences for the quality of the game, as we would like to hire the people that are specialized in certain fields of profession this game needs.
  
Your direct support is needed to:

expand our team and get more things done
get us to work on the game full-time

speed up the development
migrate to a different game engine
release DeadlyMatter to Windows PC and Linux PC (Mac OS and Xbox are stretched goals)
add VR support

add multiplayer map(s) and set up servers
get proper first person characters modeled & rigged
replace and extend animations

replace and add more vehicles

polish up the graphics and improve quality

develop AI and add more NPCs
hire a freelance writer and voice actors

improve and extend the inventory system

get it on Steam as early access

collect the rest of the additional budget with sales on Steam


 

WHY WOULD YOU FUND THIS GAME?
If you look closely you'll see there aren't that many games that are similar to DeadlyMatter. Especially as an indie-game it will stand out with its unique combination of game mechanics. Surely there are AAA games out there that do share the same kind of concepts, but as an independent developer we will have certainly less restrictions in the art direction and storyline. Furthermore are we working with a small team and anyone who's interested or involved in DeadlyMatter will be able to directly contact us with questions, comments or requests.
From a player's point of view you might be interested getting your hands on another game that's somewhat in-line with Half-Life or S.T.A.L.K.E.R.. DeadlyMatter will certainly give you a different experience, but it will contain similar elements; and we're absolutely convinced there aren't enough games that do nowadays! Hopefully you are to, then this is the game for you!

OUR STRECHED GOALS
Our $100.000 goal will be mainly used to get you play DeadlyMatter on Steam as quickly as possible. We really don't want to keep you waiting for years until it's all finished so we going to release is as an early access game. To get DeadlyMatter fully developed according our initial plans without making compromises and within a reasonable time scope; we  would need more than that. We will focus on the here & now first and be realistic in what can be achieved. Indiegogo can be the opportunity for us to accelerate the development process, extend and improve the quality of the game. Every dollar on top the initial goal will speed up the development time, contribute to more features and better graphics.

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL?
We have chosen for flexible funding because this game is already pretty far in development and we have a working prototype. With less budget we will be able to eventually release the game, but the quality and its features will be different from what we are trying to achieve. All the perks will be delivered regardless the outcome of this campaign. DeadlyMatter will then most likely not be migrated to a different game engine (with less then 100k funding). Further would it reduce the chance of of being released to Steam; the game will then be distributed as single player for Windows PC only.
REFUND
If the amount of funding turns out much too low and/or the team won't be able to finish this project properly before the delivery date, then we will offer a refund to all the backers. Note that physical perks like t-shirts, stickers etc. aren't included and the amount may differ.








 
DEVELOPMENT PLAN
» 2015 AND STEAM GREENLIGHT
DeadlyMatter has been Greenlit on Steam last year in 12 days, on #8 with 74% yes votes.

2015 was also a year that some amount of games that were released as early access and didn't meet up with the expectations of players. We raised our standards and went on further developing the game, but also further developing the game engine; with the goal to get a decent working product. Bug fixing and optimization are high priority but also truly demand a lot of time and effort.
The reality of indie game development: Due to circumstances were we unable to work full-time on this project. We had to take on jobs and unrelated projects to make a living for our selves. Despite our immense devotion is it impossible to realize this project fully, while working part-time, within a reasonable scope and without any budget.
» ROADMAP 2016-2018
The estimation of the time of delivery of any game is pretty tricky when working with a small team. If we're going to reach stretched goals with our campaign, then things will be done faster because we would be able to expand our team. But when we need to say goodbye to team members and/or we don't have enough budget; the development may be delayed. Therefore are the dates in the road-map below a rough estimation.

SO HOW WILL THIS MONEY BE USED?
We truly wished that 100% of the funding would go into development. But this is not the case as you can see in the diagram below:

This is a rough estimation! It's a daunting task to predict how much tax we paid after a year; so is the prediction of the production costs of the perks. The main goal for this campaign is to get you to play DeadlyMatter as quickly as possible; therefore all the funding that goes into "Development" will serve this goal.






 
WHO IS WE?
I am Nils Eikeleboom, the father of this game and the founder of Studio DimSum. As long as I can remember I'm into to game design; starting off with board games since when I was able to draw; and stepped over to the digital realm when I got my hands on my first computer: a Commodore 64. After the introduction of the PC I was completely hooked and the plans to build games never left my head ever since. I'm born & raised in the Netherlands but I'm living in Shanghai (China) for almost 7 years now. I studied graphic design at the academy of art and ended my career as art director before I started my private company and left my fatherland in 2009.
The idea for DeadlyMatter originated in 2012 but it started to get shape after 2 years of preparation (including development the storyline). I wanted to synthesize my passions for open world & adventure games, science & fiction and ancient events & places into one big world with a storyline, that not only will amaze you once you're in it, but also triggers you to be the researcher & explorer like I am. It's my ultimate drive to create hermetic world and capture you in it for a moment in time, giving you an experience to remember without locking you up or holding you down. Here is where my passion for game development will shine and here is where my adverse for linearity will show. I'll will always make an attempt to not only give you the freedom to roam within what's possible to build, but also try to give you the control over time as well (whenever it's feasible).
Except for the serious coding part and animations, are the most¹ things you see & hear in DeadlyMatter coming from my head, hands and mouth. As a control freak and disciplined workaholic I'll have a hand in everything regarding this project, but also have true respect for professionals that do their things better then me.

[Shanghai by night]
I'm gladly working together with other professionals, and I'm very grateful we're building this together. The size of the team varies from time to time, but it always remained to be small and dynamic. As team members & partners come and go, I'll stay on this "ship" under any circumstance. If it happens to sink, then I'll go under with it, no question about it. To make this project a success we need devoted team members, but we also need you!!!
Holding up my hand was never my thing. I believe in hard work and earning the things in life without taking advantage of anyone. The development of the game has taken so long up till no, because of that belief; and I worked on projects that were not related to gaming, just to keep the business going. A crowd funding campaign like this only crossed my mind, because it's essential now in order to complete the game with its initial concept.
I believe in a fair & sustainable business without exploiting or harm anyone or the environment. I refuse to do business with parties that are involved in gambling or illegal activities, exploit people or the environment, or conduct their biz in a unsustainable way. In DeadlyMatter I'll let you take up against the Illuminati; this is also how I stand in my personal "real" life.
Nils Eikelenboom
  Founder of Studio DimSum

¹ : If there's not enough knowledge or takes simply too much time, we will acquire 3rd party code & assets, but those will never enter the game without giving it a personal touch and ensuring maximum quality possible.






 
PERKS
» THE GAME
The digital copy, the flash-drive version and the boxed version will be released as early access and will require an internet connection top receive updates & upgrades in the feature. If we don't reach the goal of this campaign then DeadlyMatter will be only released for Windows PC. If you do not own a Windows PC but want to get the game as a perk, then please keep in mind there's a change you'll not be able to play it. When we don't meet our goal but there's a reasonable budget we will release the game for Linux PC and Mac OS as well. With enough budget to work with, we will aim to release on Xbox, beside Windows PC and Linux PC and Mac OS.

story:
We started the Cargo Race project with the idea to make an interesting and fascinating game which nonetheless does not require players to spend the whole day and night on the computer or smartphone.

The game will have some paid options, affordable for most players, that help you in your progress. Regardless how many of them you use, in Cargo Race if you do not take the time to play you won’t be one of the top players.

We are not a big company with many years of experience in game development, but a small team which did a great load of work and, with your help, we hope to complete the Cargo Race project and make it an even better game - more interesting, popular in more countries and available to more people.

After a few months of hard work our first alpha version of the game has started. Currently the game is hosted on a small test server and it is already open for play. Here is what we have done so far:

  • a virtual assistant who helps you and teaches you how to play the game
  • you transport goods to and from more than 700 cities and villages in Europe and part of Asia
  • you build a garage for each vehicle
  • you buy and upgrade trucks and planes with different features
  • you transport more than 80 different goods, the price of each changes daily
  • you buy and upgrade factories that are part of a production chain (one factory produces wheat, another factory needs wheat to produce flour, the next factory needs flour to produce bread, etc.)
  • transporting goods you make a profit and go up the top players rank list

Cargo Race is not finished yet. In the near future we plan to add some new features - we are already working on some of them.

  • add new vehicles:
    •  trailers
    • locomotives and wagons
    • ships
    • helicopters
  • even greater variety of goods and factories
  • different features for each driver with options for upgrade
  • game quests and missions with prizes
  • charts and statistics to help you check and improve your play
  • paid options, needed for game maintenance

That is not all, we have a lot of other things in mind.

  • players to be able to build hotels, gas stations, service stations
  • players to be able to buy special vehicles: buses, auto transporters, concrete trucks and others
  • to have a world map with more cities
  • players to be able to construct public buildings as a team

Support us, we will use the funds raised to:

  • register a company and cover legal procedures in our country
  • hire a better server (cloud server) to run the game without interruptions
  • development and programming of game features
  • design and art work of game features
  • promotion and advertising
  • prizes for winners
  • gift shop and advertising articles (souvenirs, T-shirts, mugs, etc.)

You can support us in many other ways, we will be grateful if you:

  • share our campaign in Indiegogo: share now
  • like and share our facebook page: open facebook page now
  • play Cargo Race and report if you find bugs: play now

  • tell your friends about the game

story:
Space only becomes ordinary when the frontier is no longer being breached.

Neil deGrasse Tyson

Solux Interactive is an independent game developer company from Kyiv, Ukraine. The company first started in 2014 when two of us participated in Epic's (company which created Unreal Engine) GameJam contests and signed ourselves as 'Solux Interactive'. We created 5 non-commercial games but never distributed them as they generally required some effort to finish. In June 2017 Dmytro 'haarer0' Korniienko (founder and programmer) and Artem 'rutto' Korniienko (3D artist) decided to focus only on game development full time. Vlad 'amHvost' Zabela (game designer) then joined the team and brought with him some fresh ideas for future development.  We were also joined by a 2D artist (Vitalii 'Felix' Lukianenko), and another 3D artist (Oleg 'Linch' Kovalenko). Once we have relocated to an office, we decided to stream the whole development process on streaming platforms. Anastasia 'Siia' Didenko joined the team, as a community manager and director of our streaming channels on Twitch, Youtube, Periscope and LiveEdu.

 

After some discussion, the team decided to start working on one of our earlier GameJam prototypes - a game called 'Eternal Forest' (can be downloaded here, however please keep in mind this game was created only in 72 hours, so it contains a ton of bugs!). In this game the player controls an ethereal spirit, protecting the Elder Tree from evil creatures.

Inspired by the latest news about researching space and plans of colonization of Mars in the near future, we picked up sci-fi terraforming as a theme for the new game. We truly believe mankind may land and establish an extra-terrestrial colony soon and want to highlight this topic to people in any way we can. 

We had a lot of internal conversations trying to predict how terraforming might look. What should be done and which technologies would be used to achieve that? In our opinion, the terraforming should happen in a few waves -

  • exploration & reconnaissance,
  • probing,
  • initial part of terraforming process (which involves manned and unmanned robots operating in hostile environment)
  • a final phase, when humans can land on the ground and complete the process on the surface.

The word "Ecopoiesis" itself ( from the Greek οἶκος [oikos] - "house", and ποίησις [poiesis] - "production") was suggested by famous biophysicist Robert Haynes. He described this word as "a fabrication of a sustainable ecosystem on a currently lifeless, sterile planet" by making some primary engineering and biological processes in order to complete the initial part of terraforming. Our game focuses on this, 'Ecopoiesis' part. 

You can read more about the game below.


Campaign goals

We want to be completely transparent by explaining the campaign goals. This is all about money (as are all the other projects on IndieGoGo). Each month we need to pay a rent for our office, pay for internet, obtain required software, pay subscriptions for different SaaS products (such as Jira/Confluence, etc). None of us have other income and our initial funding is dwindling. This creates issues as we cannot complete development, invest in hardware or software or meet other financial commitments.

Helping us get to as little as US $10,000 (and more is better!) will enable us to survive, thrive and make a successful release of our first commercial game on Steam.

 


Reasons

As this game is the first commercial project by our combined team, we are faced with simple and quite obvious issues (now they are obvious). The main reason we have used up most of our initial funding was the developing process itself, which took more time as expected. This caused by a several reasons all of which we have learnt from:

  • Underestimating the time to complete complex modelling and programming tasks.
  • Driven by our desire to make the process more educable by streaming everything and setting it all up took away from the time we could devote to development which was further impacted by explaining the game creation.
  • Lengthy exploration and discussion on how to make things more ‘realistic’ from a science point of view but still gamified.

  • As we are not astrophysicists or even space engineers with a background to prove all our ideas, we are always open for further discussions of how to improve storytelling or in-game terraforming processes.


Risks

At this moment we have a playable beta version of the game with one planet and 5 finished levels and full gameplay. Later we will put it on Steam and send keys for closed beta to our backers (US $15+). Ecopoiesis will be released with one planet and 20 levels in mid-January. If we receive support from you we may implement more planets (with different gameplays) and more in-game mechanics. It also means we get to keep our development space and keep the team members together.

 

Work to do

As mentioned above, our main goal is to release the game on Steam with appropriate quality as soon as possible. In addition, and if you can help support us, we plan to:

  • Add controllers support
  • Add new mission types
  • Add better sound effects
  • Add more comics (for storytelling)
  • Get professional voicepacks for game and OST
  • Add new mission types
  • Add more planets and new missions (as DLCs)
  • Port game on mobiles, tablets*
  • Port game on XBox, PS4 and Nintendo Switch*

*Two last points depends on funds we may raise during this campaign and sales on Steam.

How you can help us

There are several ways of helping us:

  • Become a backer. Not only will we be very grateful, you will also receive bonuses, like special in-game skins, early (+ beta) and full accesses to the game, free DLCs and OST and more other things.
  • Tell your friends about this game and post a message in social networks about us. You can not imagine how good this type of help is!
  • Help us to improve 'sci-fi' (or just the 'sci') part of the game. If you have knowledge in astrophysics or biophysics - we always are open to suggestions on how to make this game more realistic :)
  • Follow us on Twitch and social networks

 

Gameplay

Ecopoiesis is a top-down sci-fi action where the player controls a drone which protects the reactor from aliens. The game goal is to terraform a planet by completing 20 missions on it. In most of the levels the player needs to protect the reactor and 'farms' (a separate landing module which also generates oxygen) from aliens. There are different types of aliens, some of them attack reactors and 'farms', others target the drone and special drop pods with upgrades.

 

Game entities

P-03 "Pytheas" drone is an unmanned robot, remotely controlled by an operator from an orbital station. This model was developed for exploration and maintenance tasks, however after encountering the first contact with aliens, engineers re-programmed its core to emit EMP waves which can destroy ferromagnetic forms of life (aliens).

 

Reactor is a landing module which generates energy required for creating and supporting an energy dome. It acts like a greenhouse, keeping oxygen and heat inside, running some chemical reactions to separate oxygen from the local atmosphere. After acquiring the required oxygen level, it turns into a passive mode, which only supports the dome (providing no further interest for aliens). Once this phase is over, people can land on the surface under the dome and proceed to terraforming phase 3 (establishing a colony).

 

TW-02 'Tekton' drones are unmanned worker robots whose task is to place landing beacons for farms that are going to land from a low orbit and maintain the reactor. Due to their low energy consumption and extreme durability, these bots have no value to aliens.

 

Farm is a module that lands on a placed landing beacon from the space. Farms are used to seed and plant a special kind of vegetation, genetically modified for running photosynthesis many times faster and more effectively than on Earth. After landing, farms begin to spread seeds and to light plants with photosynthetically active radiation (PAR).

 

Drop pods with tools are also low orbital modules with all the necessary elements and tools required for on-site upgrades and improvements of structures and other robots. Due to their medium energy generation and consumption, they can be targeted by some alien forms of life.

 

Aliens. Orbital and surface probes detected several magnetic anomalies  below the ground. We don't have enough information about these anomalies yet, except that they seem to be a non-intelligent, ferromagnetic species. Some probes were attacked by Ferrites (that's what our scientist call them), probably because of their energy reactors. We need to examine and find a way in which we can defend ourselves from these species.

More others game objects are coming soon, check our updates!

 


You can find more information on and contact us in different ways:

  • Solux Interactive site
  • Ecopoiesis site
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Discord
  • Send us an email
  • Twitch stream*
  • YouTube stream*

    
*We stream on Mon-Fri, 12pm-4pm GMT
story_txt:
Space only becomes ordinary when the frontier is no longer being breached.
Neil deGrasse Tyson
Solux Interactive is an independent game developer company from Kyiv, Ukraine. The company first started in 2014 when two of us participated in Epic's (company which created Unreal Engine) GameJam contests and signed ourselves as 'Solux Interactive'. We created 5 non-commercial games but never distributed them as they generally required some effort to finish. In June 2017 Dmytro 'haarer0' Korniienko (founder and programmer) and Artem 'rutto' Korniienko (3D artist) decided to focus only on game development full time. Vlad 'amHvost' Zabela (game designer) then joined the team and brought with him some fresh ideas for future development.  We were also joined by a 2D artist (Vitalii 'Felix' Lukianenko), and another 3D artist (Oleg 'Linch' Kovalenko). Once we have relocated to an office, we decided to stream the whole development process on streaming platforms. Anastasia 'Siia' Didenko joined the team, as a community manager and director of our streaming channels on Twitch, Youtube, Periscope and LiveEdu. After some discussion, the team decided to start working on one of our earlier GameJam prototypes - a game called 'Eternal Forest' (can be downloaded here, however please keep in mind this game was created only in 72 hours, so it contains a ton of bugs!). In this game the player controls an ethereal spirit, protecting the Elder Tree from evil creatures.Inspired by the latest news about researching space and plans of colonization of Mars in the near future, we picked up sci-fi terraforming as a theme for the new game. We truly believe mankind may land and establish an extra-terrestrial colony soon and want to highlight this topic to people in any way we can. We had a lot of internal conversations trying to predict how terraforming might look. What should be done and which technologies would be used to achieve that? In our opinion, the terraforming should happen in a few waves -
exploration & reconnaissance,
probing,
initial part of terraforming process (which involves manned and unmanned robots operating in hostile environment)
a final phase, when humans can land on the ground and complete the process on the surface.
The word "Ecopoiesis" itself ( from the Greek οἶκος [oikos] - "house", and ποίησις [poiesis] - "production") was suggested by famous biophysicist Robert Haynes. He described this word as "a fabrication of a sustainable ecosystem on a currently lifeless, sterile planet" by making some primary engineering and biological processes in order to complete the initial part of terraforming. Our game focuses on this, 'Ecopoiesis' part. You can read more about the game below.

Campaign goalsWe want to be completely transparent by explaining the campaign goals. This is all about money (as are all the other projects on IndieGoGo). Each month we need to pay a rent for our office, pay for internet, obtain required software, pay subscriptions for different SaaS products (such as Jira/Confluence, etc). None of us have other income and our initial funding is dwindling. This creates issues as we cannot complete development, invest in hardware or software or meet other financial commitments.Helping us get to as little as US $10,000 (and more is better!) will enable us to survive, thrive and make a successful release of our first commercial game on Steam. 
ReasonsAs this game is the first commercial project by our combined team, we are faced with simple and quite obvious issues (now they are obvious). The main reason we have used up most of our initial funding was the developing process itself, which took more time as expected. This caused by a several reasons all of which we have learnt from:
Underestimating the time to complete complex modelling and programming tasks.
Driven by our desire to make the process more educable by streaming everything and setting it all up took away from the time we could devote to development which was further impacted by explaining the game creation.
Lengthy exploration and discussion on how to make things more ‘realistic’ from a science point of view but still gamified.
As we are not astrophysicists or even space engineers with a background to prove all our ideas, we are always open for further discussions of how to improve storytelling or in-game terraforming processes.

RisksAt this moment we have a playable beta version of the game with one planet and 5 finished levels and full gameplay. Later we will put it on Steam and send keys for closed beta to our backers (US $15+). Ecopoiesis will be released with one planet and 20 levels in mid-January. If we receive support from you we may implement more planets (with different gameplays) and more in-game mechanics. It also means we get to keep our development space and keep the team members together. Work to doAs mentioned above, our main goal is to release the game on Steam with appropriate quality as soon as possible. In addition, and if you can help support us, we plan to:
Add controllers support
Add new mission types

Add better sound effects
Add more comics (for storytelling)
Get professional voicepacks for game and OST
Add new mission types
Add more planets and new missions (as DLCs)
Port game on mobiles, tablets*
Port game on XBox, PS4 and Nintendo Switch*
*Two last points depends on funds we may raise during this campaign and sales on Steam.How you can help usThere are several ways of helping us:
Become a backer. Not only will we be very grateful, you will also receive bonuses, like special in-game skins, early (+ beta) and full accesses to the game, free DLCs and OST and more other things.
Tell your friends about this game and post a message in social networks about us. You can not imagine how good this type of help is!
Help us to improve 'sci-fi' (or just the 'sci') part of the game. If you have knowledge in astrophysics or biophysics - we always are open to suggestions on how to make this game more realistic :)
Follow us on Twitch and social networks

In most of the levels the player needs to protect the reactor and 'farms' (a separate landing module which also generates oxygen) from aliens. There are different types of aliens, some of them attack reactors and 'farms', others target the drone and special drop pods with upgrades. Game entitiesP-03 "Pytheas" drone is an unmanned robot, remotely controlled by an operator from an orbital station. This model was developed for exploration and maintenance tasks, however after encountering the first contact with aliens, engineers re-programmed its core to emit EMP waves which can destroy ferromagnetic forms of life (aliens). Reactor is a landing module which generates energy required for creating and supporting an energy dome. Once this phase is over, people can land on the surface under the dome and proceed to terraforming phase 3 (establishing a colony). TW-02 'Tekton' drones are unmanned worker robots whose task is to place landing beacons for farms that are going to land from a low orbit and maintain the reactor. Farms are used to seed and plant a special kind of vegetation, genetically modified for running photosynthesis many times faster and more effectively than on Earth. After landing, farms begin to spread seeds and to light plants with photosynthetically active radiation (PAR). Drop pods with tools are also low orbital modules with all the necessary elements and tools required for on-site upgrades and improvements of structures and other robots. Due to their medium energy generation and consumption, they can be targeted by some alien forms of life. Aliens. Orbital and surface probes detected several magnetic anomalies  below the ground. We don't have enough information about these anomalies yet, except that they seem to be a non-intelligent, ferromagnetic species. We need to examine and find a way in which we can defend ourselves from these species.More others game objects are coming soon, check our updates!

story:
About Us & Our Project

We want communities to be able to easily interact with the planning system and put forward their opinions on what their city should become.

In January 2016 we won Innovate UK's Innovation in Urban Spaces contest, this allowed us to look into new ways of using mapping data to engage residents in the planning process. We use Minecraft as it is an easy to use 3D design tool that doesn't leave out some of the most important people within a community, young people. 

For the past year we have been designing a new platform that can take any data and create an accurate model of a city in Minecraft.

We have now started our first map using this platform, and it is of Brighton and Hove in East Sussex. We need your help to finish it. 

Once digital Brighton is complete we will make the map freely available for young people to play at home.

What We Need & What You Get

We are initially asking for £7,000 as that will fund us to bring the higher resolution data into Minecraft. This is our most basic ask and it enable us to release a digitally generated model of Brighton and Hove from geospatial data. We also have stretch goals should we reach beyond that.

If we hit £7,000 we will
- Purchase the data needed to complete the poor resolution areas of the map. 
- Complete the model, this means it will include all the newly purchased data so we have a fully accurate map. 
- Run workshops across July and August with participants collaboratively texturing areas of the map to make it look photorealistic. 

If we hit £10,000 we will 
- Do all of the above.
- Model 3 extra areas in photorealistic detail.

If we hit £20,000 we will
- Do all of the above.
- Model all key areas of Brighton and Hove in photorealistic detail (these areas can be found in the perks section).

If we hit £50,000 
- Do all of the above.
- Model all of BN1 in photorealistic detail.

If we hit £100,000
- Do all of the above.
- We will Model all of the Brighton and Hove map (BN1, BN2 and BN3).

Perks -

We have lots of wonderful perks on offer for anybody who wants to contribute! 

£3 - Thank you from us!

£5 - Postcard - Pick from these images:

Brighton Palace Pier (Day), The Pavilion, Brighton Palace Pier (Night), Amex Stadium (Inside), The West Pier, Cassette Lord, Amex Stadium (Outside), British Airways i360.

£20 - A2 Poster - pick from these images:

Brighton Minecraft Map, Brighton Palace Pier (Day), The Pavilion, Brighton Palace Pier (Night), Amex Stadium (Inside), The West Pier, Amex Stadium (Outside), British Airways i360.

£25 - Workshops! We will be running a ton of workshops where you can come along and help us texture the remaining parts of Brighton. Each workshop will have up to 15 participants working on the map together. We will be running 3 workshops on each of the days (10am to 12pm, 1pm to 3pm and 4pm to 6pm), your preferred time will be taken at the completion of the campaign. We don’t have an age limit, and we welcome kids who have never played Minecraft before. Each workshop will focus on a different part of Brighton:

Monday July 24th - Churchill Square Build

Tuesday July 25th - Lewes Road Build

Wednesday August 2nd - North Laines Build

Sunday August 6th - Queens Road Build (only 2 workshops)

Monday August 7th - London Road Build

Wednesday August 9th - Brighton Seafront Build

Thursday August 10th - Hove, George Street Build

All workshops will be taking place at:

The Place Maker Space
FIELD, Preston Barracks
Lewes Road
BN2 4GL 

You can also donate a space, so if you would like to contribute but not attend you can select a workshop and we will give any donated spaces away to local young people. 

£25 - Workshop Voucher! Unsure what date you want? Chose this perk! This will entitle you to a voucher for any of the workshops listed. If we sell out all workshops we will then add extra dates for voucher holders across July and August. 

£30 - Limited Edition Cassette Lord Print - A2 Poster. We have made one of Cassette Lords famous pieces into a Minecraft cassette. Each part of this print is made with Minecraft blocks! Only 20 available.

£50 - Your name in the map - Have your name on our special thank you wall within the Brighton map. We will be celebrating each of you by placing your name in our digital Place Maker Space within the Minecraft map so you can visit it anytime you wish!

£100 - 3D Print - A beautiful full-colour architectural print of a famous Brighton landmark. You can pick from these landmarks - The Pavilion, Palace Pier, the Amex stadium, British Airways i360, and the West Pier.

£250 - Sponsor a street - With this perk you can get your name in lights... well street lights. Chose this and you can pick a street in Brighton to have sponsored by you. There will be a sign at the beginning and end of a road with your name on it. 

£300 - One off Cassette Lord Piece - A piece created by Cassette Lord on our launch night and made then and there. Only 1 available. SOLD OUT

£2,000 - Build a part of Brighton - Fund us to build a photorealistic detailed version of a specific space within the Brighton and Hove Minecraft map. We have some of Brighton already looking perfect, and young people will be helping us build other spaces over the summer with our workshop perk. If there are other spaces you would like to be fully textured select this perk.

Seafront (from Palace Pier to The Marina), Seafront (from The West Pier to Hove Lagoon), The Marina, Brighton Station, West Street, The Laines, The Old Stein, The Royal Pavilion, Victoria Gardens, The Level, Lewes Road (from The Level to Sainsbury's), Lewes Road (from Sainsbury's to Stanmer Park), Stanmer Park, Queens Park, Preston Park, Seven Dials, Western Road (from Churchill Square to Palmeira Avenue), St. James's Street, Edward Street, Hove (George Street), Hove (Church Road from Palmeira Avenue to Tesco's). You can also select your own area if it is not listed. 

If you wish to contribute in another way please get in contact with us. We are always looking for more data to add to the map or anything else you would like to help us with! 

The Impact

We want to create an accurate Minecraft map of England, and we are starting with our home town of Brighton. With the funding from this campaign we will be able to launch this map in beautiful detail for anybody to use and interact with. Once the campaign is over we will be making the map available to play at home. This means that local children will be able to interact with their city in a brand new way! 

Since we set up in August 2014 we have been using digital technology as a way to engage the public in planning and the environment. We feel that Minecraft offers a unique opportunity to view an area in a new light, and to explore a new topic you may not have been interested in before. For us it is a valuable way of speaking to people who would not normally be consulted, and getting their opinions and feedback. We have worked with thousands of children and adults since we started, and we pride ourselves on creating a fun environment for people to discuss topics that can be contentious, and enabling them to collaboratively design solutions to issues. 

We are planning to do the same with this map, but on a larger scale. We will be able to run workshops in any area of Brighton using an accurate map for residents to engage with. We appreciate any support you can give us in creating the ultimate blocky version of Brighton!

Risks & Challenges

One big risk is that we do not get enough funding to be able to complete the map in its basic form. If we do not reach our £7,000 funding goal we will use the money we do raise as match funding to try and find other potential sources, such as grants. We will still run the workshops and send out the perks that have been purchased.

Another risk is fulfilling the rewards. To tackle this we have allowed plenty of time for all the items that need to be printed and shipped. In terms of workshops we are used to running these and don't see them as an issue.

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love any help with this campaign, and we would really appreciate it if you could share this page with as many people as possible. We want to spread the word and get everybody using our Brighton map! 

We are also looking for any data that you may have, such as Sketch Up models of buildings, any GIS data or BIM models. Or if there is another way you would like to help please just get in contact. We are not limited to Brighton either, as if we are successful we do want to continue mapping areas all across the country.

Thank you so much for taking the time to explore our campaign!

Links & Sponsors

Please do follow us on social media and help spread the word about our campaign.
We have: Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and our website.

Thank you to British Airways i360 and the team for sponsoring our launch event.
Find out more on their: Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and website.

In partnership with FIELD. 
Find out more on their: Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and website.

This project is possible thanks to the process we created through funding from Innovate UK.

story:
“Everybody in this country should learn to program a computer, because it teaches you how to think”  

-Steve Jobs

At this pace of technological change, 65% of children entering primary schools today will likely work in roles that don’t currently exist.

 -World Economic Forum

It is no secret that not only kids, even the grown ups of today need to possess basic programming skills. We, Card Board Learning have come up with "Robot Wars: A Coding Strategy Board Game" as our first design to teach coding to kids as well as adults. 

The Concept

   In the game, players will be commanding their robots using the cards given. The game starts with Instruction cards where we introduce basic commands in simple code. Slowly game moves to resource cards on which bigger code with generic syntax is written. Robots will be executing these codes sequentially just in the way computers execute programs. The cards are written in Java but readable as simple English.

   Anyone who can read and understand English can easily read and follow these codes, thus making it easy for kids and adults to learn programming. There are complicated code cards which will be used in strategy level, which are explained well in the rule book. 

The Story 

   C.E.L.E.B (Command Executing Laser Equipped Bot) was developed by S.A.I.L (Secret Artificial Intelligence Lab) for military for war purposes. As the name says he can execute his human partner's commands and shoot enemies with the laser from his chest. 

   As a part of S.A.I.L's training program to choose the Commanding Officers for the bots, players are being tested against their logic and strategy in the artificial war zone. As the robot moves on war zone it will collect important resource codes for it's partner which will help him strategize in the war. The player who reaches the middle of war zone first will be promoted as Commanding Officer. But you need to shoot at least one enemy robot before getting there. 

 

Components

  The game box contains

    - 1 Game board (AKA) War zone

    - A deck of Instruction Cards(codes)

    - A deck of Resource Cards

    - A deck of Shoot Cards

    - A rule book

    - 4 C.E.L.E.B game markers

 

How to play

   In the beginning of the game, Shoot Cards will be distributed equally to all the players. Each player starts from each corner of the board. First player starts the game by picking up the top card of Instructions deck and moves his C.E.L.E.B according to the command on his Instruction card. If he gets to move to a new grid on the board using this card, he can collect the top card of Resources deck and keep it with him for future use. Every player picks up an Instruction and moves to collect resources. When it's first players turn again he can choose between playing his resource or picking up a new instruction.

   As the game goes on, you will collect more resources to reach the destination and to kill enemies throughout the way. Once a robot is shot it will go back to its nearest starting point, indicated by its color. There are also Laser Proof Shields that can save your from enemies.

 

What are these codes?

   Each card in the game has a code written in Java programming language on it. 

Instructions:

   Instructions are the basic movements for robot. There are 6 types of instructions. These are few examples.

Resource Cards:

   Resources are where learning actually starts. These are the code snippets with interesting and strategic moves. there are 14 Types of resources, falling 5 different categories. These are few examples.

Shoot Cards:

There are two Types of Shoot Cards. Shoot forward let's you shoot the robots in-front of you. Using Turn and Shoot , you can turn in any direction and shoot.

 

Manufacturing Status:

   The components that you see in the Video and the images are taken from samples provide by manufacturers. Though the Robots in the video are made using 3D printing, we recently got the mould ready for injection moulding to produce robot game markers. Using that funds that through this campaign we will be able to give everything out for production in next 2-3 weeks. Meanwhile we will fine tune the artwork on all the components. 

 

When will you get your game? 

   According to our timelines that we set up, we should be able to ship 1st December. You will be receiving the packages by the end of first week of December. However, if we should face any delay in manufacturing processes, we assure you that we will be able to deliver the games with the best of quality by mid December, Just in time for Christmas so that you can gift it to your little ones and enjoy the game during holidays.

 

How you can help us:

   If you love the idea and how we shaped it, please go through perks and choose the one of your choice.

   Even if this project is not your thing right now, you can support us by spreading the word and sharing the campaign from the Social Media options beside the video.

   Also, you can follow us on facebook and twitter.

   If need to contact us, we are available at cardboardlearning@gamil.com. You can ping us on facebook or fill web form on our website cardboardlearning.in.

 

Risks & Challenges:

   As we have mentioned, we already discussed with our manufactures and took samples of each component. We have discussed with our shipping partners too. So at present we do not foresee any risks except for the delay in manufacturing, which is also mostly taken care of. 

   Irrespective of how the campaign performs, we should be able to take care of all the orders and deliver them in December.

 

About Card Board Learning:

   We are a team of three, a designer, a developer and an illustrator with an idea of introducing important life and academic skills through tabletop games. With your support and the experience we had in building educational games and apps we wish to work on more interesting project in the coming years.

story:
I'm Yavuz Eren, a senior computer scientist, co-founder of Mystic Ram Studios and the parent of a four year old with an endless supply of questions. 

Even as someone working at the cutting edge of digital technology, I'm still amazed at how powerful mobile devices have become. But I'm also disappointed that most popular mobile games seem to push children into passive roles and do not help their social development.

Two years ago I started a research project in order to find out if mobile games can be redefined such that they increase the amount and quality of face-to-face communication among children. After a lot of hard work my project team developed the 'Seaburbs' technology and built a cooking game based on this technology. After conducting scientific tests we were thrilled to discover that face-to-face communication among children playing the Seaburbs game increased six-fold, from 13% all the way up to 80%! 

 

 

Although there are many facets to our work, the following are some of the core elements that resulted in the dramatic increase in communication among children:

1. Our technology makes it easy to create mobile games that children can play in the same room. This is achieved by turning the mobile devices into virtual tools in the gaming context (i.e. cutting board or pot for cooking, musical instrument for the band game etc.).

 

2. Seaburbs has a component created specifically to increase discussion among children for things such as negotiating the sharing of resources, changing the game rules, cooperatively creating game content and more.

 

3. Puzzles and gameplay elements are distributed across multiple devices for cooperative gaming.

 

4. The timing and tempo of the games have been designed to increase communication and reflection.

 

For more details you may watch the following update videos from the Seaburbs channel:

Games of Seaburbs

 

But, why is it called Seaburbs?

 

At this point we have completed the following phases of the Seaburbs Mobile Game:

 

Using our funds we will make Seaburbs the complete package by completing games in:

Engineering / Coding, Visual Arts and Music

 

 

Game development is entering an awesome new phase where the community is an integral part of the development process. We would like you to join our development cycle to increase the fun and benefits of the Seaburbs. We will do our part by providing frequent updates and communicating with you at every step.

 

 

 

My generation grew up at a time where playing games included observing other children (usually for some form of mischief), inventing games out of boredom, learning difficult social concepts such as trust and embarrasing yourself by blurting out stupid things. I can confidently say that many of our social skills were actually learned at playgrounds.

This is not really the case for the new generation and unfortunately studies show that empathy and social skills are declining. There are probably a number of reasons behind this decline but technology surely plays a great role.

As parents we can either wait and hope for the best or act now to ensure that technology actually plays a positive role in the social development of our children.

story:
Cost Breakdown

  • (Photon Networking was ripped from the project due to lack of funds, I will use free P2P networking instead)
  • Google Ads + Facebook/Instagram Ads: $50 per campaign ($25 + $25)
  • Website domain + hosting: $8 monthly w/ Amazon Lightsail + $15 annually for domain

 

The Game

Okay so, you join your friends on a deserted island, in the middle of nowhere. You can't escape. It's survival of The Fittest. To make matters worse, one of your "friends" is trying to murder everyone on the island in cold blood. Whoever manages to find a weapon first begins to go insane and becomes the Fittest. As a Survivor, you must either vote the Fittest off the island, build a boat to escape the island, or become the Fittest and kill everybody. As the killer (aka the Fittest) you need to either kill everybody, or stay the Fittest by the time the match ends. The game will feature various roles, for example you can play as a Lumberjack to harvest wood (Wood is useful for various things, such as building a campfire in order to hold meetings), or if you want to communicate with dead players (Ghosts!!) you can play as a Medium.

My Story

I began my game development journey in 2018, learned the basics and proceeded to fully develop and publish two mobile games on both the App Store and Play Store. Now, as an individual with much more experience than I had two years ago, I'd like to take my journey a step further. The plan is simple: Conceive and create a fun, memorable PC game that has the potential to provide players with outstanding experiences.

The Obstacle

I have the skill required to finish this game. I have all the time in the world. The only thing I'm missing is money. I'm age 18 and still living with my parents. No job yet. Don't get me wrong, I'm incredibly fortunate to have a roof over my head, a shirt on my back and warm meals. However, without money, I won't be able to pay for some things essential to developing my game, such as servers for players to play on and paid software to assist in the development of the project.

TL;DR

I'm making an online party game, and need funding in order to fulfill my vision for said game. Thanks for reading.

 

Trello: https://trello.com/b/IT1tXpdn/the-fittest
