story:
Would love for mankind persist without mankind itself?

 

The story takes place at The Edge of Time, the frontier of existence, where there are no civilizations left. The ocean of space is fractured, yet sometimes memories of different living beings gone long ago materialize themselves. One of such formations is The Land of Man.

 

You play as an Edge Walker  - a divine being, drawn to appearance of material objects with a want to know what makes these remnants stand the test of time and still leave their mark in the universe aeons later.

You will walk across different locations representing different human cultures and mythologies that cherished the search for truth in different, yet somehow shared ways. You will observe how different religions and people of various cultures sought the answers to their questions on existence, and find your own answers to some of them - not as a character, but as a player. 

The game is planned for release on Steam with English and Russian languages later in 2019. Approximate average length of the game - 3 hours.

The game features minimalistic gameplay focused on exploration and visual storytelling, following the tropes of genre-defining Dear Esther. Your aim as an Edge Walker is to travel through different locations, observing both the fall and the ascension of people of different beliefs. You will go through places marked with strong emotional footprint: places of war, joy, grief and worship that still resonate through the universe.

Material objects as well as spiritual flows and their manifestaions will guide you through the journey of mankind, while short stories will provide you with additional perspectives, forming your own view on mankind and the world around them. By seeing, hearing and touching the souls striving for something higher you will find your own place amongst them and understand what it meant to be a human.

In-game book of short stories - the game features fully animated book with hand-drawn art. Depending on your location in game as you're carrying it, it presents you with a single or multiple short stories that help paint the picture around you and follow the tales of people that shaped this land. While it enriches the experience, the game's narrative can be followed without reading it, if it's the way you are searching for your answers.

Voice narration -  your journey is narrated by voice that provides additional insight to the stories as well as reacts to your surroundings if you happen to stumble upon peculiar places. 

VR support - VR-version of the game for better immersion is being developed simultaneously with desktop version. If you have VR headset you are able to choose your way of experiencing the story - both versions come in one package.

The art in the game is being drawn on paper by hand and transffered on the pages of the book to better fit the style. Here you can see some of the art, done by our passionate artist:

Nikita Kalashnikov - junior game designer focused on narrative design. Worked on video games, tabletop games and live role-playing games. Recieved medical education and after working as a surgeon for couple of years, he decided to leave and turn the unending passion for games into profession. His other affection are books, so he tries to combine these two types of entertainment. Slowly walking on spiritual path and combining many religions and philosophies, his goal in this project is to share the experience and, hopefully, provide a platform for conversation.

Valery Vagin - military man and a firefighter in the past, now he's just a man that explores edges of the world. Not so long ago he met a friend, who offered to try his hand in this project. He's ready to hear any critique of his craft, and thinks that this project is a great opportunity to know his strengths and to come forward with his craft.

Unfortunately, we don't have set musician at the moment, so I can't provide you with the information about the music. We do have people interested in working for the project, and as soon as we have a dedicated soundperson who will work on music and sound design I will update the page with the respective information. I would love to include soundtrack in the package available, but as for now, I can't talk about specifics.

The most important thing that this platform helps me to achieve is communication with potential audience. The game's idea can be a very niche one and I would love to have an ability to listen to the feedback and optimize the experience for people interested in this type of game. This won't jeopardize the creative vision, but will definetly benefit the project.

Also, even with the small scope of the game, it still needs the funds to achieve it. It is my project of passion and I am fortunate to work with people who help me pro bono for now, but there's no doubt that they need to be commended for their great work. I invest heavily in this project with my own scarce savings to pay for artists' work, assets and other production costs, and while the game will be made no matter what, it would be a dream come true to gather enough resources to ensure the best quality of the project.

Being transparent about the work is important for the team and the audience, so this is how requested funds are going to be distributed:

1500$ serve as payment for the work of developer, artist and musician for the next 3 to 4 months of development planned, each getting a third of the sum. This is the basic funding we can ask for, the main priority is to raise the quality of the game an not to make this platform a source of salary for the duration.

500$ are dedicated to get the help of a 3d-modeler to work on specific assets for the game. This would give an opportunity to direct the exact vision of the team.

500$ are dedicated to the Asset Fund. This would provide a funding to purchase appropriate assets, plugins, visual effects and software needed for the development.

500$ are dedicated to studio voice-recording and small-scale promotion. This will help to raise the bar of the game's quality as well as raise some awareness for the project during fundraising and before imminent release.

500$ are dedicated to Indiegogo supporters. This includes production of physical merchandise.

I believe this amount covers the basics of the development while being objective about the scope of the game. If the desired amount is not met, then the funds will be split between the people working on the game to cover their work, as well as the purchase of the required assets. 

The development definetly won't be a smooth ride, but I'm focused on delivering the project as promised, so every obstacle need to be dealt with. Most of the difficulties will probably come from the technical side of the project: coding or performance issues.  If such challenge arrives I will spend time to resolve it myself, but if this will prove to be beyond my capabilities I will find the according specialist to resolve the issue. This can require additional expenses, but a part of the required funds is dedicated to such scenarios. Otherwise, these funds will go towards creative part of the game.

- Write your own Dedication that will appear at the start of the in-game book in your copy of the game. Dedicate the tales to something or someone you want! (backers only)
- Write a special message that we will include in the credits of the game! Share with the world the good things you've done so we could continue the tale of the greater deeds even in credits! (backers only)

- Recieve 2 postcards with an exclusive art and a unique personal message from the developer, signed by the team.

- Get a T-Shirt as one who shares the vision of the team! Join us on the path to knowledge.

- Join the creative proccess of the game! We will contact you and ask of you to write a text that will be part of the game. It might be a note, a letter or some document, that will complement the game's narrative - we just give a little background for it and let your imagination do the work!

All physical rewards will be delivered later this summer, and I will inform everyone eligible for the rewards with more detailed information.

Q: What are targeted platforms for the release?

A: For now we are aimed to release the game on Steam as we are sure in being able to provide everything as promised. We would be happy to release on other platforms and devices, but that's something that we will work on post-release.

Q: What you mean by the game being short?

A: The game is made to be played in 1 or 2 sittings, so exploring all locations and reading the short stories will result 4 to 5 hour experience.

Q: What language will the game have?

A: The game will be released with English and Russian text and voice-over. There are no plans for another languages at the moment, but if the opportunity arises, and we will have funds to do it, we will consider the localization.

If you're find yourself not interested in the game, please consider to share the campaign with someone you know who might be interested.

 

If you have any other questions, feedback or just want to get in touch, please write at kalashnikovndesign@gmail.com.
story_txt:
Would love for mankind persist without mankind itself?
 
The story takes place at The Edge of Time, the frontier of existence, where there are no civilizations left. The ocean of space is fractured, yet sometimes memories of different living beings gone long ago materialize themselves. One of such formations is The Land of Man.
 
You play as an Edge Walker  - a divine being, drawn to appearance of material objects with a want to know what makes these remnants stand the test of time and still leave their mark in the universe aeons later.
You will walk across different locations representing different human cultures and mythologies that cherished the search for truth in different, yet somehow shared ways. You will observe how different religions and people of various cultures sought the answers to their questions on existence, and find your own answers to some of them - not as a character, but as a player. 
The game is planned for release on Steam with English and Russian languages later in 2019. Approximate average length of the game - 3 hours.

The game features minimalistic gameplay focused on exploration and visual storytelling, following the tropes of genre-defining Dear Esther. Your aim as an Edge Walker is to travel through different locations, observing both the fall and the ascension of people of different beliefs. You will go through places marked with strong emotional footprint: places of war, joy, grief and worship that still resonate through the universe.
Material objects as well as spiritual flows and their manifestaions will guide you through the journey of mankind, while short stories will provide you with additional perspectives, forming your own view on mankind and the world around them. By seeing, hearing and touching the souls striving for something higher you will find your own place amongst them and understand what it meant to be a human.
 In-game book of short stories - the game features fully animated book with hand-drawn art. Depending on your location in game as you're carrying it, it presents you with a single or multiple short stories that help paint the picture around you and follow the tales of people that shaped this land. While it enriches the experience, the game's narrative can be followed without reading it, if it's the way you are searching for your answers.
Voice narration -  your journey is narrated by voice that provides additional insight to the stories as well as reacts to your surroundings if you happen to stumble upon peculiar places. 
VR support - VR-version of the game for better immersion is being developed simultaneously with desktop version. If you have VR headset you are able to choose your way of experiencing the story - both versions come in one package.

The art in the game is being drawn on paper by hand and transffered on the pages of the book to better fit the style. Here you can see some of the art, done by our passionate artist:




Nikita Kalashnikov - junior game designer focused on narrative design. Worked on video games, tabletop games and live role-playing games. Recieved medical education and after working as a surgeon for couple of years, he decided to leave and turn the unending passion for games into profession. His other affection are books, so he tries to combine these two types of entertainment. Slowly walking on spiritual path and combining many religions and philosophies, his goal in this project is to share the experience and, hopefully, provide a platform for conversation.
Valery Vagin - military man and a firefighter in the past, now he's just a man that explores edges of the world. Not so long ago he met a friend, who offered to try his hand in this project. He's ready to hear any critique of his craft, and thinks that this project is a great opportunity to know his strengths and to come forward with his craft.
Unfortunately, we don't have set musician at the moment, so I can't provide you with the information about the music. We do have people interested in working for the project, and as soon as we have a dedicated soundperson who will work on music and sound design I will update the page with the respective information. I would love to include soundtrack in the package available, but as for now, I can't talk about specifics.

The most important thing that this platform helps me to achieve is communication with potential audience. The game's idea can be a very niche one and I would love to have an ability to listen to the feedback and optimize the experience for people interested in this type of game. This won't jeopardize the creative vision, but will definetly benefit the project.
Also, even with the small scope of the game, it still needs the funds to achieve it. It is my project of passion and I am fortunate to work with people who help me pro bono for now, but there's no doubt that they need to be commended for their great work. I invest heavily in this project with my own scarce savings to pay for artists' work, assets and other production costs, and while the game will be made no matter what, it would be a dream come true to gather enough resources to ensure the best quality of the project.
Being transparent about the work is important for the team and the audience, so this is how requested funds are going to be distributed:
1500$ serve as payment for the work of developer, artist and musician for the next 3 to 4 months of development planned, each getting a third of the sum. This is the basic funding we can ask for, the main priority is to raise the quality of the game an not to make this platform a source of salary for the duration.
500$ are dedicated to get the help of a 3d-modeler to work on specific assets for the game. This would give an opportunity to direct the exact vision of the team.
500$ are dedicated to the Asset Fund. This would provide a funding to purchase appropriate assets, plugins, visual effects and software needed for the development.
500$ are dedicated to studio voice-recording and small-scale promotion. This will help to raise the bar of the game's quality as well as raise some awareness for the project during fundraising and before imminent release.
500$ are dedicated to Indiegogo supporters. This includes production of physical merchandise.
I believe this amount covers the basics of the development while being objective about the scope of the game. If the desired amount is not met, then the funds will be split between the people working on the game to cover their work, as well as the purchase of the required assets. 

The development definetly won't be a smooth ride, but I'm focused on delivering the project as promised, so every obstacle need to be dealt with. Most of the difficulties will probably come from the technical side of the project: coding or performance issues.  If such challenge arrives I will spend time to resolve it myself, but if this will prove to be beyond my capabilities I will find the according specialist to resolve the issue. This can require additional expenses, but a part of the required funds is dedicated to such scenarios. Otherwise, these funds will go towards creative part of the game.

- Get a set of wallpapers for desktop and mobile devices with an exclusive art from our artist

story:
Before proceeding to the description, let's take a minute (and 8 seconds), to watch another amazing teaser:


Summary

We are exosyphen studios, an indie game development studio established almost 15 years ago. We always pioneered new and innovative games, like the popular Hacker Evolution serios.

Rail Adventures is our next project in developing truely new, exciting and innovative games. It's not another "same game idea".

It started out as a regular 3D game, and since we were among the select few companies to have received the early HTC Vive prototypes, we started adding VR support as the game is highly suitable for this.
 

What We Need & What You Get


As we went on with development and prototyping, we realized there is so much more we can do in this game, that is beyond our original budget and possibilities.
Why settle for a few great environments when we can offer an amazing gaming and virtual reality experience with wide and detailed worlds like: Castles on a mountain, rich green jungles, epic tropical islands, freezing mountains covered in snow, etc.
We want every level to be different and unique, not just an advancement from the previous one.

Check out some more trailers and screenshots, on the game's official STEAM page:



Even if you decide not to contribute, we have a free tech demo for you on STEAM, showcasing one of the levels/environments both on your PC and on an HTC Vive VR headset.

The Impact

Help us make this game bigger and greater than ever!
Don't just contribute with money. Reach out and email us with your ideas. We have a strong record of being open and very involved with our communities.
Unfortunately, we don't have a PR and customer support department and you will have to settle with getting replies (yes, we reply to every email) from someone who actually works on the game.
 

Risks & Challenges

The only risks we see here is running into a few delays due to the size and complexity of the project. Otherwise, the game will happen.
As you can see, we have a free tech demo and also we will grant you access to the current game prototype on STEAM, before the game is released into Early Access.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, don't just throw in your money and walk away.
Every game we developed, had up to 50% of its content and features developed based on the feedback and ideas we got from our fans. We love our fans and love to spark great vibrant communities around our games.

story:
Get your tickets now!

Get Double or Group Tickets with discount before opening! 

  • Double Ticket - $25 (After campaign - $30)
  • Group Ticket - $50 (After campaign - $55)

  • Early Bird Double Ticket - $30 $15 (50% discount)
  • Early Bird Group ticket - $55 $20 (40% discount)

Click on the right on Double Ticket for Early Birds or Group Ticket for Early Birds!


About this project


Escape room Karosta is a real-life adventure game where you are locked in a room full of secret puzzles. Puzzle solving can lead you to the goal - escaping from the room, but time is running out - you have 60 minutes.

The game can be played by 2 - 5 people. It can be an exciting adventure for you and your friends as well as an empowering team building activity for business companies.

Game plot

It's hard to tell where exactly you are and how you got there. It could be late 40's as well as mid 80's. There are some kind of screens on the walls. There are some evidences that you can see trough them and can be seen too. Every of your movement and thought gets logged. Somebody has full control of what you do and think. Kind of totalitarian regime? 

But there is one clue left, one message, that someone has left to you. He or she was here before and figured out how to escape from this madness. If you want to think about escaping, first you need to figure out how to keep thinking without being noticed.

What is different about this room?

There are plenty of rooms that look fancy and authentic, but somehow you just can't get the feeling that you are really locked in unbreakable room which is in the middle of nowhere or deep down under.

Our story is different.

Location: Karosta, Liepaja, Latvia

Our escape room is located in the world famous Karosta Prison. What's so special about this place? In 20th century it was a military prison for Tsar's Navy, Nazist Security Service and KGB as well. 

In 21st century however Karosta prison (today a non-profit organization) has become a major tourism attraction offering guided tours, museum expositions, and a reality show that gives you full prison experience. You won't find a better place to build an escape room, than those gloomy cells.


Arduino - Brain Heart of Our Escape Room

We are setting up Arduino micro-controller as our game server. Escape room will be fully automated and the game will be able to run without administrating. 

However, the game will be supervised by administrator trough surveillance cameras and by two-way audio communication if needed.


Our Team

We are bunch of guys and girls well orientated and working in tourism, software and electronic engineering, marketing and art. We are a company that searches for adventures and fun activities.

From the left: Edgars, Monta, Daiva and Kristers.

While exploring other existing recreational activities around us, we came to conclusion that many of them were similar to each other or not located nearby. By putting our heads together, we analyzed our escape room experience and decided to make a better one based on our knowledge.

Also we are creating this project in partnership with the Karosta Rescue Society, which is a non-profit organization and part of our income from the Escape Room will be given to save and restore the historical heritage of Karosta Naval Port.


Why We Need Your Help?

We need your help to raise $5000 to create worlds first escape room located in a real prison. In return for your support, you will be the first to discover the room and have a chance to spend a night in Prison like a real prisoner.

All funds will be used for building materials, interior, furniture and electronic parts. None of the funds will be used for marketing activities or personal usage like coffee or late night treats.


Interiour & Furniture

This draws up the biggest part of the budget - this is what goes into the rooms - all the furniture, home accessories, anything you can find indoors.

Electronic components

We are building our escape room with lots of electronics like sensors, buttons, displays for player interaction as their visible part and relay boards and micro-controllers as hidden part. This section also includes lights, wiring and other electronic gadgets.

Building materials

Here we count in anything that refers to room redecoration, secret chamber and passageway creation, materials for building walls. Karosta Prison has very thick walls, thats why we must create some secret chambers and make them well hidden for you :)

Game administration equipment

There are things needed for game administration it self, like video surveillance cameras, two-way audio communication system, monitors, ticket scanner and other things.

Other expenses

Under this section we count in any other unforseen expenses that may appear during the project. Also some transaction fees are included.


What will you get?

Our #1 Perk is a Thank You Message & Drum Solo video. We will record a video specially for you, with a Thank You message and 30 second, one of a kind drum solo from our team member - Edgars! Can you resist that? :)

We have also thought about our Early Birds. We give:

  • Double Tickets (2 Players) - $15
  • Group Tickets (3 - 5 Players) - $20

These tickets are for extra low prices and are only 15 available from each. After campaign the ticket price will be $25 and $50! Don't miss this offer!

Our main perks are:

  • Double Ticket (2 Players) - $25
  • Group Ticket (3 - 5 Players) - $50

These tickets have special prices only for funders. You will get a chance to be the first to discover the room and sneak around the Karosta Prison.

Karosta Prison experience.

For business companies we have made a special offer - Team Building Pack - $125, which includes 3x Group Tickets (up to 15 players). This is perfect for companies that want to build strong teams and strengthen relationships between co-workers.

If you think, that you can withstand more than we have already offered, then you must take:

  • Karosta Tour for Two - $175
  • Karosta Tour The Rough Way - $350

You will:

  • Get arrested in town
  • Have an unpleasant ride to Karosta Prison
  • Soviet style lunch
  • Unfriendly inmates
  • Interrogation
  • Isolation
  • Night at Karosta Prison

This can be a perfectly planned trip for you and your friends!

For our biggest funders we are offering - Karosta Grand Experience - $750! 
We'll find you and your company (up to 5 people) anywhere in Latvia, Riga Airport (RIX) or Palanga Airport (PLQ), arrest you, take you to Karosta Prison and scare the crap out of you. 

You'll have to stay for a night at the Prison, take Soviet style food, meet inmates and experience 60 minute madness in Escape Room. Also you will be interrogated and put in isolator. We know how to handle criminals like you!

You think you have been in trouble? You have no idea what have you signed on. After this you will never ever want to get in this kind of trouble again. All you have to do is to get to Riga or Palanga Airports, we will do the rest for you!


More about Karosta and Karosta Prison

Karosta

Karosta is a unique naval port located in Liepaja, Latvia. Karosta was built at the end of 19th century by Russian Tsar to host The Baltic Naval Forces of Russian Empire. A huge military town was erected claiming more than 20 km2 at the Baltic sea to host some 120 warships and 20 000 soldiers. 

Karosta bridge

Later in 20th century Karosta was used by Latvian army as well as German and Soviet armies. During the Cold War Karosta became a military base of highest importance since it lay on the western border of Soviet Union and had nearly 40 000 Soviet troops and a submarine base. For 100 years Karosta has been a city within a city, unknown to the inhabitants of Liepaja. 

What is Karosta today? A unique place that you have to see with your own eyes. Karosta has only 5000 peolpe living there now and although most of the military structures are in ruins, there are some stuning sights. 


Karosta Prison

The top place to visit in Karosta is definately Karosta Prison. From 1905 till 1997 it was used as a detention centre for misbehaving soldiers of Tsar's Navy, German Imperial Forces in WWI, Latvian Army, German Kriegsmarine and SD (Security Service) during WWII and of course Soviet Army and Navy. Those walls have seen more than you would like to imagine. 

Karosta Prison

Since 2002 Karosta Prison is fully open to tourism attracting some 20 000 visitors annually. Karosta Prison is run by a non-profit organization Karosta Rescue Society and offer its guests guided tours and museum expositions as well as some shocking experiences like the reality show "Behind the bars" or the extreme night. 

Karosta Prison has been voted the most extraordinary hotel in the world and for a reason! More info you can get at www.karostascietums.lv

Risks & Challenges

If we don't reach our goal we will recalculate our budget, set priorities to continue with and look for other financial support, but one thing is for sure - there will be Escape Room Karosta.

In case of this scenario, work process may slow down a bit, so a delayed opening date also is possible.  


Other ways you can help

Financial aid is not the only way to help us. We would also appreciate if you could spread the word on social media - Facebook and Twitter by sharing this campaign. Or maybe you own some old lamp, rotary telephone or something similar that could perfectly fit into our Escape room.


FAQ

When Escape Room Karosta will be open?

If everything goes well, May 1st is our opening date!

How long does my ticket remain valid?

Tickets will be valid until you use them so don’t worry. But we’d love to meet our funders sooner :)

How much will the ticket prices go up after Indiegogo?

Double ticket will rise up from $25 to $30 and group ticket - from $50 to $55.

There are things needed for game administration it self, like video surveillance cameras, two-way audio communication system, monitors, ticket scanner and other things.
Other expenses
Under this section we count in any other unforseen expenses that may appear during the project. Also some transaction fees are included.


What will you get?
Our #1 Perk is a Thank You Message & Drum Solo video. We will record a video specially for you, with a Thank You message and 30 second, one of a kind drum solo from our team member - Edgars! Can you resist that? :)



We have also thought about our Early Birds. We give:



Double Tickets (2 Players) - $15



Group Tickets (3 - 5 Players) - $20



These tickets are for extra low prices and are only 15 available from each. After campaign the ticket price will be $25 and $50! Don't miss this offer!
Our main perks are:



Double Ticket (2 Players) - $25


Group Ticket (3 - 5 Players) - $50


These tickets have special prices only for funders. You will get a chance to be the first to discover the room and sneak around the Karosta Prison.




Karosta Prison experience.

For business companies we have made a special offer - Team Building Pack - $125, which includes 3x Group Tickets (up to 15 players). This is perfect for companies that want to build strong teams and strengthen relationships between co-workers.
If you think, that you can withstand more than we have already offered, then you must take:



Karosta Tour for Two - $175


Karosta Tour The Rough Way - $350


You will:


Get arrested in town
Have an unpleasant ride to Karosta Prison
Soviet style lunch
Unfriendly inmates
Interrogation
Isolation
Night at Karosta Prison


This can be a perfectly planned trip for you and your friends!

For our biggest funders we are offering - Karosta Grand Experience - $750! We'll find you and your company (up to 5 people) anywhere in Latvia, Riga Airport (RIX) or Palanga Airport (PLQ), arrest you, take you to Karosta Prison and scare the crap out of you. 
You'll have to stay for a night at the Prison, take Soviet style food, meet inmates and experience 60 minute madness in Escape Room. Also you will be interrogated and put in isolator. We know how to handle criminals like you!
You think you have been in trouble? You have no idea what have you signed on.  After this you will never ever want to get in this kind of trouble again. All you have to do is to get to Riga or Palanga Airports, we will do the rest for you!

More about Karosta and Karosta Prison
Karosta


Karosta is a unique naval port located in Liepaja, Latvia. Karosta was built at the end of 19th century by Russian Tsar to host The Baltic Naval Forces of Russian Empire. A huge military town was erected claiming more than 20 km2 at the Baltic sea to host some 120 warships and 20 000 soldiers. 


Karosta bridge
Later in 20th century Karosta was used by Latvian army as well as German and Soviet armies. During the Cold War Karosta became a military base of highest importance since it lay on the western border of Soviet Union and had nearly 40 000 Soviet troops and a submarine base. For 100 years Karosta has been a city within a city, unknown to the inhabitants of Liepaja. 

What is Karosta today? A unique place that you have to see with your own eyes. Karosta has only 5000 peolpe living there now and although most of the military structures are in ruins, there are some stuning sights. 

Karosta Prison

The top place to visit in Karosta is definately Karosta Prison. From 1905 till 1997 it was used as a detention centre for misbehaving soldiers of Tsar's Navy, German Imperial Forces in WWI, Latvian Army, German Kriegsmarine and SD (Security Service) during WWII and of course Soviet Army and Navy. Those walls have seen more than you would like to imagine. 






Karosta Prison
Since 2002 Karosta Prison is fully open to tourism attracting some 20 000 visitors annually. Karosta Prison is run by a non-profit organization Karosta Rescue Society and offer its guests guided tours and museum expositions as well as some shocking experiences like the reality show "Behind the bars" or the extreme night. 
Karosta Prison has been voted the most extraordinary hotel in the world and for a reason! More info you can get at www.karostascietums.lv
Risks & Challenges
If we don't reach our goal we will recalculate our budget, set priorities to continue with and look for other financial support, but one thing is for sure - there will be Escape Room Karosta.
In case of this scenario, work process may slow down a bit, so a delayed opening date also is possible.  

Other ways you can help
Financial aid is not the only way to help us. We would also appreciate if you could spread the word on social media - Facebook and Twitter by sharing this campaign. Or maybe you own some old lamp, rotary telephone or something similar that could perfectly fit into our Escape room.

FAQ
When Escape Room Karosta will be open?
If everything goes well, May 1st is our opening date!
How long does my ticket remain valid?
Tickets will be valid until you use them so don’t worry. But we’d love to meet our funders sooner :)
How much will the ticket prices go up after Indiegogo?
Double ticket will rise up from $25 to $30 and group ticket - from $50 to $55.

story:
Hi everyone! I'm Eldon and I make graphics for video games.  Making video games is awesome and can be a loads of fun.  It also takes hard work and dedication. What I want to do is make graphics to help you with your game. You can use the graphics as placeholder while programming, or use them for commercial release.  That's up to you.  Now that I've reached a milestone of creating 20,000 assets, I'd like to grow my site Graphicsforgames.com with more and better content well into the future.  What I'd like to accomplish is outlined below:

  • With the funding I receive from my campaign, I'd like to make dozens of complete "build-your-own" asset packs and secure funding to continue work well into the future.

  • If my "Free Site" stretch goal is met, I'll make the site completely FREE for everyone.  This includes all the new content I make.  During the campaign, if you donate over $35 and the campaign does not reach it's goal, you'll get complete access to all the art on my site just the same.

This funding is for the artist's so they can continue work on new and better assets.  A minor portion of the funding is for software, hardware, and website upkeep. So what have we done so far?

  • Many people have published games with our assets. They got 100% of the profits.
  • A New Website has launched.
  • Steam has allowed distribution of our assets on their service. So if you don't want to download from our site, you can download from there.
  • We've hired other artist's, as funds allow, to work on projects.  We'd like to do more of this.
  • We've developed "Build-Your-Own" asset packs.  They are modular graphic .PNG files that can be combined, remixed, or modified to create your own sprites. This is something we've done with many of our packs.

Take a look at our site Graphics for Games and the gallery below for examples of how "Build-your-own" graphic packs work.
 

We can do so much with funding:

  • Hire more artist's to create Commercial Free assets. Work full time on new packs for faster releases.
  • Make Video Game Music
  • Investigate the possibility of developing a program that will aid in putting the assets together. Distribute it for free.
  • Add more assets to already included packs.
  • Fix our community site Roencia Game Creators and dedicate it to your projects and games.

(What build-your-own graphic packs are like)


Icon Creation Kit:
(Create icons for games like DOTA 2 - Premade icons included)

Tank Creation:

Character Creation:

(Do you have a drawing or character you want us to create?)

Endless Ship Variations:

Create ships, plants, HUD's, and other elements to make a complete game:

Remember, if you donate even a dollar and we reach our "Free Site" stretch goal, you'll get access to graphicsforgames to download everything.  Also you can:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use your social networks

story:
Hello, and welcome to my project!


My name is Alejandro and I've come to Indiegogo to present you my project. First, allow me to introduce myself. I'm an 18 year-old guy from Spain, living in Barcelona, and I'm an avid fan of gaming and the airsoft sport ever since I can remember. Unfortunately, here in Spain there are not many places where you can practice this sport, so I thought: "Why don't I make my own Airsoft Field so people can come and have fun playing this awesome sport?". And here I am, presenting you my project. But think further about it, what if you could play airsoft in a video-game themed field? Wouldn't it be awesome to play airsoft in a field that totally looks like Dust II from Counter Strike?

This is my project. A video-game themed airsoft field.


How can I help? What will I get?


I am aware that this is a big project and that I'll be needing a lot of money to be able to take it forward. I have part of the money but I highly doubt I could afford to begin the project in a full scale with it, that's why I'm asking you for help.

I've set the goal to 5.000€, which I think would be enough to rent an industrial space to set the field, and buy the necessary materials to set up everything (Airsoft weapons, security clothing, helmets, goggles, materials to build up the walls...), in other words, those 5.000€ are going to be directed straight to the project, it will help me set up everything and you will be getting updates on everything I do about it.

My main goal right now is to get enough money to get everything set up and start getting my hands dirty creating the shooting field, which will be the Dust II map from the famous series Counter Strike. As I said before, I will be posting updates on everything I get done. That stands for pictures, receipts... So you can see that I'm using the money I get from here to fund the project. If you want to see the rewards you can get by donating, please refer to the proper section.

If the money doesn't reach the specified quantity, you can be sure I'll be using whatever I get from here toturn the project into a reality by working as hard as I can to get the rest.


Why all this?


As I said before, there are not many places in Spain to play airsoft, and the few that exist are either too crowded or with barely enough people to start a game. My objective is to create a totally new airsoft field with a map that can be familiar to a lot of people, I want an airsoft field that people actually feel nervous to play at. If I get some people to play in my airsoft field, walk around it and get them to think: "Wow, this totally feels like a Counter Strike game, it's like I'm walking in the game" then you can be sure I'll feel completely satisfied, because that's the feeling I want people to get.


For all of you who don't know what I'm talking about, here are some screenshots from the Dust II map, in Counter-Strike: Global Offensive.


Risks? Challenges?


I'm not going to lie, for me, this is a very risky project. It can either go terribly right, or terribly wrong, I'm putting the money I have into this project, I want it to be my project of future and make a living out of it. So you could say this is an all or nothing situation, that is why I require your help. I can assure you I will be eternally grateful if you donate to my project. Of course, this situation only makes me stronger to overcome whatever obstacle can come in my way.

Is there any other way I can colaborate?


Spread the word! If for whatever reason you can't colaborate with a donation (please, remember that every euro helps, even if it's just one!) just spread the word to your family and friends, show them the project and let them decide if they want to colaborate and donate to this project I'm creating, remember to share the project on Twitter, Facebook or any other social media, every way to help, as little as it seems, can make a huge difference!

Thanks a lot for reading through the project. If you're interested in donating, please head to the proper section and read the different rewards!

story:
Star Zeal is a 4x space strategy game with a more personal interaction with your civilization and its characters. It can be considered as a hybrid between an RPG and a 4x space civilization builder. You will be able to play as many different species, even minor ones, from large militaristic empires to isolated nomadic species, or even a race of pirates. The end goals of each faction created, or pre-made can be extremely variable. Sometimes a faction simply wants to hide from everyone in their tiny corner of the universe.

The main game has you play in the Milky Way galaxy with pre-made star clusters and systems like our own the Sol system and many procedural star clusters. You will be able to choose from a multitude of species within their own family to form a faction  such as humanoid, reptilian, insectoid, mechanical, other mammalian species and even non corporeal beings. 

One of the main features is the extremely large playable area, an entire galaxy! With thousands of procedurally generated and hand made star systems. You will probably never explore it all. The player can start off as any available species or go with what is more familiar like the young Human Empire recovering from long tribal wars on Earth.

More work in progress and early concepts on twitter: https://twitter.com/Akuu_D_E?lang=en

Unique features.

-Massive galaxy to play in with real life star clusters and procedurally generated as you go along. 
-Deep character and species system, more focus on character interaction and development.
-Espionage, military tactics, diplomacy and exploration will be more favourable than sheer expansion. 
-Very different end goals per faction(that players can set too),  From isolationists of single systems, to massive galactic empires.
-Research tree is dynamic and opens depending on your exploration and available resources.
-Alignment system, good or bad depending on actions you take.
-Your empires progress and survival will be aided by procedural quests and your choices in them will determine your alignment.
-Mysterious foes and anomalies to interact with.

Basic features

-Unique races, with unique ship sets, characters and other art including planetary bases.
-Real time, with adjustable time skips and pause.
-Ship design.
-Full real time 3d battles on all axis. 
-3d colony.
-Trading.
-Diplomacy and influence.
-Automation when the player wants, in multiple aspects of gameplay. 

Main pre made factions for early access are:

  • Human Empire
  • Sirius Rebels(minor rebels)
  • Carcharon(large carnivorous reptilians)
  • Mikonians(large carnivorous mammals)
  • Lorr(minor nomadic humanoids)
  • Bortax(mechanical hive)
  • Sion(small, extremely advanced, psychic humanoids)
  • Sphen(minor reptilians)
  • Archonyx(hybrid, non corporeal humanoids)
  • Procedural pirate and minor factions.

Older work in progress images and quick concept artworks can be viewed on the twitter page: @Akuu_D_E

Inspiration.

The inspiration for Star Zeal mainly comes from playing many different types of 4x space games, especially from the early 2000s and also RPG style turn based strategy games with focus on heroes.

I wanted to capture the feeling of being really small in the vast expanse of the final frontier and an more personal attachment to your civilization as you attempt to survive and explore.

Many of the core features are near completed, what the Indiegogo is for is mainly to seal the deal on the rest of the art and additional programming for things such as the research tree and ship design. Coding for these parts are there but requires a lot more art work to complete, thus most of the funding will go towards art and marketing. Character design will also get some extra tender love and care.

NB: Indiegogo campaign costs are calculated along with the Marketing.

 

There are more possible additions to the game that can be reached with stretch goal funding.

                                3d ground battles and additional ships for all factions.

                            Mod support, 2 new major species and additional music.

        4 new Major species and 10 new minor species with unique ships and troops.

         Andromeda galaxy, totally new set of species, ships, music and story lines.

 

It is somewhat ambitious for a single person to develop, that is why I decided to use an Indiegogo campaign to get me the help I need to complete this project. I found inspiration in other single developers who have created 4x games, via contract work and their own bravery. 

With your support I am sure Star Zeal can achieve its vision and become a future classic 4x space game with high ​replayability.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any help is greatly appreciated. If you are too strapped to help out monetarily, please consider retweeting @Akuu_D_E and or spreading the word on Star Zeal.

Please do not hesitate to comment and ask questions, I will answer them here as best as I can :P.

Thank you :P

Some early concepts:

Mikonian/Mammal concepts.

Reptilian Carcharon concepts 

Early Archonyx ship concepts:

Other humanoid ship concepts:

story:
Why is Social Sniper special? 
Social Sniper is an attempt to create an entirely new type of online/offline gaming experience. We call it cross-world gaming. We want to take multiplayer action games from the computer screen, and into the real world, to get players outside and active, to be immersive in their community, and in their interaction with real people.

We’re not the first to try this, but by focusing on a simple, casual gaming style, and compelling gameplay, we want to be the ones who take cross-world gaming into the mainstream. The basic story of Social Sniper casts you as a secret assassin, with one or more other players as a target. Your goal is to find the target(s), and “shoot” them by taking a picture with your smartphone camera. If we’re able to verify that you’ve got the correct target, you win – but at the same time other snipers may hunting you, and you never know who!

The vision of Social Sniper is to spawn an entirely new category of games, a category that facilitates and encourages physical activity and real social interaction. Games that bridge the gap between the virtual and the real worlds in new ways. We believe that the technology and concepts behind Social Sniper can enable many other cool gaming experiences, and we hope to inspire others to use the concepts behind Social Sniper to create cool new experiences for the community. We have a few of these ideas ourselves ;-)

What We Need & What You Get
The first version of Social Sniper has been funded and developed entirely by our small team. Our backend systems, such as the gameplay API, our image analysis systems, and messaging hubs are fully capable, and built to scale globally on enterprise grade cloud services. You can download the app for iOS or Android, and play the game today, however the gameplay offered by our current front-end (mobile) app is pretty limited, and that is the major focus for this crowdfunding campaign.

For our next release, we want to re-build the app from scratch, and significantly improve the feature set and user experience. We will be adding new game types, such as league play, private teams, play-during-commute mode, as well as weapon selection, body armor, leveling, proximity alerts, social media integration and much, much more.

By backing this crowdfunding campaign, you not only become a part of the future category of cross-world gaming, but you also get the VIP Supporter badge displayed on your Social Sniper profile for life. We want to make a game you’ll be proud to have backed, and will take feature requests from contributors, and implement the top (feasible) requests into the game. Contributions over $20 also get exclusive access to the top-line sniper rifle, the M200 Intervention. This rifle shoots armor piercing rounds, for "one shot, one kill" action regardless of any target body armor. We will never offer a better weapon, and only backers from this campaign will receive it. Once the campaign is closed, there will be no way to get this weapon again. Ever.

If we reach our funding goal, two new front-end apps (iOS and Android) will be built from scratch, with the features mentioned. We’ll use the funds to hire additional programmers, to ensure a rapid progression and high quality UX. We expect to deliver the new apps within 3 months of campaign closing, and will provide regular updates to backers. We can project such short timeframes, because we already have our prototype running, and have dealt with the biggest complexities already. If we fail to reach our funding goal, we’ll still keep developing Social Sniper towards our vision. We’ll use the contributed funds to maximum efficiency, and we’ll work hard to provide additional funding ourselves as well as do more of the development work in-house, but we’ll get there in the end. Backers will be kept in the loop on progress, and development time may be extended to 6-12 months, depending on the funding received. If we exceed our funding goal any additional funds will be spent on new features and marketing. 

Who Are We?
The team behind Social Sniper consists of 5 friends, with extensive startup experience, and diverse, unique and complementary skillsets.
Flemming is the initiator of Social Sniper, born out of frustration from watching his teenage son sit in front of the computer for hours on end. An experienced entrepreneur, with over 20 years of successful business in the mobile and telecommunications field, Flemming is the powerhouse of go-get energy and can-do attitude. 
Jesper is the multi-talented business professional, who has taken on the graphic and audio design of Social Sniper.
John is a former police intelligence special agent, who brings real world insights and enlightenment to the team. He is a master of team dynamics and instrumental in creating the immersive gameplay we want for Social Sniper.
Martin is the resident geek. A tech entrepreneur for more than 15 years, Martin enjoys envisioning and developing innovative new concepts as much as he does designing and coding solutions to make them reality.
Paul is a physical therapist and acclaimed coach and author, focusing on the mental and physical therapeutic benefits that can be achieved through games and activities.

Social Sniper is FREE to download and play, now and forever:

Our mission is to make companies pay to become part of the Social Sniper game. In “Solo Missions” will all missions be without involment of other players, such as taking a selfie with a McDonalds employee , take a picture of a Starbucks coffee etc.

Companies then pay a small fee for this “Hidden” advertising, and also provide a “Mission Completed” price to the Social Sniper player, for example a coffee, a hamburger and so on.

Eventually, our backend can be used much more extensively than just the Social Sniper game, we can make treasure hunts, dating portals, locate lost items etc., by just adjusting a bit of programming. The possibilities are endless.

Risks & Challenges
Since we’ve already built our playable prototype of Social Sniper, the development risks to the project are limited. The most prominent risk is if development costs were to turn out higher than expected. To a large degree we are able to mitigate this risk by having full in-house technical knowledge and development capabilities. By not being dependent on external companies or consultants for any core parts of our development work we could complete any commenced work and final changes ourselves, should this situation occur. We also practically eliminate the risk by being able to provide detailed and accurate specifications to any external suppliers. All in all, there’s no scenario where we’re funded, but can’t deliver.

Other Ways You Can Help
We want Social Sniper to become a community project, and we’re looking for ambassadors to help spread the word, and promote Social Sniper. If you want to help set up Social Sniper groups within your city, university, workplace or other community, please connect with us on Facebook. If you have ideas for features, spin-offs, or want to collaborate with Social Sniper for your own project, please reach out as well – we’re always happy to hear from you.
story_txt:
Why is Social Sniper special? Social Sniper is an attempt to create an entirely new type of online/offline
gaming experience. We call it cross-world gaming. We want to take multiplayer
action games from the computer screen, and into the real world, to get players
outside and active, to be immersive in their community, and in their interaction
with real people. 
We’re not the first to try
this, but by focusing on a simple, casual gaming style, and compelling
gameplay, we want to be the ones who take cross-world gaming into the
mainstream. The basic story of Social Sniper casts you as a secret assassin, with
one or more other players as a target. Your goal is to find the target(s), and
“shoot” them by taking a picture with your smartphone camera. If we’re able to
verify that you’ve got the correct target, you win – but at the same time other
snipers may hunting you, and you never know who!
The vision of Social Sniper is
to spawn an entirely new category of games, a category that facilitates and
encourages physical activity and real social interaction. Games that bridge the
gap between the virtual and the real worlds in new ways. We believe that the
technology and concepts behind Social Sniper can enable many other cool gaming
experiences, and we hope to inspire others to use the concepts behind Social
Sniper to create cool new experiences for the community. We have a few of these
ideas ourselves ;-) 
What We Need & What You
GetThe first version of Social Sniper has been funded and developed entirely
by our small team. Our backend systems, such as the gameplay API, our image
analysis systems, and messaging hubs are fully capable, and built to scale
globally on enterprise grade cloud services. You can download the app for iOS
or Android, and play the game today, however the gameplay offered by our
current front-end (mobile) app is pretty limited, and that is the major focus
for this crowdfunding campaign. 
For our next release, we want
to re-build the app from scratch, and significantly improve the feature set and
user experience. We will be adding new game types, such as league play, private
teams, play-during-commute mode, as well as weapon selection, body armor,
leveling, proximity alerts, social media integration and much, much more.
By backing this crowdfunding
campaign, you not only become a part of the future category of cross-world
gaming, but you also get the VIP Supporter badge displayed on your Social
Sniper profile for life. We want to make a game you’ll be proud to have backed,
and will take feature requests from contributors, and implement the top (feasible)
requests into the game. Contributions over $20 also get exclusive access to the
top-line sniper rifle, the M200 Intervention. This rifle shoots armor piercing rounds, for "one shot, one kill" action regardless of any target body armor. We will never offer a better weapon, and only backers from this campaign will receive it. Once the campaign
is closed, there will be no way to get this weapon again. Ever. 
If we reach our funding goal,
two new front-end apps (iOS and Android) will be built from scratch, with the
features mentioned. We’ll use the funds to hire additional programmers, to
ensure a rapid progression and high quality UX. We expect to deliver the new
apps within 3 months of campaign closing, and will provide regular updates to
backers. We can project such short timeframes, because we already have our
prototype running, and have dealt with the biggest complexities already. If we

story:
NOTE:  I've done a lot of work on this game, but I've reached the point where I need help to finish it. I am raising money to get that help. I intend to offer a paid internship to one or more game development majors from Columbia College's Interactive Arts and Media Department. I have reached out to Columbia College and will keep you posted here. In addition, 10% of the eventual sales of this game will be donated to breast cancer research. Which charity / foundation will in large part be determined by you (see $100 perk description). 

(High level game screen annotations describing game play in more detail are available here: http://www.melonwater.com/SpaceNanny.pdf)

Premise: You have been abducted by aliens and forced to be their nanny. Aliens are in our solar system mining asteroids on a very tight schedule. They need someone to take care of their newly-hatched alien brood if they are to hit their deadline. Your job is to keep the brood happy, healthy and satisfied; because if you don't, they explode, and you get launched out an airlock without a spacesuit.

 Space Nanny is designed to be an addictive time-crunch tap-fest time-waster with just a hint (the teeniest tiniest smidgen, really) of resource management. It will be the kind of game that makes your public transportation commute fly by, your family holiday get-togethers bearable, and "working from home" even more unproductive than it already is. 

 I've put almost 500 hours into the design side of things already, and now I need to hire someone talented and experienced to build it. I tried the "partner with a developer buddy who also has a family and a day job" approach previously, but he burned out and bailed. I tried my hand at livecode (and a couple of similar products) and was reminded why I draw rather than code. I also tried giving up and moving on to something else, but for some reason Space Nanny is stuck in my head for good.

The introductory price point I'm thinking about right now is $2.99 for both tablet and mobile. I figure that's the top end for trying something new by someone you've never heard of. But I'm getting ahead of myself. The first order of business is getting it built, and I will be forever grateful to those of you who help me do it.

My sincerest thanks in advance!

Mike Wean

story:
Everybody has an opinion about robots. Maybe you wish they’d become cheaper more quickly so that you could afford to keep one as a butler. Maybe you’re excited to see just what they’re capable of. Maybe you’re a little nervous to see just what they’re capable of. Whatever your opinion is, the future of robotics as painted by authors such as Isaac Asimov, seems sure to be one of excitement and wonder, as our inventions begin to walk alongside us and reach heights that would have been otherwise impossible. In Rock’N’Robot, you get to choose an individual robot.

Rock'n'Robot is a Adventure-Science-Fiction-Fighting-Browsergame. Upgrading. Going on adventures. Fighting in the Roborena against other players. As a bonus there is voiceacting. So you don’t have to wait minutes to let the timer count down to zero. Get entertained by our little audio-plays.

By increasing stats such as shield, energy, and strength, you develop your robot character from a newly minted product into a fearsome artificial intelligence. You will go on quests in order to own gold, and every quest comes with its own story. Of course you can the voice acting of – but actually there’s no reason :-)! Plus, in the interest of making the game social, there will be an international high score list. You can compete with your old friends and make new ones!
This is a one-of-a-kind game for anyone who’s even remotely curious about robots: tech nerds, sci-fi geeks, gamers – it will appeal to all of these demographics.

With your contributions, we can turn this game into something that everyone will be able to enjoy, right out of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, or whatever browser you may use.

Thank you!

And: it's for free! If we say it, we mean it! Just some VIP features and that's it!

Planned Beta-Start: December 2015


Here are some things you can do in the game:

-  Choose your Robot Character out of different Robotars

-  Level and upgrade your Robo by solving quests

-  Rent Space-Ships which decreases your quest time or give you some extra money per Quest

-  Craft your own gear and Robo-Upgrades (optional when reaching a higher amount of money)

-  Fight other players in the Roborena

-  Be the best robot in the highscore list

-  Get a job in one of the Robo-Companies like Robtec or Incredit




International Development

We are a team of highly qualified developers, Space-Nerds and Browsergame enthusiasts – from all over the world (India, Israel, Germany, USA and many more)

The development so far is financed by ourselves. To finish the Game and integrate some more special features we need a final amount of money!




Budget Breakdown

All the funded money goes into the development and finalizing the project. With more money funded new special features are integrated.

Here are some details:

Development/Programming: 45 %

Graphic Design: 27 %

Sound: 15 %

Marketing: 6.5 %

Law/Fees: 6 %

Coffee: 0.5 %


Risks

Risks are everywhere! Especially in the game development sector. All game developers highly risk everything when they develop a game. But without going with these risks players from all over the world wouldn't have so much awesome games!
You, the gaming community, are the monument, the base of the game development sector!
We promise to give all our heart and passion into that project. With your help we can get our baby online and built a huge international community!
