story:
What is Dethrone?


Dethrone is a Real time Hack-N-Slash RPG with a first person touch to it.  There will be a number of unique elements but let's focus on the big ones.  Right now my team is dedicated to making an immersive environment, and creating combat the is not only rewarding and interactive, but fun and explosive.  I will dedicate myself to making combat what you once wanted as a kid, or most importantly one that you WILL come back to.


What type of combat?


most combat will be held in a first person view with the main player controlling powerful hero characters with some unique hack-n-slash combat.  Secondary combat will take place in a real time strategy base Over-The-World Camera Perspective.  The King/Queen, YOU the player, giving orders to Troops or militia to Attack, Defend, or Retreat to or from a position on the map.  Rally points will also be an option to be setting for your troops, but don’t forget your hero, who will be the difference maker as far as combat goes.


Why Hack-N-Slash?


Have you ever sat back as your units attack the enemy, but wanted to jump into combat and turn the tide of the battle yourself.  Well this will allow you just that.  Take up your hero(custom made by you the player) and your weapons and skills of choice to take on combat like we have yet to see in a video game.  This type of combat will also be really fun in my opinion.  Ever since I played games that had medieval combat, I fell in love, but there wasn't enough progression.

What Progression will there be?

If you look at some great games over the past 10 years, they had progression.  Whether it was a skill tree, or it was loot, they allowed you to feel like you were growing.  There will be lots of growing in this.  From customizing your castle's abilities, to outfitting your player with special abilities fit for your play style.

Marcus Trujillo
http://greentowelgaming.blogspot.com/

I was born into a tech family.  My father was an IT guru since before i was born, and has passed most of his knowledge on to me.  I built my first computer when i was about 7, and was playing old SNES side scrollers with my father since i was about 5.  I have loved video games and have played them since then.  It was never enough though.  Over the past 3 years i have been engrossed in learning about games, how they are made, and in turn have seen many come to life.  From classics like mario, to some lesser known like titan quest.  Each game holds a special place in the industry, and now that I have a dedicated and talented team of developers, we can finally make a mark on this amazing industry.


Green Towel Gaming, and DeThrone are two of my latest ventures.  My leadership and guidance in this game will be something probably a little different than most people are used to.  I enjoy taking input from my developers as well as others outside us to help make a more complete game.  So far, the work we have completed has been small compared to the grand scheme of things, but it is a lot considering the amount of time actually put into this.  We do our work fast and efficiently, but most importantly we love what we do.

Gary "Embershard" Kinsey
Blogger Address - http://embershardsdethroneblog.blogspot.com/
                                  (My DeThrone Progress Blog)
From a young age, I've always been enamored by video games.  It always amazed me how developers could create an entirely new, living world from nothing.  Now, I'm on the front lines of that world creation, and it is an amazing feeling indeed, giving birth to another place.  Art has always been a passion of mine, so when I began 3D modeling, I was able to combine two loves and complete both at the same time.  I've been modeling for the past 5 years, mostly creating mods for myself, and the Steam community.  This year, I've been invited to work on a few projects for developers, and it has been a blast.  Lately, I've been working with Green Towel Gaming, on a start up project to develop a game, as well as working with Eleon game studios on their project "Empyrion".  I hope to keep driving toward development of a complete game, because, games, I love em.


Tier 1: $50,000

Basic Package- Basic funding of this project  guarantees a finished game, at least one environment, two classes, basic character interaction and castle development, and simple progression mechanics.  Funding to this point will ensure that the game gets built.  My time will be dedicated to the project.

Reward::Hand sculpted environments, with each bush/bunch of grass/rock placed in such a way as to create a unique, ambient play area.  This amount will allow me to dedicate all my time to creating a game I am proud of.

What the money will do for us::This funding is the bare minimum in order to fund myself to get the project done.

Tier 2: $70,000

Reward::Cohesive models and textures, that bind the game world together. A number of unique environments that lend themselves to an immersive experience.

What the money will do for us::Will allow me and my team to purchase dedicated, high end systems and software to facilitate the creation of the games many assets and gameplay features. From 3ds max, to a top of the line custom built computer(Built by myself to save money), these are the tools we will need to speed the process along.

Tier 3: $90,000

Reward::Realistic physics and interaction in combat, as well as a deeper RPG feel to the games progression mechanics.  More story quest oriented gameplay, diverging from the basic go here, kill this, scenario.

What the money will do for us::This will allow me to hire the 3D artist full time for creating assets and models.

Tier 4:$110,000

Reward::Two more classes will be added to further diversify play styles.  Custom classes to create a hero character that best fits your play style, be it tanking, spell slinging, stealth/assassination, or ranged combat.

What the money will do for us::This will allow me to hire a dedicated, professional programmer to refine the database and scripting so the animations and features within the game run smoothly.

Tier 5: $130,000

Reward:: Rigorous playtesting, bug fixing, and optimization to facilitate gameplay on a wider array of computer specs.(Linux will be added to the platform list)

What the money will do for us::This will help us secure a permanent work space within my teams radius to ensure a professional work environment, free from everyday distractions, for optimized workflow and productivity.

Tier 6: $150,000

Reward:: Two more classes will be added and 4 or more custom made environments to battle in.  Deeper design of the castle and more customization of the battlements.

What the money will do for us:: This will allow us to continue development for longer, bringing the game closer toward a AAA quality release, which includes continued employment of the modellers and programmers. 

Tier 7: $170,000 (This will unlock another Vassal(Tier 8))

Reward:: A town to interact with between matches that is tailored to the medieval style.  Visit your favorite shops to buy and sell and trade goods and upgrade your equipment for your next battle.

What the money will do for us:We will be able to dive deeper into the RPG aspects of the game allowing more progression and quests to accomplish along side the battle.

Tier 8: $220,000

Reward:: Pets!! You will be able to collect, be awarded, and even find pets that can help you in battle.  Want a wolf that has a healing howl, or a Panther that allows better stealth, this will now be possible!!

What the money will do for us: Adding content will be an ever growing task, so with this money we can hire talented content creators to make some amazing models, textures, and effects!




(Traveler)Tier 1: $5

-A tip of the hat to the good wanderer willing to donate to a good cause.

(Peasant)Tier 2: $10 Early Bird Special(Limit of 500)

-A copy of the game when fully finished and released.

(Farmer)Tier 3: $15 (Limit of 200)

-A copy of the game when fully finished and released, Exclusive access to our forum(Farmer Badge) and a Beta Copy of the game as soon as available.

(Militia)Tier 4: $20

-A copy of the game when fully finished and released, Exclusive access to our forum(Militia Badge) and a Beta Copy of the game as soon as available.

(Merchant)Tier 5: $25

-Previous Tiers that apply(Merchant Forum Badge), A bonus copy of the game to share with a friend.  We will also reward a custom made “Merchant Hat” to equip on your character, only for backers.

(Craftsman)Tier 6: $45

-Previous Tiers that apply(Craftsman Forum Badge),A Craftsman Hat, and a special place in our forum and website dedicated to our amazing community members like you!

(Knight)Tier 7: $75

-Previous Tiers that apply(Knight Forum Badge),

(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)

-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name 2 weapons of your choice for your Castle Inventory.

(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)

-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name 2 Classes of your choice for your Castle.

(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)

-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name Your Castle whatever it is you choose.

(Noble)Tier 9:$150

-Previous Tiers that apply(Noble Forum Badge), All three of the exclusive rewards of the Vassal Tier.

(Noble)Tier 9: $150

-Previous Tiers(Clergy Forum Badge), Access to 3 more custom class slots.

(Clergy)Tier 10: $200(Limit of 30)

-Previous Tiers(Noble Forum Badge), a Custom weapon skin for the hero's weapons. Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.

(Monarch)Tier 11: $500(Limit of 15)

-Previous Tiers that apply(Monarch Forum Badge), A Custom Player Skin for a hero of your choice. Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.

(Prince/Princess)Tier 12: $1000

-Previous Tiers that apply(Prince/Princess Forum Badge) Work Directly with us to create a unique asset in the game(weapon or character)  Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.

(King)Tier 13: $2500

-Previous Tiers that apply(King Forum Badge)PETS!! You will get your very own pet of your choice that can be further customized in game to fit the behavior of your liking.  Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.

(Deity)Tier 14: $5000(Limit of 10)

-You Get Everything, from a Custom Made Deity Forum Badge, Custom Pet, Custom Armor and Character, Naming of Everything, 2 Custom weapons,  also all future DLC published for DeThrone.
story_txt:
What is Dethrone?Dethrone is a Real time Hack-N-Slash RPG with a first person touch to it.  There will be a number of unique elements but let's focus on the big ones.  Right now my team is dedicated to making an immersive environment, and creating combat the is not only rewarding and interactive, but fun and explosive.  I will dedicate myself to making combat what you once wanted as a kid, or most importantly one that you WILL come back to.What type of combat?most combat will be held in a first person view with the main player controlling powerful hero characters with some unique hack-n-slash combat.  Secondary combat will take place in a real time strategy base Over-The-World Camera Perspective.  The King/Queen, YOU the player, giving orders to Troops or militia to Attack, Defend, or Retreat to or from a position on the map.  Rally points will also be an option to be setting for your troops, but don’t forget your hero, who will be the difference maker as far as combat goes.Why Hack-N-Slash?Have you ever sat back as your units attack the enemy, but wanted to jump into combat and turn the tide of the battle yourself.  Well this will allow you just that.  Take up your hero(custom made by you the player) and your weapons and skills of choice to take on combat like we have yet to see in a video game.  This type of combat will also be really fun in my opinion.  Ever since I played games that had medieval combat, I fell in love, but there wasn't enough progression.What Progression will there be?If you look at some great games over the past 10 years, they had progression.  Whether it was a skill tree, or it was loot, they allowed you to feel like you were growing.  There will be lots of growing in this.  From customizing your castle's abilities, to outfitting your player with special abilities fit for your play style.



Marcus Trujillo

http://greentowelgaming.blogspot.com/
I was born into a tech family.  My father was an IT guru since before i was born, and has passed most of his knowledge on to me.  I built my first computer when i was about 7, and was playing old SNES side scrollers with my father since i was about 5.  I have loved video games and have played them since then.  It was never enough though.  Over the past 3 years i have been engrossed in learning about games, how they are made, and in turn have seen many come to life.  From classics like mario, to some lesser known like titan quest.  Each game holds a special place in the industry, and now that I have a dedicated and talented team of developers, we can finally make a mark on this amazing industry.
Green Towel Gaming, and DeThrone are two of my latest ventures.  My leadership and guidance in this game will be something probably a little different than most people are used to.  I enjoy taking input from my developers as well as others outside us to help make a more complete game.  So far, the work we have completed has been small compared to the grand scheme of things, but it is a lot considering the amount of time actually put into this.  We do our work fast and efficiently, but most importantly we love what we do.
Gary "Embershard" KinseyBlogger Address - http://embershardsdethroneblog.blogspot.com/                                  (My DeThrone Progress Blog) 
From a young age, I've always been enamored by video games.  It always amazed me how developers could create an entirely new, living world from nothing.  Now, I'm on the front lines of that world creation, and it is an amazing feeling indeed, giving birth to another place.  Art has always been a passion of mine, so when I began 3D modeling, I was able to combine two loves and complete both at the same time.  I've been modeling for the past 5 years, mostly creating mods for myself, and the Steam community.  This year, I've been invited to work on a few projects for developers, and it has been a blast.  Lately, I've been working with Green Towel Gaming, on a start up project to develop a game, as well as working with Eleon game studios on their project "Empyrion".  I hope to keep driving toward development of a complete game, because, games, I love em. 







Tier 1: $50,000
Basic Package- Basic funding of this project  guarantees a finished game, at least one environment, two classes, basic character interaction and castle development, and simple progression mechanics.  Funding to this point will ensure that the game gets built.  My time will be dedicated to the project.
Reward::Hand sculpted environments, with each bush/bunch of grass/rock placed in such a way as to create a unique, ambient play area.  This amount will allow me to dedicate all my time to creating a game I am proud of.
What the money will do for us::This funding is the bare minimum in order to fund myself to get the project done.
Tier 2: $70,000
Reward::Cohesive models and textures, that bind the game world together. A number of unique environments that lend themselves to an immersive experience.
What the money will do for us::Will allow me and my team to purchase dedicated, high end systems and software to facilitate the creation of the games many assets and gameplay features. From 3ds max, to a top of the line custom built computer(Built by myself to save money), these are the tools we will need to speed the process along.
Tier 3: $90,000
Reward::Realistic physics and interaction in combat, as well as a deeper RPG feel to the games progression mechanics.  More story quest oriented gameplay, diverging from the basic go here, kill this, scenario.
What the money will do for us::This will allow me to hire the 3D artist full time for creating assets and models.
Tier 4:$110,000
Reward::Two more classes will be added to further diversify play styles.  Custom classes to create a hero character that best fits your play style, be it tanking, spell slinging, stealth/assassination, or ranged combat.
What the money will do for us::This will allow me to hire a dedicated, professional programmer to refine the database and scripting so the animations and features within the game run smoothly.
Tier 5: $130,000
Reward:: Rigorous playtesting, bug fixing, and optimization to facilitate gameplay on a wider array of computer specs.(Linux will be added to the platform list)
What the money will do for us::This will help us secure a permanent work space within my teams radius to ensure a professional work environment, free from everyday distractions, for optimized workflow and productivity.
Tier 6: $150,000
Reward:: Two more classes will be added and 4 or more custom made environments to battle in.  Deeper design of the castle and more customization of the battlements.
What the money will do for us:: This will allow us to continue development for longer, bringing the game closer toward a AAA quality release, which includes continued employment of the modellers and programmers.  
Tier 7: $170,000 (This will unlock another Vassal(Tier 8))
Reward:: A town to interact with between matches that is tailored to the medieval style.  Visit your favorite shops to buy and sell and trade goods and upgrade your equipment for your next battle.
What the money will do for us:We will be able to dive deeper into the RPG aspects of the game allowing more progression and quests to accomplish along side the battle.
Tier 8: $220,000
Reward:: Pets!! You will be able to collect, be awarded, and even find pets that can help you in battle.  Want a wolf that has a healing howl, or a Panther that allows better stealth, this will now be possible!!
What the money will do for us: Adding content will be an ever growing task, so with this money we can hire talented content creators to make some amazing models, textures, and effects!
(Traveler)Tier 1: $5
-A tip of the hat to the good wanderer willing to donate to a good cause.
(Peasant)Tier 2: $10 Early Bird Special(Limit of 500)
-A copy of the game when fully finished and released.
(Farmer)Tier 3: $15 (Limit of 200)
-A copy of the game when fully finished and released, Exclusive access to our forum(Farmer Badge) and a Beta Copy of the game as soon as available.
(Militia)Tier 4: $20
-A copy of the game when fully finished and released, Exclusive access to our forum(Militia Badge) and a Beta Copy of the game as soon as available.
(Merchant)Tier 5: $25
-Previous Tiers that apply(Merchant Forum Badge), A bonus copy of the game to share with a friend.  We will also reward a custom made “Merchant Hat” to equip on your character, only for backers.
(Craftsman)Tier 6: $45
-Previous Tiers that apply(Craftsman Forum Badge),A Craftsman Hat, and a special place in our forum and website dedicated to our amazing community members like you!
(Knight)Tier 7: $75
-Previous Tiers that apply(Knight Forum Badge),
(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)
-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name 2 weapons of your choice for your Castle Inventory.
(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)
-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name 2 Classes of your choice for your Castle.
(Vassal)Tier 8: $100(Limit of 100)
-Previous Tiers that apply(Vassal Forum Badge), Name Your Castle whatever it is you choose.
(Noble)Tier 9:$150
-Previous Tiers that apply(Noble Forum Badge), All three of the exclusive rewards of the Vassal Tier.
(Noble)Tier 9: $150
-Previous Tiers(Clergy Forum Badge), Access to 3 more custom class slots.
(Clergy)Tier 10: $200(Limit of 30)
-Previous Tiers(Noble Forum Badge), a Custom weapon skin for the hero's weapons. Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.
(Monarch)Tier 11: $500(Limit of 15)
-Previous Tiers that apply(Monarch Forum Badge), A Custom Player Skin for a hero of your choice. Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.
(Prince/Princess)Tier 12: $1000
-Previous Tiers that apply(Prince/Princess Forum Badge) Work Directly with us to create a unique asset in the game(weapon or character)  Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.
(King)Tier 13: $2500
-Previous Tiers that apply(King Forum Badge)PETS!! You will get your very own pet of your choice that can be further customized in game to fit the behavior of your liking.  Also all future DLC published for DeThrone.
(Deity)Tier 14: $5000(Limit of 10)-You Get Everything, from a Custom Made Deity Forum Badge, Custom Pet, Custom Armor and Character, Naming of Everything, 2 Custom weapons,  also all future DLC published for DeThrone.

story:
Hi Guys,

GCoin is a cryptocurrency like Bitcoin with a much lower value but with a

lot of space to grow. It's been around for over a year. GCoin Bubbles is our

new arcade game. It's finished and will be ready to download within days.

It's our fourth game. You can personalize GCoin Bubbles with your own 

pictures for extra fun. It's a free Android app from the Play store.

We want to raise $1000 to maintain and promote GCoin Bubbles with your 

help. When you win at GCoin Bubbles you win GCoin instead

of just points. You can save them or spend them on electronics.

More details are at www.gcoin.us

Now uploaded at the Play Store 

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=c...

Many Thanks

Best

Greg

story:
SKY UNLIMITED« – Himmel ohne Grenzen

Der Aeroclub Nordrhein - Westfalen setzt Zeichen.

Die Ballonsportjugend macht mit!

Aus http://www.aeroclub-nrw.de/sky-unlimited/ :

"Nicht erst seit Reinhard Meys »Über den Wolken« verbinden wir den Luftsport mit grenzenloser Freiheit. Schon immer haben wir Grenzen überwunden und Neues ­erkundet, haben unüberwindbare Höhen gemeistert und unvorstellbare Strecken bewältigt. Unser Hobby ist ein Privileg und eine Aufgabe zugleich. Nur gemeinsam erreichen wir die schönsten Ziele, überwinden Grenzen und schließen Freundschaften. Jeder Segelflug ist anders, jeder Fallschirmsprung aufregend und jede Ballonfahrt ein Abenteuer ins Unbekannte. Wir Luftsportler tragen die grenzenlose Freiheit im Herzen. Für Ausgrenzung und Gewalt ist kein Platz.

Die gegenwärtigen gesellschaftlichen Ereignisse zeigen ein anderes Bild von dem, was wir Luftsportler leben und lieben. Ausgrenzung, Hass, Fremdenfeindlichkeit prägen die Medien. In den Köpfen der Menschen herrscht die Angst vor Unbekanntem. Grenzen im Kopf führen zu Ausgrenzung und Gewalt.

Zeig uns, dass du als Luftsportler diese Werte in dir trägst! Schnapp dir Freunde, Flugzeuge, Ballone, Fallschirm, Modellflugzeuge und eine Kamera, dreht gemeinsam ein Video oder schießt Fotos und seid kreativ! Positioniert euch gegen Fremdenfeindlichkeit und steht für Vielfalt und Toleranz im Luftsport!"


Um diese Idee weiter zu tragen, möchte die Ballonsportjugend auf Europa´s größten Ballonfestival in Frankreich "Flagge zeigen".

Unterstützt die Ballonsportjugend um Banner und Aufkleber drucken zu können, die an Ballone verteilt werden und am Korb hängend inmitten hunderter Ballone das Motto verbreiten. Wir wollen ein tolles Bild erzeugen und möglichst viele mit Bannern ausstatten. Außerdem sollen diese noch in diesem Jahr auf möglichst vielen Ballonevents "getragen" werden. Helft uns, der Ballonsportjugend, "Flagge" zu zeigen.

story:
Download Demo!

Loria is Classic RTS game inspired by the golden era of strategy games and a love of the classic Warcraft series. Loria aims to take the best concepts from the RTS classics and create a modern user-experience, intelligent AI, smooth controls, pleasing visuals and many hours of quality content that present even experienced players with an honest challenge!

The Game introduces a lot of new ideas and plenty of RPG elements. Some examples are quest driven missions, heroes, veteran units and a focus on decision making that affects each playthrough!

Giving the game replay-value is very important for us and we think that great story telling, hours of fun gameplay, dozens of hidden easter eggs and engaging quests is the way to achieve this!

Platforms: PC, OS X, Linux
Estimated Delivery: January 2018

Features & Goals:

Levelable Heroes

Your hero will progress and evolve through the game along with your own skills. Collecting powerful items, learning new abilities and accomplishing quests. Heroes will become the heart of your army, leading your soldiers towards the battle!

Veteran Units

Units are promoted to veterans as a result of combat experience. Your units can be promoted several times, gaining special ability and increasing their skills & attributes. If you manage to keep your soldiers alive long enough, you will get one badass squad of veterans, slicing through your enemies like knife through a butter.

Secrets & Easter eggs & Fun!

The main story lines in Loria will be serious and well written. However, we are planning to add plenty of easter eggs, jokes and hidden quest-lines for you to find. All with the intent of lightening the mood and bringing something unexpected into the game. We are going to create a colorful palette of surprises for you. There will not be a dull moment in land of Loria!

Improved AI

90s classics were great for their time. Unfortunately due to hardware limitations, the AI was usually rather boring and predictable. We want to create an intelligent AI system that can surprise you, react to your tactics and present even experienced players with an honest challenge!

Improved Controls

One of our goals is to make sure that the gameplay feels smooth and polished. We are adding plenty of shortcuts, features allowing you to group, command and interact with both your units and the world in an intuitive and seamless way. No more clunky controls!

RPG Elements

We have already introduced many RPG elements to the game - hero units, collecting beneficial items, reactive environments and quest lines that can be completed only with your hero. But we are just getting started! There are plenty of ideas waiting to be implemented.

Decision Making

Do you enjoy games where your decisions actually matter? Where you can decide to finish a quest line in more than one way, and based upon that decision, gain different allies or objectives? We do. And we certainly want to implement this feature into Loria. The story will not limit you to just one path!

Strong Story

It is one of the hardest goals to make enthralling and interesting story. However it still is one of the main goals We are hoping to achieve. Most of the funding will be spent towards writing a good story that people will enjoy and get invested in!

Multiple Environments

Plenty of asset kits are being prepared to create many unique environments. So that the battlefields, dungeons and forests never feel dull. There will be always something new and beautiful to look at!

Well all that talking about how great the game will be made me thirst for some action! Can I actually see some gameplay?

Well yes, strange voice in my head! You can.
There is already couple of gameplay reviews and you can find the most comprehensive one in the video below:

There is also a demo mission, which is free to download at Official website!

How Will We Spend The Money

Indiegogo & Rewards

Only 5% is dedicated to indiegogo - which is standard indiegogo fee. Though it is common to give out plenty of physical rewards, our first and last interest is the game itself. Physical rewards are limited to minimum, so most of the funding is savored towards making the game top-notch. And time saved towards developing the game, instead of packaging and other busy work related to creating physical rewards. We are sure that great game is the best reward for chipping in for our funding.

Graphics

Most of the funding will be spent on graphics, so Loria can be the prettiest classic RTS ever! Plenty of gorgeous animations, spells and unit variations, but also many easter egg animations and colorful environments. We want to make sure that Loria will be graphically flawless and also fun to watch! All the graphic sprites are hand drawn and it is a lot of work!

See this examples below to fully appreciate the amount of detail required

 




Music & SFX

SFX and music will be as accurate to the 90s style as possible. We have been in contact with a few great voice actors and freelance composers that want to contribute to our project. A part of the funding will be dedicated to pick the right person to compose the music. As we feel that an original soundtrack is vital for achieving the atmosphere.

Story

Among the best things that we remember about classic games was the story. If the story is well written and executed, it makes the game enthralling and thus gives it replay-value.We will be dedicating a significant amount of the project's finances to storywriting in order to achieve this.

Development

Well wait, what about development? Is 15% of funding enough? Since this is our love child, we have decided to develop the game without paying any salaries, ensuring that there will always be enough funds to cover all the other requirements, like story, music and art! All the development money will be spent on independent testers and quality assurance.

You can see how regular development day on Loria looks like on illustration below:



25k - Basic Goal

  • 2 campaigns ( 1 per faction )
  • 3 unique heroes per faction
  • 8 missions per faction ( minimum )
  • Skirmish mode with at least 10 maps
  • 5 various environments - Chaos, Summer, Winter, Badlands, Dungeon
  • 8 buildings per race - 10 units per race - composed of ships, flying units and ground units

30k - Art Perfection

We will bring another level of detail to all of the characters! This process is long and tedious, but it is worth it!

You can see example of polished units below.

With an extended budget for art, many more unit variations can be created & tested, to give the game more diversity.

35k - Multiplayer

Multiplayer will be a lot of work to implement, so it is not a part of the basic goal. The reason for this is that we want to primarily focus on Loria's campaigns. However, even if this funding goal is not reached - we will explore ways of adding multiplayer once first goal is reached and game starts earning some money, so the game will be able to pay for multiplayer itself.

45k - New Faction

What can make a game more interesting than adding another race! Once this goal is reached, we will create a unique new race with accompanying campaign and of course include it in the multiplayer & skirmish game modes. But what race will be added? The community decides!

55k - Co-op Campaign

Unfortunately, many modern RTS games do not include co-op campaigns. We love being able to play with our friends and will thus add this functionality upon reaching this goal.
Co-op campaign will be designed for 2 players.

80k - Free To Play

At this point we believe that we have more-than-accomplished our vision for Loria. Since there is no reason for additional funding, the game will be released free for all RTS fans to enjoy!

100k - Codes are Released

We will release the game source, so we all can look forward to playing more quality 2D RTS games! This will enable anyone to create their own strategy with Loria’s engine!

Every couple of years, I like to replay all of my childhood classics. And my Warcraft 1 playthrough was long overdue. So I installed the game excited to feel the same way as when I was a child. But due to various software issues and latter UI, AI and controls problems with warcraft 1 it felt more like a hard work to play the game! So I ended up watching a playthrough on youtube instead. It was great and it did bring a lot of good memories to the surface.

At some point through watching the gameplay, there was a spark. I wanted to create my own game - Loria, which will bring out the best of the RTS classics, but improving on the tedious gameplay and AI.

Sure, Loria is heavily inspired by Warcraft series. When one says classic RTS, I immediately think of warcraft. It has had a great influence over how I think of classic RTS games. So you can surely see the influence it has over me and thus Loria. But I am also hoping to bring so much more to Loria, not just clone an existing game. You can read more about that in the ‘About' section of this page.

Any Donation

You will receive BIG thank you from us!
Not enough huh?
Ok then, your name will be also listed on the in-game 'Donations' screen. The order & size of your name ( or logo - above 100$) will be determined by size of the donation.

10$ Art Collection

You will get a collection of various pieces of art, early sketches, characters that did not make it into game, different unit variations, or briefing screens. Art pieces that were not published before!
+ All of the previous

15$ Digital Copy of Game

Once the game is published you will receive a copy digitally
+ All of the previous

25$ Early Access

Be one of the first to play and experience the story of Loria.
+ All of the previous

50$ All The Future Expansions

The plans and hopes for Loria are big. If everything goes as planned, there will be plenty of expansion ahead. For contribution of this size, you don't have to worry about paying for any of them.
+ All of the previous

100$ Digital Copy of All The Games

You will get all the Loria games, expansions and any other games we will create after Loria!
+ All of the previous

150$ Name NPC

There will be plenty of NPC characters, involved in quest lines and you get to name one!
+ All of the previous

200$ Write Phrase for Character

Each unit and NPC have their own nature - from lazy peasants, through grumpy swordsmen to sadistic necromancers. And to render this nature to full, there will be plenty of phrases and jokes that character will be able to say. You get to add one of these. See the video for examples.
+ All of the previous

250$ Design a Quest

There will be plenty of missions and each mission should have at least one side quest! Now you can create one of these quests!
+ All of the previous

500$ Special Reward

If you feel specially generous, we will contact you and make sure you get your fair reward. We will contact you and see what your heart desires to see in Loria!
+ All of the previous



Loria is created in classic top-down view. All the art you can see is drawn by hand and animated manually. Frame by frame, animations are created and customized for each character, to allow for truly unique visual experience.

Loria uses vivid but not intrusive or distracting colors. Creating truly pleasant and balanced view on the game.

Loria was inspired from graphics of Warcraft 1, however Loria offers higher resolution of sprites, clear definition of features and hint of 3D perception of space.

Even with the wallpapers and portraits Loria stays authentic. The wallpapers are done in low resolution - 480x320 and are made as pixelart. Then in-game, the wallpaper is stretched to fit appropriate size, thus giving you the right feeling of 90s classic.













Voice Acting

Most of the Loria voice acting, was bought from various asset sites. After releasing the first demo, We got lucky enough to be contacted by few talented voice actors. New phrases, texts and voice recordings are added each day and voice palette of Loria is starting to fill out nicely.


SFX

Loria is also supported by professional studio blazy.sk. You can listen to excerpt from the SFX that is currently in progress below

Music





Loria started out as a small after-job hobby almost a year ago. And from the beginning there was just me, one person doing all the coding. The initial idea of the game was much more simple than it is today. Create really small RTS, for personal benefit and pure joy of creation.

With time I started to perceive the project more and more seriously, hiring artist to do all the sprites, searching for right voice recordings, buying and combining right assets. And as the game started to get more clear and specific shape, I knew I want to finish the game for general public. I fell in love with the idea. Released first demo and the response was fantastic. The feeling of satisfaction, that people like something you created with your own resources and wits, was exhilarating.

So here I am, with product I would love the spread, but with plenty of sprites, audio and screenwriting & art required. Too many for myself to fund. And I am asking for help, to let me create game that can be enjoyed by thousands of classic RTS fans.

Don't have any money to spare ?

Worry not, me neither! But if you still want to contribute to make this game happen. Be sure to spread the word!

Also I am currently looking for writers and music composers and voice actress. So if you have any of those skills, be sure to contact :)

Contact through website

If you manage to keep your soldiers alive long enough, you will get one badass squad of veterans, slicing through your enemies like knife through a butter.Secrets & Easter eggs & Fun!The main story lines in Loria will be serious and well written. However, we are planning to add plenty of easter eggs, jokes and hidden quest-lines for you to find. All with the intent of lightening the mood and bringing something unexpected into the game. We are going to create a colorful palette of surprises for you. There will not be a dull moment in land of Loria!Improved AI90s classics were great for their time. Unfortunately due to hardware limitations, the AI was usually rather boring and predictable. We want to create an intelligent AI system that can surprise you, react to your tactics and present even experienced players with an honest challenge!Improved ControlsOne of our goals is to make sure that the gameplay feels smooth and polished. We are adding plenty of shortcuts, features allowing you to group, command and interact with both your units and the world in an intuitive and seamless way. No more clunky controls!RPG ElementsWe have already introduced many RPG elements to the game - hero units, collecting beneficial items, reactive environments and quest lines that can be completed only with your hero. But we are just getting started! There are plenty of ideas waiting to be implemented.Decision MakingDo you enjoy games where your decisions actually matter? Where you can decide to finish a quest line in more than one way, and based upon that decision, gain different allies or objectives? We do. And we certainly want to implement this feature into Loria. The story will not limit you to just one path!Strong StoryIt is one of the hardest goals to make enthralling and interesting story. However it still is one of the main goals We are hoping to achieve. Most of the funding will be spent towards writing a good story that people will enjoy and get invested in!Multiple EnvironmentsPlenty of asset kits are being prepared to create many unique environments. So that the battlefields, dungeons and forests never feel dull. There will be always something new and beautiful to look at!Well all that talking about how great the game will be made me thirst for some action! Can I actually see some gameplay?Well yes, strange voice in my head! You can.There is already couple of gameplay reviews and you can find the most comprehensive one in the video below:There is also a demo mission, which is free to download at Official website!How Will We Spend The MoneyIndiegogo & RewardsOnly 5% is dedicated to indiegogo - which is standard indiegogo fee. Though it is common to give out plenty of physical rewards, our first and last interest is the game itself. Physical rewards are limited to minimum, so most of the funding is savored towards making the game top-notch. And time saved towards developing the game, instead of packaging and other busy work related to creating physical rewards. We are sure that great game is the best reward for chipping in for our funding.GraphicsMost of the funding will be spent on graphics, so Loria can be the prettiest classic RTS ever! Plenty of gorgeous animations, spells and unit variations, but also many easter egg animations and colorful environments. We want to make sure that Loria will be graphically flawless and also fun to watch! All the graphic sprites are hand drawn and it is a lot of work!See this examples below to fully appreciate the amount of detail required Music & SFXSFX and music will be as accurate to the 90s style as possible. We have been in contact with a few great voice actors and freelance composers that want to contribute to our project. A part of the funding will be dedicated to pick the right person to compose the music. As we feel that an original soundtrack is vital for achieving the atmosphere.StoryAmong the best things that we remember about classic games was the story. If the story is well written and executed, it makes the game enthralling and thus gives it replay-value.We will be dedicating a significant amount of the project's finances to storywriting in order to achieve this.DevelopmentWell wait, what about development? Is 15% of funding enough? Since this is our love child, we have decided to develop the game without paying any salaries, ensuring that there will always be enough funds to cover all the other requirements, like story, music and art! All the development money will be spent on independent testers and quality assurance.You can see how regular development day on Loria looks like on illustration below:25k - Basic Goal
2 campaigns ( 1 per faction )
3 unique heroes per faction
8 missions per faction ( minimum )
Skirmish mode with at least 10 maps
5 various environments - Chaos, Summer, Winter, Badlands, Dungeon
8 buildings per race - 10 units per race - composed of ships, flying units and ground units
30k - Art PerfectionWe will bring another level of detail to all of the characters! This process is long and tedious, but it is worth it!You can see example of polished units below.With an extended budget for art, many more unit variations can be created & tested, to give the game more diversity.35k - MultiplayerMultiplayer will be a lot of work to implement, so it is not a part of the basic goal. The reason for this is that we want to primarily focus on Loria's campaigns. However, even if this funding goal is not reached - we will explore ways of adding multiplayer once first goal is reached and game starts earning some money, so the game will be able to pay for multiplayer itself.45k - New FactionWhat can make a game more interesting than adding another race! Once this goal is reached, we will create a unique new race with accompanying campaign and of course include it in the multiplayer & skirmish game modes. But what race will be added? The community decides!55k - Co-op CampaignUnfortunately, many modern RTS games do not include co-op campaigns. We love being able to play with our friends and will thus add this functionality upon reaching this goal.Co-op campaign will be designed for 2 players.80k - Free To PlayAt this point we believe that we have more-than-accomplished our vision for Loria. Since there is no reason for additional funding, the game will be released free for all RTS fans to enjoy!100k - Codes are ReleasedWe will release the game source, so we all can look forward to playing more quality 2D RTS games! This will enable anyone to create their own strategy with Loria’s engine!Every couple of years, I like to replay all of my childhood classics. And my Warcraft 1 playthrough was long overdue. So I installed the game excited to feel the same way as when I was a child. But due to various software issues and latter UI, AI and controls problems with warcraft 1 it felt more like a hard work to play the game! So I ended up watching a playthrough on youtube instead. It was great and it did bring a lot of good memories to the surface.At some point through watching the gameplay, there was a spark. I wanted to create my own game - Loria, which will bring out the best of the RTS classics, but improving on the tedious gameplay and AI.Sure, Loria is heavily inspired by Warcraft series. When one says classic RTS, I immediately think of warcraft. It has had a great influence over how I think of classic RTS games. So you can surely see the influence it has over me and thus Loria. But I am also hoping to bring so much more to Loria, not just clone an existing game. You can read more about that in the ‘About' section of this page.Any DonationYou will receive BIG thank you from us!Not enough huh?Ok then, your name will be also listed on the in-game 'Donations' screen. The order & size of your name ( or logo - above 100$) will be determined by size of the donation.10$ Art CollectionYou will get a collection of various pieces of art, early sketches, characters that did not make it into game, different unit variations, or briefing screens. Art pieces that were not published before!+ All of the previous15$ Digital Copy of GameOnce the game is published you will receive a copy digitally+ All of the previous25$ Early AccessBe one of the first to play and experience the story of Loria.+ All of the previous50$ All The Future ExpansionsThe plans and hopes for Loria are big. If everything goes as planned, there will be plenty of expansion ahead. For contribution of this size, you don't have to worry about paying for any of them.+ All of the previous100$ Digital Copy of All The GamesYou will get all the Loria games, expansions and any other games we will create after Loria!+ All of the previous150$ Name NPCThere will be plenty of NPC characters, involved in quest lines and you get to name one!+ All of the previous200$ Write Phrase for CharacterEach unit and NPC have their own nature - from lazy peasants, through grumpy swordsmen to sadistic necromancers. And to render this nature to full, there will be plenty of phrases and jokes that character will be able to say. You get to add one of these. See the video for examples.+ All of the previous250$ Design a QuestThere will be plenty of missions and each mission should have at least one side quest! Now you can create one of these quests!+ All of the previous500$ Special RewardIf you feel specially generous, we will contact you and make sure you get your fair reward. We will contact you and see what your heart desires to see in Loria!+ All of the previousLoria is created in classic top-down view. All the art you can see is drawn by hand and animated manually. Frame by frame, animations are created and customized for each character, to allow for truly unique visual experience.Loria uses vivid but not intrusive or distracting colors. Creating truly pleasant and balanced view on the game.Loria was inspired from graphics of Warcraft 1, however Loria offers higher resolution of sprites, clear definition of features and hint of 3D perception of space.Even with the wallpapers and portraits Loria stays authentic. The wallpapers are done in low resolution - 480x320 and are made as pixelart. Then in-game, the wallpaper is stretched to fit appropriate size, thus giving you the right feeling of 90s classic.Voice ActingMost of the Loria voice acting, was bought from various asset sites. After releasing the first demo, We got lucky enough to be contacted by few talented voice actors. New phrases, texts and voice recordings are added each day and voice palette of Loria is starting to fill out nicely.SFXLoria is also supported by professional studio blazy.sk. You can listen to excerpt from the SFX that is currently in progress belowMusicLoria started out as a small after-job hobby almost a year ago. And from the beginning there was just me, one person doing all the coding. The initial idea of the game was much more simple than it is today. Create really small RTS, for personal benefit and pure joy of creation.With time I started to perceive the project more and more seriously, hiring artist to do all the sprites, searching for right voice recordings, buying and combining right assets. And as the game started to get more clear and specific shape, I knew I want to finish the game for general public. I fell in love with the idea. Released first demo and the response was fantastic. The feeling of satisfaction, that people like something you created with your own resources and wits, was exhilarating.So here I am, with product I would love the spread, but with plenty of sprites, audio and screenwriting & art required. Too many for myself to fund. And I am asking for help, to let me create game that can be enjoyed by thousands of classic RTS fans.Don't have any money to spare ?Worry not, me neither! But if you still want to contribute to make this game happen. Be sure to spread the word!Also I am currently looking for writers and music composers and voice actress. So if you have any of those skills, be sure to contact :)Contact through website

story:
Aries puts you in the head of a mighty space empire in a dark galaxy! Lead your empire through the campaign map and take command of your armies and fleets in the battle maps. With three planed factions at lanch each having unique abilities, troops, and tech Aries will keep you engaged through many playthroughs.

Aries primary developer is Edward Roscoe, an experienced developer at Codemasters, and he is being assisted by a collection of freelancers. He has been self-funding the game up until now, but is looking to get help with the development of new art and support with some programming elements.

 

 

 

 

Here you will make war and peace, direct your armies movements, and manage the solar systems you command. Through careful planning and shrewd diplomacy, you will be able to paint the heavens with your colours. Aries features an extensive tech tree that will allow you to develop your technological, military, and civil might.

 

 

 

When moving your armies to conquer or defend systems, your army might be engaged by enemy forces in the depths of space. In space, you must trust in your mighty warships. During the space battles, you will need to outmanoeuvre and out firepower your enemies to conquer the void.

Space battles are deadly, and if you have focused on your ground troops to much, you might be better retreating and attempting to find a way to outmanoeuvre the enemy forces. If you have a great and powerful space fleet, then use this to deny your enemies an opportunity to land their troops and strangle the life out of their empire!

 

 

 

Once you arrive at a system bringing it to compliance is no small feat, you will need all of your skills as a commander to conquer this new territory. You will be presented with an option of missions you can launch against a system to increase your control of the system if you are victorious.

Beware the garrisons of systems as they will not be easily removed from their homes! During the defenders turn they can launch missions to try and weaken the invader's grip on the system and even throw them back into the dark depths of space!

 

 

 

At launch, we plan on having three factions all with unique styles and units. The first faction and the only one playable at the moments is the planetary guard, their style is that of WW1 steampunk, and they focus on heavy weapons. Next, we have the knightly orders, plated in heavy armour and obsessed with ancient Arthurian legends, and these warriors excel in close combat. Finally, we have the Mech cult, who use advanced machinery gifted to them through dark rituals to elder things.

There are plans for alien races, but that is likely to be after launch unless we can raise considerably more than we have set as a target.

 

 

 

It might be tempting to leave back the game until it is launched, but there are three great reasons to back now!

  1. By backing now you will gain access to it before anyone else in the world. When we launch early access next year we want to reward the people that championed this game, as such we will make sure you get a copy at least a month before anyone else.
  2. You will get the game cheaper than you will at early access launch and at the official launch. Save future you some money now!
  3. All the money you pledge will be put into making the game great at a time when it is most needed. A £1 pledged today has a massive impact on what we can do.

 

 

 

Up until this point, the game has been self-funded, and I have been the only person working on the game except for a few freelancers that helped from time to time. I now need your help to turn this game into something great!

  • We need to add in the rest of the units and environments, and if I can hire a 3d artist, this will make the end product much better.
  • We need to bug fix, this is a huge time sink, and if I could work on it full time, the results would be better and done faster.
  • We need to polish the game; things such as camera movements and UI need significant work to make them smooth and easy to use.
  • Balanced the gameplay, this is a key to making the game fun, and I can do a better job of it if I could work on it full time.
  • I would love to add multiplayer, and I have built the game to support it, but to get it to work, I need your support.
  • I want to have an AI that has a neural network component so that it adapts to how players play, this is a massive project, and I don't think I can do it without working on the game full time. 

 

 

 

To consider the game at an Alpha state, I want to make sure that all of the fundamental features are in place. Once we have hit Alpha, it would be possible to play a game from start to finish, even if it is a little rough in places. I am happy to say Aries is nearly there with the only work remaining to tie up the different game modes, so they play together nicely.

Alpha roadmap features:

  • Campaign map: The campaign map will serve as the home of your grand strategy and will be a place for you to build up your army and the systems under your control. By the end of Alpha, the campaign map will allow you to manage all of your planets, build armies, engage in battles, and have hazards for your army to avoid[Done]
  • General features: All the general features you would expect in a game, this includes a comprehensive options menu, save and load system, and patch installer.[Done]
  • Research: The research trees will have been fully implemented but may change subject to balancing. [Done]
  • AI: The AI is a vital part of any strategy game, and we want to make sure ours is a stand out AI that challenges players with smart decisions and not through arbitrary boosts. In Alpha, we want to have our AI making some reasonable calls and to be ready to be updated to use machine learning in Beta.[The AI is a little dumb but puts up a fight]
  • Battles: We want to be able to play space and ground battles by the end of Alpha, but the AI and balancing of units will likely need significant work in Beta and on the road to launch.[Both fleet and land battles work]

Once Alpha is done, we will start work towards Beta and early access. In this period the key focus will be on adding the rest of the units, improving the AI, improving the animations, and making the controls and UI easy to use (Custom Key Bindings!!!). Alongside fleshing out the game and developing this technology, there will also be a lot of balancing of gameplay to be done.

 

 

 

When will you get the game & how we will keep you up to date

Early access will begin in 2020, the current plan is for august but we will provide a confirmation in June and will keep you updated between now and then. While lots of games do very early access, I don't believe strategy games do well in them as under polished AI, and UI can be intensely frustrating. Given the current state of the game, I feel that the game should be in a reasonably polished and in an enjoyable state by the beginning of 2021.

Having backed many Kickstarters and IndieGoGo campaigns, I know the frustration of a silent creator. I will provide monthly updates on IndieDB, and will often tweet to let you know I am still alive and working on your game!

 

 

 

All of the significant challenges have been overcome, but the critical risk we face is that the game will fall short of what it could be.

  • The animation of units is currently very clunky when you zoom in, this is a result of us having to add in a custom animation solution to handle hundreds of troops on the screen at once. With your support, I can invest the time to polish the animation code and hire a 3d animator to improve the animations.
  • AI is a vital part of the game, and I want to add a neural network component to the games AI so that the difficulty can be based on the skill of the AI and not some arbitrary boost to unit strength. This is a large project, and while I have worked on neural networks before I cannot do this without dedicating an enormous amount of time to the project. 
  • Poor communications, I am terrible at keeping people up to date on what I am doing, so I have set a calendar reminder to poke me and make sure I update you! Also, feel free to tweet me.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for reading through this campaign, I understand that you might not be in a position to contribute, but you can still help, and it would be super appreciated.

  • If you can share this campaign with people you know, that would help immensely. 
  • If you can follow us on twitter or watch us on IndieDB that would also be awesome.
  • I am also always looking for feedback, so if you have any, please let me know.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
• First-person shooter
  • Community based
  • Realistic survival techniques
  • Realistic Graphics
  • Zombies, Sandbox Mode, Campaign
  • Unique gameplay
  • Windows and Mac


Who Is The Publisher & What Is This Game?

Hi!  Thank you very much for viewing this campaign!

I'm Serkan, a 19 year old boy from Germany who finished school last year and fell in love with online marketing in the gaming industry ever since due to my interest in gaming and being self employed. While I just got started with the usual social media marketing in the gaming niche, I quickly figured that releasing and marketing my own video games was super fun and promising for various reasons.

I started to publish pretty simple $0.99 games on Steam first and started to get my first contacts in this scene and a lot of useful knowledge. With my latest project "Combat Force" I can finally tell that I am ready to bring this game publishing passion onto a new level!

 



Combat Force will aim towards offering the end customer and unbelievable amount of value for the purchasing price of $3.99 (we will have a 25% launch discount for the first release week which means that the game will be available for $2.99 during that time)

It will offer a zombie survival mode with 2 awesome maps, various weapons and several features such as barricades, power-ups and upgrades/perks. Although the game can be compared to the Call of Duty Black Ops zombies mode, we will have a bunch of key differences which make it feel way different than the Call of Duty example. 

Aside from that, our goal is also to release a well-designed single player campaign which adds a deeper meaning to the zombie mode and also gives the game itself a story-line.

During the launch on Steam (on the 6th December) - the game will only have the zombie mode and sandbox mode but the mentioned single player campaign, multiplayer modes and various updates to the zombie and sandbox mode are scheduled.

The reason behind it is that I only have 1 developer working with me right now. His name is Matt and he is a 19 year old friend of mine who lives in the US. He is a fairly talented guy, especially for his age and also gets some help with map design and certain parts of the coding from his contacts. 

Now that we are less than 2 months away from the initial release on Steam, we start to find more and more graphical assets which would fit into the game well and improve it a lot and also start to realize how big of a deal a proper marketing campaign will be where I should definitely go all out.

Financing the game and a good marketing campaign on my own would lead to limitations and mediocre results, it would open up a worst case scenario where I would have to burn through my cash way too fast if many problems occur.

That's why I decided to host this Indiegogo campaign since it would be awesome to simply have a higher budget for the game development and just some kind of financial buffer/support from other's who genuinely believe in our idea or just feel generous. 

Once the zombie mode and single player campaign were updated and maintained well for a couple weeks or months and we were able to work well towards improvements with the help of community feedback, we will also start to implement an online multiplayer mode

YOU as a contributer would help me to master this game release since you would make it possible for us to significantly increase the game quality and also help out with a security buffer for us whenever unexpected expenses come up which involve Combat Force.

Also I came up with some creative ideas to reward contributors of this campaign with some special rewards such as free game copies and other cool gifts/perks!

 

 

 

Where the money will go and what you will get!
 

For the distribution of the raised money, me and my developer came up with a simple agreement:

  • 75% will straight up flow into game quality improvements which were the main goal of this campaign. With that being said, this money is used to increase our budget for ingame assets (such as textures, sounds and certain mechanics) and once we took care of that, the rest will most likely flow into other aspects like improving the Steam store page or into the general marketing budget
  • 25% goes to my developer as an additional payment since he is putting more time and effort into this project than we both expected so I would love to make it worth his time!

A list of various rewards for contributing to this campaign: 

  • Beta access copies to Combat Force for you and your friends!
  • Normal copies once Combat Force releases for you and your friends!
  • A special contributor role on our Discord server (https://discord.gg/Hpbfz5S)
  • Getting yourself a little easteregg inside of the game (like your name being displayed somewhere on the map)
  • Getting added to a contributors list which will be place on our Steam group discussions
  • A personal thank you!

 

Additional rewards for huge contributors:

  • A spot in the official game credits as "top contributors"
  • High priority contact with us including exclusive insights, a special involvement with the game and more!
     

The Impact you will make by supporting us!

By supporting my first big attempt to step into the game publisher industry you will become one of the early supporters who actively contributed to making this dream come true.

Without you this probably wouldn't be possible so I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart since every contributor or simply visitor of this campaign is highly appreciated! 

I'll never forget your help! 

 

Future goals and challenges

For the game release, quality improvements and general marketing we already have a good roadmap so we can assure that the raise money will be used as efficient as possible.

Once we had a fairly successful game launch, our next goal will be to interact with our community as good as possible and genuinely listen to our supporters and fans to properly maintain the game with regular fixes and updates which are appreciated by the player base!

To establish a perfect relation with our community, we have a Steam group and a Discord server for announcements and discussions and also plan on releasing a website with forums for Combat Force.

(Gives Special Player Bonuses)

Screenshots of The Last Hope

If you want to know how you can support us, here are some ideas:

  • Follow my publisher Studio on Steam to keep in touch with my games! https://store.steampowered.com/publisher/HaDeGames
  • Add Combat Force to your wishlist on Steam if you want! https://store.steampowered.com/app/1172430/Comb...
  • Share this campaign with your friends or social media followers!

Also make sure to check out Combat Force on Discord, Steam & Facebook!

story_txt:
First-person shooter
Community based
Realistic survival techniques
Realistic Graphics
Zombies, Sandbox Mode, Campaign
Unique gameplay
Windows and Mac


Who Is The Publisher & What Is This Game?
Hi!  Thank you very much for viewing this campaign!
I'm Serkan, a 19 year old boy from Germany who finished school last year and fell in love with online marketing in the gaming industry ever since due to my interest in gaming and being self employed. While I just got started with the usual social media marketing in the gaming niche, I quickly figured that releasing and marketing my own video games was super fun and promising for various reasons.
I started to publish pretty simple $0.99 games on Steam first and started to get my first contacts in this scene and a lot of useful knowledge. With my latest project "Combat Force" I can finally tell that I am ready to bring this game publishing passion onto a new level!
 



Combat Force will aim towards offering the end customer and unbelievable amount of value for the purchasing price of $3.99 (we will have a 25% launch discount for the first release week which means that the game will be available for $2.99 during that time)
It will offer a zombie survival mode with 2 awesome maps, various weapons and several features such as barricades, power-ups and upgrades/perks. Although the game can be compared to the Call of Duty Black Ops zombies mode, we will have a bunch of key differences which make it feel way different than the Call of Duty example. 
Aside from that, our goal is also to release a well-designed single player campaign which adds a deeper meaning to the zombie mode and also gives the game itself a story-line.
During the launch on Steam (on the 6th December) - the game will only have the zombie mode and sandbox mode but the mentioned single player campaign, multiplayer modes and various updates to the zombie and sandbox mode are scheduled.
The reason behind it is that I only have 1 developer working with me right now. His name is Matt and he is a 19 year old friend of mine who lives in the US. He is a fairly talented guy, especially for his age and also gets some help with map design and certain parts of the coding from his contacts. 
Now that we are less than 2 months away from the initial release on Steam, we start to find more and more graphical assets which would fit into the game well and improve it a lot and also start to realize how big of a deal a proper marketing campaign will be where I should definitely go all out.
Financing the game and a good marketing campaign on my own would lead to limitations and mediocre results, it would open up a worst case scenario where I would have to burn through my cash way too fast if many problems occur. 
That's why I decided to host this Indiegogo campaign since it would be awesome to simply have a higher budget for the game development and just some kind of financial buffer/support from other's who genuinely believe in our idea or just feel generous. 
Once the zombie mode and single player campaign were updated and maintained well for a couple weeks or months and we were able to work well towards improvements with the help of community feedback, we will also start to implement an online multiplayer mode
YOU as a contributer would help me to master this game release since you would make it possible for us to significantly increase the game quality and also help out with a security buffer for us whenever unexpected expenses come up which involve Combat Force.
Also I came up with some creative ideas to reward contributors of this campaign with some special rewards such as free game copies and other cool gifts/perks!
 
 
 

Where the money will go and what you will get! 
For the distribution of the raised money, me and my developer came up with a simple agreement:

75% will straight up flow into game quality improvements which were the main goal of this campaign. With that being said, this money is used to increase our budget for ingame assets (such as textures, sounds and certain mechanics) and once we took care of that, the rest will most likely flow into other aspects like improving the Steam store page or into the general marketing budget
25% goes to my developer as an additional payment since he is putting more time and effort into this project than we both expected so I would love to make it worth his time!

A list of various rewards for contributing to this campaign: 

Beta access copies to Combat Force for you and your friends!
Normal copies once Combat Force releases for you and your friends!
A special contributor role on our Discord server (https://discord.gg/Hpbfz5S)
Getting yourself a little easteregg inside of the game (like your name being displayed somewhere on the map)
Getting added to a contributors list which will be place on our Steam group discussions
A personal thank you!

 
Additional rewards for huge contributors:

A spot in the official game credits as "top contributors"
High priority contact with us including exclusive insights, a special involvement with the game and more! 



The Impact you will make by supporting us!
By supporting my first big attempt to step into the game publisher industry you will become one of the early supporters who actively contributed to making this dream come true.
Without you this probably wouldn't be possible so I would like to thank you from the bottom of my heart since every contributor or simply visitor of this campaign is highly appreciated! 
I'll never forget your help! 
 

Future goals and challenges
For the game release, quality improvements and general marketing we already have a good roadmap so we can assure that the raise money will be used as efficient as possible.
Once we had a fairly successful game launch, our next goal will be to interact with our community as good as possible and genuinely listen to our supporters and fans to properly maintain the game with regular fixes and updates which are appreciated by the player base!
To establish a perfect relation with our community, we have a Steam group and a Discord server for announcements and discussions and also plan on releasing a website with forums for Combat Force.

Screenshots of The Last Hope

Add Combat Force to your wishlist on Steam if you want! https://store.steampowered.com/app/1172430/Comb...

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/combatforceofficial

story:
Hello, my name is Alex Monfort Ferrer.

Randy & Manilla is a game project that for years I wanted to do it with the company of people dedicated to the indie sector of video games and art, and I would like to have a great support in Indiegogo so that it can become a reality to be able to develop this indie project that has occurred to me in the best way possible.

 

On the year 2142, In the mysterious interior of the quantum supercomputer created by Lambert Wilson, there is a cyber-universe surrounded by a brightly colored cubes called "Net-Cubes" that inside have a fantastic virtual worlds of pixelated structures, abstract and even in various ways. It is free from threats like hackers, cyber-spies and corporate and government organizations. But that doesn't mean that they have their own threats, such as the villain of the red Net-Cube, "Cracksom Virus" a dominant virus that puts all Net-Cubes in danger of being permanently eliminated to be able to expand his empire of computing corruption to the real world left by humans.

Then a message algorithm called "E-Mailer" arrives at the world of "Bloxland Qubitown", the home of Randy and Manilla, giving them an urgent notice that the entire cyber-universe is in a big danger of being destroyed by Cracksom, because he knows that they are the only ones who can stop their great threat, and they accepted the mission and they will embark on a great adventure about the different Net-Cubes, but E-Mailer will also accompany and open them portals to access the new worlds.

 

Randy Qubit Pix-It: Bold, somewhat brave and motivated. Their power ups are of fireballs and strength, which can remove obstacles and many enemies.

Manilla Von-It: The younger sister, cheerful, optimistic. Her power ups are speed, which can run, give quick attacks and mini-teleports that pass through glass walls and fences. In a few phases it will run similar to Sonic.

 

E-Mailer: The Messenger Algorithm that sends emails through all Net-cubes of the supercomputer. When he warns of a virus danger (such as Cracksom), he goes to alert Randy, Manilla or any other hero to motivate them to save Net-cubes from the impending disaster.

 

Each selectable Net-Cube of the game, represents and refers to a certain videogame genres (RPG, Platform, Arcade, Shooter, etc.), with distinctive colors compared to most (behind will be shown a screenshot of a very early prototype version of what it consists of).

 

 The two cubes in blue a little less clear, will possibly be the selectable worlds.

Upon entering inside of the Net-Cubes, they are also the entry to discover the worlds of its interior to that these game genres represent. Such for example Terra-Qubit, where the levels are of the platforms genre accompanied by a retro and pixelated mosaic aesthetic.

 

 

To better understand about its important role that represent the Net-Cubes for the game itself, I have made a short video about the alpha demo of the project.

In this you can make a free travel on the cyber-universe surrounded by Net-Cubes of various colors driving with a ship, when entering on the brown Net-Cube, the screen menu with the title of the world (Terra-Qubit) is activated as if it were another videogame inside it, going through an interactive stage of the map of the levels based on the gender of the platforms, in the first level (of the blue tile) the camera follows the character with a perspective similar to Super Mario 3D Land / 3D World, making reference to the 3D linear platforms. And the basic object for a platform game that helps follow the player, They are bright yellow cubes called "Net-Points" that when you pick them up, he get points that fill the score, and there is also a Power-Up that is activated at the right time to defeat enemies and reach the goal.

In the second example, the ship go through the Net-Cube of Wonder Race, The colorful racing Net-Cube where it represents the genre of racing and runner levels, where can we play as Manilla, starting a Test Level of a 3D speedy platformer with her power-ups that can collect, activate and use to defeat enemies, obstacles and go jump the cliffs, in addition to a challenging 2D Runner level with 3D Effect.

And in the last example, the ship go through the Net-Cube of Blacksquare Qubit-Battle, a dark place where it represents the shooter genre and high difficulty. When Randy step on a green tile, it take to a level with the basics of an FPS, with shooting fire & a first person camera which makes it seem like it feels like playing in the skin of the main character (a bit like Mirror Edges).

With these three examples you can give a better idea that the game is a multi-genre.

 

This indie game project, being partly multi-genre, it could host many classic game references, also the dark and post-apocalyptic origin on a supercomputer with Net-Cubes that stores memories of humanity before its extinction, may have some touch of Ready Player One, but taken to an even farther future, and several virtual environments would also have the simple and funny style of Wreck-It Ralph (specially by the main characters, and the game title its obvioulsy a reference).

 

The first version of the game (Pre-Alpha), was released in October 2019 made only by me, for the Alpha version in November of the same year, it has been developed with a group of 3 persons:

Alex Monfort Ferrer (Ofihombre)

From Gata de Gorgos (Spain)

Me, the creator, director, writer, designer and main programmer of the project.

 

Skyrider

Of Central Europe

Designer of 3D Models by Hobbie, He is the one who designed the Manilla and Venny Loopsuit models, and also fan-made models of Wreck-It Ralph and Hotel Transilvania.

 

Jake Gamelin (Donnie Rush)

From San Diego (California, USA)

Music composer, is who has composed the first 3 soundtracks of Randy & Manilla.

 

I loved creating this game, and that it is well known enough for much of the gaming communities.

The objective of this campaign is to obtain the necessary support and recognition so that the project could move forward to obtain a better and more advanced development result, and having these necessary parts fulfilled, the possibility of being put on sale will be opened.

Otherwise, if it fails to reach that goal, it would never reach that stage of development and recognition, or it will simply get more economical development materials with the funds obtained without having reached its goal.

Once the campaign has been successful, the work will be distributed in several of the important sections for the development of the game project, depending on its complexity and the time to complete:

And in case the campaign manages to exceed its objective, it would also have the possibility that the project may include additional elements that improve the details (such as better models and more advanced programming, extra modes, better distribution, animated short films for cutscenes, etc.).

 

There will be a perks for the sponsors who contribute the most in this project campaign that will be sent by email and download by the end of the campaign and the game demos for later shown in this image of bottom:

As an additional point, there will also be a unique and great physical reward for those who choose a larger contribution.

 

Your contribution can be very important for the Randy & Manilla project, it means an important step for the path to its success and to obtain a better quality of development, it would be something that can help a lot

Risks & Challenges

One of the problems that prevents me from making this project come true, is that if I don't get a sufficient number of sponsorships and donors of this campaign, the development of this project will never be completed, and not even be able to get the necessary development team sufficiently trained so that the development of the game project has the highest quality possible.

If I fail to beat these two challenges, this project would will run the risk of being paused or canceled. So, please, support me in making the development of this great Indie videogame project come true. It would be very helpful if your great support makes this project a reality and can overcome these obstacles.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this campaign but you don't want to contribute to it, don't forget to share with friends the campaign link from Facebook, Twitter or any other site with the hashtag #RandyandManilla.

 

If you like it much and want to know more about this videogame project, try & download the Alpha version of Randy & Manilla for PC in the nexts links:

IndieDB: 

Special Alpha:

 

 

itch.io: https://ofihombre.itch.io/randy-manilla

Indiexpo: 

 

Or follow me on:

Twitter: http://twitter.com/AlexMonfortfer1

Discord: https://discord.gg/UyacSFF
