story:
Short Summary

Crooked Deck is a regular deck of cards.... until it's not. In addition to the standard set of Jacks, Aces and Kings, we've added a few wild cards; a political version of Gin Rummy without the Gin. (Or with the gin... your choice) Like Gin Rummy, your goal is to get a set of four similar cards, i.e. four Kings, four “8’s”, etc. any card and a run of three such as 4, 5, 6, etc. Get one set of four and two runs of three and you lay down your cards. Bam! You’ve won your first “Primary.”

The game instantly takes a recognizable "political" turn with each card you draw because the wild cards will take your average gin rummy game and add a bit of good, old-fashioned corruption. For example, when you draw Clinton-the Woman Card, you steal any players card. Draw a Trump-the Wall Card and you block any players next turn.

The game was created by Doug Crowe and his international team of designers & marketers. Crowe is an unapologetic critic of politics and all around nice guy. We looked at Kickstarter, but those guys seemed a bit high-brow (...rules and all) so we chose Indiegogo. Anyway, we can't build this without you. In fact, there's a BIGGER play in mind. "Huge... Fantastic!"  More on that in a moment...

If you're into card games, politics or creating drinking games in the garage, please help us make this game a reality.  It's probably more important than voting... and much more interesting.

We promise to make fun of everyone, too...

-Doug & friends

What We Need & What You Get

  • The funds raised will go to getting our designer a real computer. "Seriously... ditch the PC, Ognen!" We will also use the funds for our support staff and legal team to make sure our irreverent humor wouldn't get us a visit from the secret service. "Hi guys!" Of course the bulk of the funds will go creating the actual game! Your perks!
  • We are starting with three (3) different card games. At the top of the list is our signature game, the Trump Deck in Putin red. Complete with a host of celebrities who have officially endorsed the candidate including Pete Rose, Dennis Rodman and others.

  • Next up, we are rolling out the Hillary Deck in Lewinsky blue dress. Her cards include celebrity endorsements such as Beyonce, George Clooney, Robert De Niro and her husband, Bill Clinton.

  • Third on the roster, is a personal favorite. Our the WTF Deck comes in royal purple, celebrating the dissolution of the 2-party system, cronyism, a bloated Federal government, the introduction of term limits and transparent accountability! Once all of that is accomplished, 100% of the profits will go to our unicorn ranch. 

We are confident we'll exceed our very modest goal. But hey, if for some reason we don't; we'll refund your perk. No problemo! which is a grammatically incorrect way of saying "no hay problema", although it becoming more common among the 11 Spanish speaking Trump supporters in the United States. "Look it up! I ripped that right from WikiHow."

Something for Everyone!

Listen, we know most people are not overly enthused about their choices. It seems there are more #NeverHillary or #NeverTrump people than all out raving fans for either candidate. We feel your frustration. (Still #feelthebern ?) 

That is why we designed 3 separate decks of cards to appease, please & insult everyone equally.

===========================

ADAPT THE GAME: If you really want to have fun, buy 2 decks. Use the Non-partisan deck box & insert the Trump Deck cards inside (for maximum right wing conspiracy power). Then, invite over all your friends from Berkeley and pretend to play with the Non-partisan deck. The "frothing Progressives" may tear out your liver in an expression of their tolerance and peace, but you'll never have more fun. Of course, if you actually went to Berkeley, do the same thing... just reverse the process: Use the Hillary deck cards and insert into the Non-partisan deck. Not sure if this will work. It may depend on how many NASCAR friends you actually have...

===========================

We are initially launching 3 separate playing card decks. Each deck is a complete set of playing cards and each deck also includes custom wild cards guaranteed to offend someone.

The "Trump" Deck

This deck is exclusively in English. The Patriot edition comes in "Putin" red.

The "Hillary" Deck

The "Hillary" Deck is in perfect health. Guaranteed to last more than 2 terms.

The "WTF Happened to our Country" Deck

Can't decide if you'll lose friends by having a "Hillary" or "Trump" deck of cards in the house? No worries. Get our Non-partisan "WTF Deck" in royal purple.

Collector's Edition

You know the golden rule? No... not the one your grandmother taught you... the real one.

"Whoever has the gold makes the rules!" 

Our collectors edition is an exclusive opportunity to get a 2-deck, collectible set. Select 2 decks of your choice and we'll print them on super-dee-duper plastic cards and put them in a gold foil case. This is a limited print run. Once printed, we will NOT print any more... ever. Seriously. I'm keeping one for my kids, after all...

"Will they worth something some day?"

Well, don't open the package, Johnny!

Certainly in 20 years, you can try to sell them on Pawn Stars XXI.

###

Backing this project won't do anything to swing votes or debug the malware in the voting machines. But, you can put a smile on the faces of your friends in an otherwise cantankerous election. Select a perk on the right and have fun!

Risks & Challenges

Are there risks with this? YES! The biggest risk in life is taking ourselves too seriously. While this election has certainly not delivered the best and brightest America has to offer, it certainly has created more INTEREST in politics and that might actually be a good thing in the long run.

Crooked Deck is not designed to influence the election, but it will bring a fun perspective to an otherwise depressing situation.

"Are there any other challenges? You know... like development or delivery?"

No.

The designs are all done and we will start shipping immediately! The only actual risk is treating this Indiegogo campaign like the Presidential campaign. Don't sit on the sidelines... pick a perk and let's deal!

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you creative? After looking over this campaign do you have an idea for your own game?  Cool! We'd love to hear from you. Drop us a line and share away.

If you don't have an idea, here's a few things to get the creative juices flowing!
(Crooked Deck idea contest with prizes coming soon!)

Isn't it Time to Share Some Political FUN?

From $2 to $5,000, Crooked Deck will be the most fun project you've ever backed. However, if even the $2 option is not for you, please share this campaign with your friends and on social media. Convince THEM to buy the game so you don't have to. They already know you're cheap... don't worry, they won't be shocked.

Indiegogo has some brain-dead simple sharing tools at the top, so click away and be that person who shares something cool.

Scroll up and choose your perk and put a smile on someone's face, starting with your own.

story:
Who are we & why are we here?

We are three students who share one childhood dream: to build our own games. Together we have set up our own indie game studio, and the Cublast adventure is our first big step towards making our dream reality.   

In the last months we have dedicated all our time and effort to developing Cublast. Unfortunately, hard work is not always enough. In order to make Cublast HD the best it can be, while actually surviving in the process, we are going to need some resources. 

With your support we can make sure that the game design is as smooth and polished as possible, we can create the most awesome soundtrack, AND we can avoid going homeless!

We want to develop this game more than anything, and you can help us make it happen!

So what is Cublast HD?

In 2015, we released our first mobile app, ‘Cublast’, a minimalistic modern arcade game to play on your phone. 350,000 downloads and a lot of positive feedback later, we have decided to take it to the next level with Cublast HD, a console version with many exciting new features. What stays the same is the foundation, which is best described with a horrible but wildly appropriate gaming cliché: easy to learn, but hard to master.  

Cublast HD is all about practicing your agility in a variety of challenging levels. Each level has a starting point and an exit. In order to complete a level you will have to jump, roll and bounce around to collect blast points. The more blast points collected, the higher your overall score. Sounds easy, right? Well, it is. At first. But every level-up means new obstacles and dangers that will test your skills. Expect frustration, expect fulfillment, but above all, expect some serious fun.

 

Cublast HD Features

Is there anything more fun than blasting cubes with friends? Team up and beat levels together or battle against each other for victory; it’s all possible. 

Use our built-in level editor to create your very own challenges and puzzles for others to explore.  

If you’ve played the Cublast mobile game, you probably know the frustration of running out of time when you’re JUST about to complete the level. No more! In Cublast HD you battle for the best time, but time limits are a thing of the past.

Easily share your creations with other players from all over the world through the game's online community.

Rewards

Where does the funding go?

 

ThinkFast Studio is an independent game studio from Zwolle, the Netherlands. The company was founded in 2015 by two childhood friends. Soon, a third member was added to the team. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides funding our campaign, there is another way for you to support us. We want the world to know that we're here, so please take a moment to share this campaign with your friends or fellow gamers!

story:
You can now buy via Xsolla at: http://www.faromstudio.com/?page_id=317
with all popular payment systems


A third-person, open world Survival Action sandbox with combat, looting, crafting, building, leveling and diplomacy, that will take you to the world after civilization crisis.

Join a group of people or create your own faction, build your base or capture it from your enemies. Create your own world where you can be proud loner, or create a group with your friends. The entire subsequent history of the world depends on you.

Summary:

  • Planned platforms: PC, XBox One, PS4, Mac, Linux
  • Release date: Q2 2017 on PC, Mac and Linux, Q4 2017 Xbox One and PS4


World - Large realistic US themed open world covering over 64sq.km(39sq.miles). Every building in this world is explorable, you can search loot or create your base in every building in the world.

Build system - You can either build temporal camps to store found loot, or huge bases for you and your personal faction.

Combat - The combat system is designed more for stealth or fighting from ambush. Attack on the forehead is not so rational. Also you can take your friends in the fight or hired NPCs. If you are a solo player you can crouch and sneak your way past enemies or throw objects to distract them.

 

 

Offline, Private Multiplayer or Massive Multiplayer - choose the way you want to explore the world, solo with NPC only, with your friends or on public servers with up to 100 people.

Factions - You can create your own faction to gather resources and build big bases with friends, fight with another players factions or try to negotiate. Cooperate with others and build a alliance of small groups to fight against big factions. In the world you can find NPC bases where you can rest between travels, trade, and hire NPCs to join your wandering.

Crafting - Item list that you will able to craft is depends on pre-story of your character, and skills you select in the future. You will be able to select from wide list of skills to choose what you actually going to do in the future. For example, if you select chemist pre-story of character, your character will be able to create different types of medpacks and stims. Or if you select architect, your list of available constructions will be increased with more building types, while character without this perk is able to craft only camping elements. 

Skills - You will improve skills that you use. For example, if you close combat player and prefer melee weapon, you will upgrade your skills when you fighting, this will give you new perks which will give you new opportunities.

Missions - You can get different auto generated missions, that you will be able to complete solo or with your friends(up to 4 players per mission)


 

Huge expanses of Lost Region are fully open and how explore them is up to you.
You can explore world by yourself or with your friends, gather resources and build camps or bases, craft, hunt, run NPS missions, fight with other players, arrange raids on their bases or even capture their buildings to raise your influence in world.
World covers approximately 64 sq. km. with vast forests, big city, and underground locations.
The world population will react to your actions. If you injure NPCs, their attitude towards you will get worse and vice versa, by assisting and completing missions of fractions you will increase your authority.
Also, your relationship with the factions of the other players will be affected in many ways on the game.


 

The game uses Unreal Engine 4, which allow us implement all our planned features fast, and Audiokinetic Wwise sound engine provide HQ sound to the game.
 

 

 

Farom Studio was founded by two dreamers who wanted to create their own videogame.
The path of development started in 2011 with Bad Day game for iOS platform, which now became project for Desktop and Consoles platforms. Our team worked with many studios helping them to bring titles to Steam.


 

Spread the word around the world. This will help us to enlarge our community. Share this campaing and our socials, website and forum with your friends in social networks.
 

 

We need to say THANK YOU to all of this awesome companies and teams, that helped us during development, we much appreciate your help and wish you all the best in future releases and technologies updates.



And to many Unreal Engine marketplace creators, for awesome stuff you provide to developers.



 

Game development is a difficult process, and large open world projects are very challenging.
We will use all of the funds raised during campaign directly to development of Lost Region. We will do our best to deliver this game to all platforms as fast as we can. We will stay in communication with all our players and will let you know about every update.
story_txt:
You can now buy via Xsolla at: http://www.faromstudio.com/?page_id=317with all popular payment systemsA third-person, open world Survival Action sandbox with combat, looting, crafting, building, leveling and diplomacy, that will take you to the world after civilization crisis.Join a group of people or create your own faction, build your base or capture it from your enemies. Create your own world where you can be proud loner, or create a group with your friends. The entire subsequent history of the world depends on you.Summary:
Planned platforms: PC, XBox One, PS4, Mac, Linux
Release date: Q2 2017 on PC, Mac and Linux, Q4 2017 Xbox One and PS4
World - Large realistic US themed open world covering over 64sq.km(39sq.miles). Every building in this world is explorable, you can search loot or create your base in every building in the world.Build system - You can either build temporal camps to store found loot, or huge bases for you and your personal faction.Combat - The combat system is designed more for stealth or fighting from ambush. Attack on the forehead is not so rational. Also you can take your friends in the fight or hired NPCs. If you are a solo player you can crouch and sneak your way past enemies or throw objects to distract them.   Offline, Private Multiplayer or Massive Multiplayer - choose the way you want to explore the world, solo with NPC only, with your friends or on public servers with up to 100 people.Factions - You can create your own faction to gather resources and build big bases with friends, fight with another players factions or try to negotiate. Cooperate with others and build a alliance of small groups to fight against big factions. In the world you can find NPC bases where you can rest between travels, trade, and hire NPCs to join your wandering.Crafting - Item list that you will able to craft is depends on pre-story of your character, and skills you select in the future. You will be able to select from wide list of skills to choose what you actually going to do in the future. For example, if you select chemist pre-story of character, your character will be able to create different types of medpacks and stims. Or if you select architect, your list of available constructions will be increased with more building types, while character without this perk is able to craft only camping elements. Skills - You will improve skills that you use. For example, if you close combat player and prefer melee weapon, you will upgrade your skills when you fighting, this will give you new perks which will give you new opportunities.Missions - You can get different auto generated missions, that you will be able to complete solo or with your friends(up to 4 players per mission)

story:
UPDATE:

Team KAIZEN & Ingenium were invited to show off Burst!, Shattered Soul and PlayStation VR at Western Art Week, a big city-wide auction/expo in Great Falls, MT (over 10 million generated in 4 days). This is the first time video games have ever been celebrated as an art form at Western Art Week, check out our recap video below (which includes an updated look at Shattered Soul)!

 

 

 

Burst! is being made by Team KAIZEN (www.TeamKAIZENgames.com, Montana's 1st PlayStation Certified Game Studio) and Ingenium, Team KAIZEN's 501(c)3 non-profit sister studio.

Both of our studios are under Add-A-Tudez Entertainment Company, which is the company started by Team KAIZEN Co-Founders Josh, Trevor and Cyndi Hughes. We started Add-A-Tudez after we lost everything and went medically bankrupt in 2002 when Trevor (who was in the 7th grade at the time) was diagnosed with chronic kidney failure. He's since had over 70 surgeries, is in dialysis 3 times a week and is on the kidney transplant list. One day, while he was in surgery, his brother (Josh) turned to their mother (Cyndi) and said, "Normal isn't working for us, we've got to try crazy! We've got to take our love of video games and turn it into a job!"

Through a chain of events, Rebecca Engum (then of the Great Falls Development Authority) found out and told the brothers that -if they were serious- she'd teach them how to be entrepreneurs. The brothers, along with their Mom, founded Add-A-Tudez and Team KAIZEN and began the long road to developing their dream fighting game Shattered Soul, a love letter to 90's 3D fighters like Bloody Roar and Battle Arena Toshinden.

You can see a VERY EARLY (note: not visually representative of a final product and gameplay features are missing) pre-alpha of Shattered Soul's Unity3D build below:

 

The Team KAIZEN crew is refining that pre-alpha into a pitchable tech demo that we hope to pitch to industry publishers soon.

As our crew was team building and getting ready to make that tech demo, a weird thing happened. We won a grant from HASTAC (Humanities, Arts, Science and Technology Advanced Collaboratory www.HASTAC.org) and The MacArthur Foundation to make a free-to-play level pack for LittleBigPlanet 2 that taught the STEAM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art and Math) and History behind rides and roller coasters.

We had a blast developing that pack (you can see a trailer of it below: 

and queue up the first level at http://lbp.me:80/v/0s-btf)!

However, we were also initially nervous. We believed the lie that's often there in our industry: you're either a 'normal' game studio and make content just for 'normal' gamers, or you're an educational studio that just makes stuff exclusively for classroom use. We didn't like that paradigm. We wanted to make games like Shattered Soul. At the same time, we saw the excitement the LittleBigPlanet pack we did generated with people (we even got invited to speak at our state capitol on how games and learning can come together) and we didn't want to abandon what was obviously positive impact happening there.

The answer was simple! We needed to abandon the paradigm. We did that by turning ourselves into a 'teaching studio', meaning we usually make non-educational games like Shattered Soul but also heavily evangelize the STEAM, career opportunities and potential for community impact that gaming and game development/entrepreneurship has.

This led us to develop curriculum for schools and camps to use LittleBigPlanet 2 (and eventually LBP3) as a development medium for game design camps/clubs called LittleBigPlanet Club. Our efforts on that front impressed people so much that PlayStation actually drove the Road to Greatness Truck to Great Falls, threw a 1 day party/expo for us and did a video on our outreach efforts you can see below:

At the same time, we realized we had the capacity as a team to work on 2 projects at a time. One big, one small. Shattered Soul's tech demo was our big one, and we knew for our smaller one we wanted to somehow bridge the world between the 'normal' and 'educational' gaming worlds. It'd be a bonus too if we could address a complaint we heard a lot in the educational side: that many educational gaming experiences don't actually have the STEAM/History content as a part of the game play experience (for instance: some games reward players with game play for passing an otherwise standard digital test).

During our city's annual 4th of July fireworks display, it came to us! Put the player in charge of a fireworks spectacular where they change the Periodic Table elements inside the fireworks to alter the colors! Burst! was born!

Burst! started life as a Flash based tech demo (to see all our legacy builds, watch the pitch video at the top of this page!). We had people play our various builds several times and give us feedback on what worked and what didn't. We arrived at a late-alpha/early-beta that's fun to play and engaging.

In this build, as the shells rise into the sky (represented by buttons on the controller), they'll slowly turn to green. Once they hit green, the player hits the corresponding button on the controller to blow the shell in the air. They also use the triggers to swap out the different Periodic Table elements to change the colors, getting bonus points for having chains of fireworks detonated in a row where they changed colors throughout the chain without missing a firework.

You can see a video of our latest alpha build (keep in mind, there is many assets missing and/or in a placeholder capacity) below:

As for the elements in the game, here's a breakdown on them:

We've gotten far enough along with this new build of Burst! that we finally feel ready to hop on IndieGoGo and get this baby across the finish line! We're going to finish this game no matter what, but if we're funded that puts us on a MUCH nicer time table where we can have this game in your hands hopefully before the end of 2017. We're asking for $25,000.00 to get this game out on PlayStation Vita, and the stretch goals could bring us to other platforms such as PC and even PlayStation VR.

We have several different backer tiers for you to check out, everything from having your name in the credits to digital game downloads and even Team KAIZEN Co-Founder Cyndi Hughes consulting with you and designing your own special necklace under her Turtle Mountain Design found art jewelry line! Physical rewards that require shipping will only be awarded if we hit the minimum funding goal of $25,000.00. However, digital goods that don't require shipping will be given out regardless of our hitting the minimum goal or not.

Don't forget, if you back us at $25 or more, you get to join the Team KAIZEN/Ingenium BETA SQUAD! You won't only get access to Burst!'s beta builds and help us shape Burst! for launch, you will also get access to Shattered Soul's beta builds and help us prepare Shattered Soul for pitching to industry publishers! That's access to two betas for backing one game at less than half the purchase price of a single AAA game!!!!

Thank you so much for backing Burst!, we're excited to rock this project for you! If we break through the $25,000.00 barrier, here's how we plan to move forward with stretch goals:

story:
The Game

You either have to defend or steal from a large mining vessel deep in space. Each game lasts twenty-minutes and can be replayed.

Capitalist has four players to choose from:

Miner

Miners have the abilities to control their spaceship using a wrist ship controller. This gives them a top down view of the ship. Using this map they can construct robots or turrets to seek out and eliminate the Pirates. Miners can open and lock doors, turn off gravity in a room or vent gas into the room. In certain rooms Pirates can be ejected out into space.

Each Pirate has a unique ability. Pirates must work as a team to transverse the game and beat the Miner.

Captain - still developing

A Captain, if the team can get him to the ship’s bridge can take over the vessel winning the game and the entire loot. The Captain can deploy shields to protect the pirates or heal their team mates.

Hacker

A Hacker can unlock doors and hack into large vaults along with disrupting the miner's defences.

Mercenary

A Mercenary has more health and firepower to keep the team safe.

Player Progression

Game Store

There will be an in-game store called the Free Market for the Miner and the Black Market for the pirates. Players can pay to improve their character’s weapons and equipment. There's no micro transactions, players can buy equipment through in-game currency earned by playing the game.

Skill Based Match Making

Players level up their favourite characters individually the more they play as them. Insuring correct team based match making.

Game Artificial Intelligence Over Multiplayer

Each robot and turret is controlled by Artificial intelligence. Even the player’s character, if their internet connection drops.

What We Need

Your support will allow us to upgrade from Unity Personal Edition to Unity Pro. We can significantly enhance Programming, Animation & Audio in Capitalist with the Pro version of Unity. Ensuring that you get the best possible gaming experience.

We're firm believers that keeping players actively involved in the development cycle is what makes a great game. After our success with the Alpha, showcased at Dublin Comic Con in August 2016 and taking third place at Dublin Beta in December 2016. We were able to get valuable feedback from players on what works & what doesn't. With your support you will help us bring Capitalist to International gaming events such as Gamercon, Spiel 2017, Insomnia Gaming Festival & more.

Impact

With Capitalist, players will experience a unique blend of Real Time Strategy with both, FPS & Third Person gameplay elements. The competitive aspects of Capitalist allow us to build a tournament based community in which players can chose to either, casually play with friends or sharpen their skills to climb the leaderboards and compete in exclusive Newlove hosted events.

If our goal is achieved, the game will be released on Steam, which in turn will help us fund other passionate indie gamers projects and contribute to helping them realise their ambitious projects.

Risks & Challenges

This project has had risks and challenges from the beginning. Starting out we were surrounded by those longing to attempt a project like Capitalist but due to the daunting nature of taking on a challenge like this, it would always remain a dream.

We however got creative and focused on making the best with what little resources we had at our disposal.

The game will be released on Steam whether we meet our funding goals or not, however the risk of not meeting our goal here, will mean we won't be able to fully realise the potential quality of Capitalist.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, there are many other ways you can give us your support.

Follow and share the progress we make with your friends on social media. Come meet us at the events we will be at. Join the Capitalist community on our website so you can provide the valuable feedback we need to produce the best game possible.

story:
Short Summary

When I was a teen, I played many browser based RPG games, but one in particular is what fueled me to learn how to code my own. The owner of that game never talked to most of his players and only logged on to take donations and then left. It was then I vowed I could do better. I taught myself how to code and made my own game where I actually interacted with my players, making lasting friendships with people who still play my game 8 years later, through all of the different versions. Being in poverty my whole life, I could never afford hosting for my game consistently, meaning I had to stop and start over a lot. I am finally at a point in my life where I can afford stable hosting and invest in my game, where I want each and every player to know I'm available and I want them to have a great gaming experience, one that molds to their choices, one where there are always multiple choices and you are never stuck on one path if you change your mind after a choice. I want my game to be the player's game, too. I wach each player to know their game experience is different than anothers. To do this, I need help raising money to invest more time and resources.

What We Need & What You Get

To begin, we're raising $500 to put towards hosting, development, and most importantly, the look of the game. We are in talks with a pixel artist who will create the characters, items, icons and more needed for an aesthetically pleasing gameplay experience. No one wants to stare at text and buttons all the time. Our players want to see that epic sword they just looted off of a dungeon boss. Our players want to see what their character looks like now that they bought and equipped that awesome new blue mohawk they just purchased from the premium store. Our players want to see that special icon that only a Game Master has next to their name in chat and the forums. We need to add imagery that shows just how exciting that new NPC is in town that is selling the awesome items you can now see the icons to!

The Impact

Since the day I started to learn how to code, creating an excellent and addictive gameplay experience for anyone who played my game has been my dream. This campaign will allow me to bring so much more to the game, which in turn brings more to the players, which is my ultimate goal. This game has been my baby since 2007, and I am determined to get to the final stage of development to provide a bug-free, action-packed, fun-filled gaming experience that is different for each and every player. I know with your help, we can get there!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate money, donating your time and goodwill by sharing this campaign, or even playing the game and testing it would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Our Story

Our founder Mior has an idea to start selling Video Game at affordable price.The idea start when he and his friends wanted to buy game in game store near his house.

They are not a rich people and struggling for buying a new thing,His overcome addiction start when they tried to buy a new game but the price not allow them buy that game.

So he Decided to start his own physical and online game store to serve the community and online buyer to help them to buy a game at reasonable price.


The Mission

The aim of this fundraiser is to raise money to open a KapitalisGaming Store that will provide a video game at cheaper price, So the poor will get the chance to play the game, and a safe haven for people who loved to play Playstation and Xbox game,or even nintendo console, Or other gamer's that tried to buy game at discounted price. This fundraiser is For the communities to buy games at lowest price.

1). Cheaper Price: We will Bring the best game title  to the communities, so they can enjoy new game at cheapest price. We will try to make sure the price is cheapest in town .

1). Free Shipping: We aim to give free shipping to all our customer,So they can enjoy buying games with no extra charges.Once it's Free,It will Forever be Free .We Will serve our communities with the best service.Together, we can help to make sure this Mission Accomplish. Your gift will save your budget for shipping cost forever. 

1). After Sale Service: We will make sure that you will get the best After sell service from us.

2). More Discount during sale: The backpacker will get the fastest and highest discount from us using email or coupon code.They will get discount for every sale and forever

The First design for our Physical Game Store 


Online GameStore for Worldwide Buyer

We also wanted to start a webstore to sell online and give the best online experience to all our customer.


Reward And Perks

We have a wide array of perks / rewards for you to choose from. We will be updating the designs in the upcoming days / weeks and we will be adding more perks for you shortly. 
1). $1: This perk is for people who just want to contribute to the campaign and just want to see it succeed. All money raised will go towards opening the Game Store and all proceeds from the Store go towards charities and help poor in need to play a game. HIGH 5 from Mior!
2). $5: Become a member of KapitalisGaming! By getting this perk you will be contributing to a good cause and helping us build community for our Store.Member will get discount.You will receive a mail Registration from Mior  after the campaign.
3). $20: You get a KapitalisGaming mug and a personalized letter from Mior, to say thank you for contributing to our fundraiser.
4). $40: Doodle Design T-shirt for Our best customer
5). $50: Opening Night party for our opening Ceremony 
6). $100: Opening Night party (VIP) for our opening Ceremony
7). $250: You get Your name on our Game Store wall, as a donor to the Cafe. You also get a free visit to the KapitalisGaming store with 1 guest and we will photograph you and our founder Mior by the wall when you come to visit.
8). $500: You get to have afternoon tea with Mior and our store crew. You also get the All Time Discounted Pass to buy a game at discounted price forever at any time you bought from us. You also get a personalized letter from Mior, to say thank you for contributing to our fundraiser. We will contact you after the campaign to schedule a time and place for the afternoon tea.
All Backpacker Will be noticed by email and will get a discount coupon when the Sale held.

Why Funraiser is Important

Crowdfunding is an absolutely wonderful way to include fundraiser to the project. Not only do we want to help poor people to play the game,We also aim this community to feel being a part of this process, we invite you to give us feedback and ideas and help us perfect our concept. We want to know what kind of Concept of our store would you  like the most. We want to do this together with all of You, our amazing and loving fans! Also opening a Kapitalisgaming is very costly indeed so we do need the financial help as well. Also the more people get behind the project, the easier it will be convincing city official and other legal entities of our project. Crowdfunding is a great tool that gives the people the power to choose what kind of cafe’s, business’s or other ventures are set up in their home towns or cities.

We want to know what kind of Concept of our store would you  like the most. We want to do this together with all of You, our amazing and loving fans! Also opening a Kapitalisgaming is very costly indeed so we do need the financial help as well. Crowdfunding is a great tool that gives the people the power to choose what kind of cafe’s, business’s or other ventures are set up in their home towns or cities.

story:
Tactical Intervention was concepted as a highly tactical “First Person Shooter” or FPS game that had been released in 2013 as the spiritual successor of Counter-Strike, as both games shared the same creator: Minh Le or “Gooseman”.

There was a long list of features that set it apart from the competition: There were car chases and rappelling, K9-dogs and helicopters, lots of useable objects, many different game modes and complex objectives from hostage rescue to bomb planting and defusal, which requires smart, precise and professional teamwork to function.

 

Against our better judgement, we had to release TI almost one year ahead of schedule. We had no choice but to do as we were told, since not all, but some of our publishers and investors did not understand that our concerns were justified.

There was a long list of technical issues – most notably catastrophic bugs and glitches that caused many crashes, threw players out of the levels or caused them to get stuck.
In the end, the game that we were forced to release was an alpha-version with a lot of potential, but little to no polishing and a number of catastrophic flaws.

We have since spent four years – some of us unpaid for some of the time, others for all of the time - working very hard to repair the broken bits, and what we’ve come up with is in all honesty a decent and honest First Person Shooter.

Unfortunately, in the end we lacked the means to keep up the very expensive infrastructure necessary to host the quite terrible “Free to Play” payment system, so TI had to be shut down.

 

 

First of all, we want to bring TI: Reloaded out on STEAM in 04/2018 for USD 14.99 in a one-time-payment that gives you access to every weapon, every piece of equipment and anything else that is relevant to the gameplay. From the Map Kit to the Co-Op, from car chases in normal mode to the highspeed, no-nonsense levels in pro-mode and the fully customizable clan servers in both. 

 

So ok, wait - what? Car chases? In an FPS?!

And yet you want this to be a competitive game for professional gamers?


Yep. 
 

Because we made sure that both the Casual and the Professional gaming community should find whatever they need in TI:R.

For casual gamers, the game offers the "Normal" game mode.

Car chases, multi-stage scenarios with background story, lots of things to see and to do, and levels to explore; we'll even put in a Co-Op mode that we'll tell you more about later on.

For professional gamers, there will be a Pro game mode. 

Very fast maps with 200-300 fps, more options to choose from, extremely precise collision models, lots of weapon settings to adjust, and a basic, no-nonsense feeling that brings back memories from the sleek and nimble counter-terrorism games of the past that for some reason grew a bit old and fat over the years...

 

 

Now that the five of us have been working so hard towards fixing it, we want to deliver it, too.

That means to rip out anything related to the F2P-concept, including the cumbersome inventory and shop system. We want the game to be accessible, simple and fun, yet precise and properly balanced. If this campaign and the relaunch turn out to be really successful, we want to add more features, such as an entirely new Co-Op game mode called “L.A.”; and then, the longer we can keep our artists and coders entertained, we want to give you all that is currently still hiding in the darker corners of our twisted minds.
And there is a lot left in there…

 

Most of all: the game doesn’t feel like a rushed beta-version anymore.

 

 

It’s much more precise, faster and better looking, movement is smoother, many bugs, crashes and glitches are gone, and there is much more to see thanks to five additional levels. For those of you who hated specific things about “Old TI”, there is a list of about half the fixes we have made (and found the time to write down) and with a bit of luck, maybe you will find your favorite glitch in it.

 

 

Hectic Vehicle Pursuits

Canine Response Units

Tactical Rappelling

Optimized Networking

Dedicated Servers

TI:R Development Kit

 

 

 

 

Initially, Tactical Intervention was made and released by FIX Korea Ltd., a small company based in Seoul, and went through several publishing attempts. Today, we are publishing the game ourselves as FIX Games Ltd. which is based in the small town of Jeonju, South Korea.

After most of the original team left FIX in 2014, only Tony “Omega” Sergi and Til “Albatros” Sichel were left to work on TI. Their only advantage was the combined experience of today more than 20 years of industry work. Steve and Pavle joined afterwards, and they have supported us with their work for years without asking a single penny in return.

 

As of now, we are 100% independent, and there is no investor, no publisher and no-one pulling the strings in the background. It’s really just us trying to release this game the way it should have been released in the first place.

 

 

 

 

 

 

  72% Development and debt; we have four artists and coders, two of which have never seen a penny working on TI, and we need to change that. Also, we have amounted debt that needs to be repaid.


  15% Then, there are the three things that are certain in life: taxes, taxes and fees


  8% Licenses, additional content - we will have to renew some licenses soon, and we also cannot create everything that we need all by ourselves.


5% Tournament and backing rewards.

 

 

We did our due diligence before coming up with this number, and to do the bare minimum of what we’ve promised, we will be able to make due with that amount. However, if we had a more substantial budget, things would be much better.
The higher the stretch goal we achieve, the more does the breakdown of the cost shift; initially, development and compensation for our artists will be almost equal to the rest of our costs, but the more content we create, the more development work will have to be done, and that in turn means that more artists will have to work harder and longer to achieve the goals, while overhead costs should more or less remain the same.

 

 

In terms of Stretch Goals, this is what we have planned:

 

 

So, bottom line...TI:R  isn't for everyone. ​

But it's many things to many people.

Whether you're a casual gamer, a professional gamer, a YouTuber looking for something hectic to stream, an artist, a level designer or just fond of hosting your own customizable clan server (like back in the good, old days of C.ertain S.hooter games that seem so long gone)...

story:
The Afterglow Miniatures Miniatures Game is a tabletop strategy game designed for two or more players, set in a grim world devastated by an apocalypse.

Players lead bands of survivors who clash against each other in a struggle for survival among the ruins of towns, burned-out wastelands and underground bunkers.

The game, based on the intuitive mechanics, is fast and dynamic. Depending on the format it takes from 40 to 90 minutes to play, while the number of miniatures in warbands varies from 4 to 20 models, depending on the chosen faction.

Afterglow is different from many other wargames. First of all, it is a game of survival. Victory is not always on the side of those who deal the biggest damage to the opponent.

Scenarios and Mission Cards provide an opportunity to win the game without firing a single shot, relying on the player's intelligence, strategic planning skills, anticipation of opponent's moves and clever use of unit skills and abilities. 

We have also created a system of playing campaigns - connected scenarios, during which members of your warbands can gain experience, develop skills, plunder and find new equipment, but also sustain permanent injuries, fall victim to diseases and mutations or eventually die.

The game is becoming increasingly popular in Poland. For over a year we have been organizing meetings and tournaments, where you can meet many amazing people and test yourself as leader of a post-apocalyptic gang. Now we would like to present Afterglow to players and miniatures enthusiasts in other countries.

Download free beta rules and take part in the open tests. 

 

At the moment five factions are available for Afterglow MG. Each of them delivers a different playing style and aesthetic feel.

Now we would like to offer you the sixth faction, long awaited by many Afterglow players and fans.

Forsaken are rejects of post-apocalyptic societies. Their ranks include outlaws, mutants, cannibals and those infected with the Black Mouth disease.

Forsaken are driven by rage. They attack with unusual ferocity and brutality, showing no mercy nor compassion. Their sole motivation is to fight, plunder and feast on their victims. This is a faction focused on an offensive playing style and close quarters fighting.

 

 

The main goal of this campaign is to release the Starter Set for a new Afterglow faction - Forsaken.

 

 

A Forsaken Faction Starter Set is not all we can offer you. If your support reaches levels indicated below, we will be able to release even more Afterglow miniatures and accessories.

Check out Stretch Goals, help us to unlock them and expand your warbands!

 

Shipping cost may vary, depending on chosen pledges and countries. 

Poland shipping costs - FREE!

EU shipping costs – from 3 EUR (from Thug to Mechanical Death pledges) to 10 EUR (package full of miniatures, accessories, terrains and other goodies).

Worldwide shipping costs - from 5 EUR (from Thug to Mechanical Death pledges) to 20 EUR (package full of miniatures, accessories, terrains and other goodies).

 

Afterglow is a project of White Tree - a small company from Poland, dedicated to the games hobby. We are long-time gamers and hobbyists. Our main goal is to create games and miniatures "by players for players".

We collaborate with a group of talented artists to make sure that the products you buy are of supreme quality. 

Oskar Walczewski - Afterglow creator, rules designer and founder of White Tree. Gamer, miniatures painter, historian and music enthusiast. 

Sylwia Popiel, Jakub Kosla and Maciej Jastrzebski - miniatures quality assurance team. 

Konrad Sałek - Chief Critic of Afterglow

Michał Bury - Master of Tables and Numbers

 

Artwork & Graphics

Piotr Foksowicz

Jarosław Marcinek

Piotr Wyskok

Sebastian Zakrzewski

 

Sculptures

Eliasz Gola

Victor Hugo

Kamil Milaniuk

Irek Zieliński

 

Translation into English

Tomasz Potocki

 

White Tree has been operating since 2012. We sell our products online and through hobby stores, and we have many satisfied customers. You can read more about our company on our website: www.white-tree.pl

In previous years we conducted two successful crowdfunding campaigns through Polish crowdfunding platform - Wspiera.to. After both campaign backers received their pledges as expected. 

With this campaign, flexible pledges mean that you can be 100% sure you will receive your pledge after the campaign ends. 

We are continually learning and gaining experience in order to produce miniatures, accessories and games of the highest quality. Therfore we are confident that we can overcome any risks and challenges that could arise in the course of this campaign. 

 

 

 

 

If you like our project help us spread the word about it. Letting your friends, colleagues and family know about Afterglow can be of great support to us.


Share information about this campaign and Afterglow through your social media profiles (Facebook, Twitter, forums etc.).

Please find Afterglow banners and graphics available below. Feel free to use them on your websites or social media profiles.

 

Thank you very much!

Cheers!
Oskar Walczewski & the White Tree Team

 
* All miniatures are sold unassembled and unpainted. 
** Some of the presented products and artwork are concept art and may differ slightly from the final versions.

story:
Ever since we dipped our toes in the Game Development Scene We have have received a ton of positive feedback and encouragement from all over the pc gaming community in the United States, Canada and Australia. We want to start our new venture to a loving game we think everyone can enjoy!

Welcome to Ravesta, and welcome to Ravesta-Racing ...


 

Raw Gameplay as of January, 2019:

Ravesta Racing is a very different racing game to anything that you've ever played before. At its core, we wanted to make a racing game that gives you realistic modes with bots, friends and have everything a traditional racing game would but MORE we're not selling you a $60 game, we're gonna be offering a very cheap racing game with BEAUTIFUL GRAPHICS, IMMERSIVE GAME-PLAY, AMAZING CONTROLS & ENDLESS FUN, We want to include sandbox modes where you can free roam like classic driver games, much more to give you more gameplay depth than your usual racing game.

To do this, I need everyone's help and support on providing the team and income to continue development for this project.


More to do in the game! Gamemodes such as..
 

  • Demolition Mode

Demolition Mode will allow you to play the game with your friends or bots on various modes such as Capture The Hill, start at the bottom of a hill on some janky trucks and race on steep cliffs and using your max force from your car to finally get up the hill to realize your wheels, doors, and headlights all fellout in the process. Every car part can fallout of the vehicle you are driving into players or bots with.
 

  • Sandbox

Sandbox will allow you and you're friends play the game at your will, use all the mechanics, destruction, spawn all vehicles, upgrade them and repair them, customize until your limitless with everything on your car working perfect.

 

 

 

Who is creating the game?

Hi my name is Matt Sowards. I'm a professional game developer, YouTuber, and Producer based out of Tampa Florida. You can take a peek at some of my work, and a list of games I've worked on that shipped to market: https://mattsowardsofficial.com

 

Why am I making this game?

I noticed that there was a serious lack of racing games where you had a choice of play-style where you could play serious or just have a laid back experience for game-modes on these games. Most that are found in the these markets, tend to be more focused on a more realistic simulation of racing games where you cannot customize your car, explore, even have an option where you can play aggressive and destroy opponents cars in demolition mode, or just wanna have a serious realistic sports racing moment and stop playing a demolition mode. Seeing this opening in the market, combined with a love for vehicle racing games, and an option to include my Recording Label of over 10 years of music i own 100% writes too, to actually do something with it, this led me to start development on Ravesta Racing quite some time ago.

 







 

Where Can I Play?

Once you obtain a key, you can redeem it in your Steam Library on PC
​Console Guide coming soon.

Raw Gameplay as of January, 2019:



Screenshot of the game as of January 4th, 2019:


 

Funding and Feature Unlocks

We've set the bar low at $5,000 where this game can become a reality. But that won't cut it for the most sought after features like late models and 30 player online racing. For those stretch goals, we need as many racing fans to get involved, so we can see how far we can take this!

story:
Our Story

Hello, everybody! We are Team Passion. We are making an 18+ visual novel called Tower of Saviors: Cries of Souls. It is a fan game based on the mobile game Tower of Saviors, by MadHead Limited. We have the official approval from the company to make this project a reality! If we got funded, we the game will be free to play! You don't need to know too much about the game's lore to be able to enjoy this VN, it will be a great journey regardless ^_^

Below is the summary of the story!

 

Games Story

A bloody thousand years war has waged between the gods and the demons, and now even the humans have gotten involved. It was up to the Summoners to help end the war, and bring peace back to the realm. They climbed the Enochain Tower to try and seek the highest god's help. But as they climbed higher up the tower, they found out the truth behind the god's true motive for the war...
Lenio is a 19-year old young man who lived deep in the forest with his 10-year old sister, Linna. Even after their parents died from a hunting accident, they kept on living a peaceful life. Their village was far from the war zone. Linna hoped for Lenio to become a Summoner and bring her to his adventures. Everything changed on the day, when the demon Astaroth invaded the village and killed his sister right in front of him. The devastated Lenio swore to become a mighty Summoner, with guidance from Glauox, a mysterious owl person. He goes on a journey to end the war himself, like he promised his now-deceased sister. Along the way, he makes friends, helps people, and learns secrets of the world.

 

What we need and What you'll get

We have big ideas and determined to bring them to life but not all at the same time, we broke the workload into steps we can claim one by one.

1st step: Making the game
Our first step is the biggest one, We have the story, we need character and background art, Music, Some animation and a whole lots of programming to create a playable and enjoyable game, we will need to pay our team members $50,000 for the work they have ahead of them.

2nd step: More content
As our first stretch goal we plan to add more content to the game and expand the story and gameplay, More CG, background and music. $75000

3rd step: Hearing voices
A major improvement would be adding voice for characters and lyrics to our music, For the second stretch goal we will be hiring voice actors and improve the game to a whole new level. $100000

4th step: More mini-games
Everybody enjoys mini-games right? We plan to add more mini-games and add a new kind of routes, mini routes known as Aftermath Romance! (Unlock by playing mini games). $150000

5th step: Animation everywhere
We plan to upgrade the games visuals by replacing the backgrounds and characters with animated versions and bringing life to important moments of the story with animated scenes, nothing is better than animated +18 scenes right? $250000

The funds will be going to paying everyone who work on the game.  And some as payment fees.

Now for the perks!! Note that all of this are examples only, thanks~~~

Poker cards!!

Wooden puzzle!

Artbook!

And finally, T-shirts!!

 

Play the Demo

Gameplay video!!! YAY!

We have spend 1 year making the demo, hope you guys will enjoy it! You can download it below.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/2mm0nfqi076og2b/ToS.z...

Screenshots for the game!! 

 

 

 

 

Our main Characters

Lenio- The main character of the story. He has lost some of his sanity after the loss of his sister, but manages to keep his composure with sheer will power. He becomes a summoner just to fulfill his sister’s last wish.

Glauox- A mysterious owl person who came in to save Lenio. He mentors Lenio, and acts as a comforter for when the boy feels his sanity faiding.

Nathaniel- One of Lenio’s heroic spirit summons. He is a general for an army. He is known as the arrogant Duke. He is very caring towards Lenio for some reason.

Astaroth- A demon whose sole life goal is to make the demon race control the world. He seeks the power of the Primordial Dragons.

Xaverine- One of the supporting cast, she is gentle and kind like her mother, help runs the inn. Oldest of Kanra’s children.

Kanra- A supporting cast, she is the mother of Xaverine, lost her husband after an attack on the town, is an ex medic.

Molly- The first summon Lenio gets, she and Sean is a couple, very caring towards her friends. Before she died, she help fight in the war.

And many more characters we are keeping secret for now!

 

More about the Game

The full game will be free to download. The story does not just focus on the main character (Lenio) alone. There are other routes that treat other characters as the protagonists of their route and some might end up together.

There are 7 routes in total

  • Glaoux X Lenio route
  • Nathaniel X Lenio route
  • John X Hertz route
  • Red Boy X Hertz route
  • Stephen X Jackie route
  • Sean X Molly route
  • Pollux X Luna route

Each route has two endings; one bad, and one good, except for Sean X Molly route - they only get good endings, because they need their happy end together!

Special mini game as ending decider!

Instead of the traditional visual novel choices that lead to different endings, you will instead be playing a mini game to choose your ending!

 

Our Team

Kina_Skynight : I am the project leader. I have been writing fan fiction for 6 years. I am a very organized person that works on the side while pursuing my passions. My role in this project is to direct and write the script for the game.

Hamed Po- Our character and CG artist. He has been drawing since he started watching anime as a kid.

Bogdan- Our background artist, he have worked with various indie studio from around the world, he will be the artist that is responsible for drawing indoors/building backgrounds.

CrowKicks- The other background artist that will be responsible for drawing the outdoors/scenery backgrounds. He has experience of 5 years working on backgrounds for anime and games.

Dren- He has been a game developer for the past seven years. He has assisted numerous web-development and video game projects, some of which have been released on the Steam platform, such as Eternal Silence.

Delta Vee- Our music composer, his experience extends back 8 years. He has been composing music for commercial use for 3 years.

Otaku Apologist: Our editor, and marketing person. He has a university education in creative writing, three years of experience in online advertising, knowledge of the hentai game market, and project management experience from running his own hentai news site, comic projects, and game projects. He also runs a hentai blogging business.  

 

 Risk and Challenges 

We want to make this game as high quality as possible, meaning, the production will last at least three years. It's realistic that in that time frame, one, or two, of our team members will get into unforeseen accidents, or other trouble. Several team members are also independent entrepreneurs with their own businesses, which in the event their success escalates, they could prioritize their own work over this project. There is a chance of team members overextending and burning themselves out, working on their own projects. There is a minor chance that Madhead Limited pulls the plug on the project, for unforeseen reasons despite our current great relationship with them. Hardware, such as computers, can break during production, which would cause delays.

The money will be handled by the project leader, and her trustworthy sister. We will ensure that we avoid the scenario where anybody could split with the cash. Team members will receive their salaries on a monthly basis, upon completing their portion of the work. In case somebody leaves, or dies, we can hire new people to pick up the slack. We have backups of the material on cloud storage, and on an external hard-drive.

 

 

Share, Share, Share... Everywhere

You can help the project by sharing this project on your facebook, twitter and other social media! Anything you do can help the project out further. 

If there is anything you want to ask, please go ahead and contact me below

limqing28@yahoo.com

story:
Wolf Wick is an indie team dedicated to creating immerse and stunning games, 'Out of Reach' will be all our debut game to this industry and we hope that you will join us on our journey.

'Out of Reach' has been a passion of the team for a while, and we all really want to see it turn into a physical property that other people may experience and grow to enjoy.

With contributions, Wolf Wick can continue to grow as developers, artists, designers and programmers - as well as create 'Out of Reach' and allow all of you to be able to experience it.

After the game has been released and published we will continue to add content to this game, through free updates.

Video-games are extremely expensive to both create and publish.The money that is contributed to this project will be directly going into game-development and equipment in order to expand the full scope of this video game, as well as being able to hire individuals to contribute to this game's development.

The funding obtained via Indiegogo will be split accordingly:

  • 8% licenses.
  • 47% video-game development.
  • 30% equipment.
  • 10% art and music.
  • 5% marketing.

However, if we do not obtain the $4,000 goal, all funding will still continue to go towards ‘Out of Reach’ - but the release date will be pushed further back. The funding will still be separated similarly to the above statistics but will be slightly further skewed on some objects due to priority. 

This project is pivotal to our dream of becoming a complete video-game studio, we all want to be able to create amazing pieces of influential and interpretive art through the video-game medium.

With contributions and funding, Wolf Wick will be able to create video-games and release it to the world!

 

If this game does get completely funded, this game will certainly be created and published.

Some major risks that come with this project are the facts that we are a brand new studio, with 'Out of Reach' being our major debut game into the industry. 


Already, within this game's development, we have had multiple challenges, all of which we all have overcome and expanded our knowledge from overcoming these hurdles.

With my game being developed on the Unreal Engine 4 engine, I am always able to reach for help throughout the extensive documentation found on the 'Epic Games' website. As well as a plethora of forum posts which have helped individuals like me an extensive amount of times.

 

We am well aware of individuals that do not have the money in order to back this project, and that is far more than perfectly okay! If you are unable to contribute towards this project I kindly ask that if you could possibly share the word of this project it would be extremely helpful to us in the long term!
