story:
Hey guys, we have some awesome news for you, we managed to make a demo of our game! You can go check it out by following this link:

     As this is our first project we wanted to get accustomed to the engine and build something that we are proud of. Keeping that in mind we started from a basic topdown spaceshooter template and added unique mechanics to it.

     The most important mechanic in the game is the absorb. We wanted to make the game different from other spaceshooters by limiting your ability to shoot. The only way you can replenish your ammo is by absorbing asteroids or enemies, but be aware that absorbing enemies comes at a cost, it takes out some of your energy.

     Another key mechanic is the teleport. By not using the classic portrait view of different spaceshooters you are left with more room in which to move. To traverse this space more quickly or to dodge enemy attacks you can use the teleport. This also takes out a small portion of your energy.

     Last but not least, the most clasic mechanic in all spaceshooters, you can shoot down all the enemies on screen by using your ammo.

     After you complete a sector you will be rewarded with an upgrade point. You can use these points to upgrade any of the seven different stats. All stats have a three tier progression, the more you want to upgrade it the more points it will cost. These stats are:

  • Max Health: Upgrades the maximum health of your ship, but keep in mind that you can only refill it with drops from the enemies.
  • Energy Regen: Your ship continuously regenerates energy. With this stat you can improve how fast this regeneration goes.
  • Max Ammo: The storage for ammunition on the ship is limited. By upgrading this stat you can now hold more ammunition.
  • Ship Speed: Sometimes all you want to do is just go faster, this gives you more speed.
  • Absorb Ammo: Each asteroid and enemy that you will absorb will give you more ammunition.
  • Absorb Range: If you every feel like you just can't reach what you wanted with the absorb you can upgrade its range.
  • Luck: Increases the chance of health drops from killed enemies.

 

     You are aboard a new prototype science vessel deployed into the far reaches of space to test the new Magnetic Pull drive by absorbing different energy filled asteroids and analysing them.

     You find out that the drive can modify the mass and molecular density of everything that it absorbs. After playing with it you find out that you can also launch the modified mass of the absorbed objects out at high velocity. You tweak the drive even further and it creates a small wormhole that teleports you to a different vector coordonate. You get a bit concerned because this uses a small part of your ships energy.

     After some successful testing you decide to head back to Earth by using the drive, only to find that your homeworld was destroyed almost completely by three alien races.

     One of the remaining headquarters on Earth fills you in on what happened. You decide you want to take revenge on the alien races by using the Magnetic Pull drive to jump to their location in space. Your mission? Destroy everything in sight.

 

     Because we wanted to make each world feel different we filled them with unique enemies. There are three main factions that you will need to battle throughout the game.

War Faction

     Thought from birth that the only way to survive in life is to mercilessly beat down all who oppose you the war faction's arsenal reflects what it means to stay alive in this world. They are equipped with shields, deadly exploding mines and kamikaze pilots.

Tech Faction

     More interested in unraveling the mysteries of the universe than fighting, the tech faction has special ways with which to confuse the enemy. They are equipped with ships that can phase, shoot static energy fields and turn invisible.

Chaos Faction

     Wild and unpredictable the chaos faction strive on everything that doesn't make sense in the universe. Their motto is "We'll find a way to make this work". They are equipped with fast moving ships, special ammo that can temporarily blind you and big lasers.

 

     In your quest for revenge you will have face all three alien races with a split progression. Meaning that you can travel and complete the worlds in any way that you see fit. You will have to kill all the enemies present in each sector in order to progress.     You will have access to 2 different gamemodes, story and arcade.

     In Story mode you will need take out each sector of enemies step by step while also learning the truth behind what really happened in the alien invasion back on Earth. You will have unlimited continues for each sector in case you die.

     Arcade mode is more challenging, you start out with 3 lives and have to go as far as you can with them while also trying to get the highest score. After finishing it, either by winning or running out of lives, you will be prompted to save your score for the rankings page.

 

     After working hard for a few months we are very close to finishing the development of the Arcade mode. We managed to get this far by implementing our own machanics, but we realised that if we wanted to make this game a unique experience we need to invest some money in custom soundtracks and visuals. We will also need to use some of this money to finish up the story and to market the game to a bigger audience.

                     

 

 

 

     Like what you see but you don’t feel like you can contribute? Have no worries, you can still help by following us on social media and spreading the word about our project!
story_txt:
Hey guys, we have some awesome news for you, we managed to make a demo of our game! You can go check it out by following this link:     As this is our first project we wanted to get accustomed to the engine and build something that we are proud of. Keeping that in mind we started from a basic topdown spaceshooter template and added unique mechanics to it.     The most important mechanic in the game is the absorb. We wanted to make the game different from other spaceshooters by limiting your ability to shoot. The only way you can replenish your ammo is by absorbing asteroids or enemies, but be aware that absorbing enemies comes at a cost, it takes out some of your energy.     Another key mechanic is the teleport. By not using the classic portrait view of different spaceshooters you are left with more room in which to move. To traverse this space more quickly or to dodge enemy attacks you can use the teleport. This also takes out a small portion of your energy.     Last but not least, the most clasic mechanic in all spaceshooters, you can shoot down all the enemies on screen by using your ammo.     After you complete a sector you will be rewarded with an upgrade point. You can use these points to upgrade any of the seven different stats. All stats have a three tier progression, the more you want to upgrade it the more points it will cost. These stats are:

Max Health: Upgrades the maximum health of your ship, but keep in mind that you can only refill it with drops from the enemies.

Energy Regen: Your ship continuously regenerates energy. With this stat you can improve how fast this regeneration goes.

Max Ammo: The storage for ammunition on the ship is limited. By upgrading this stat you can now hold more ammunition.

Ship Speed: Sometimes all you want to do is just go faster, this gives you more speed.

Absorb Ammo: Each asteroid and enemy that you will absorb will give you more ammunition.

Absorb Range: If you every feel like you just can't reach what you wanted with the absorb you can upgrade its range.

Luck: Increases the chance of health drops from killed enemies.
      You are aboard a new prototype science vessel deployed into the far reaches of space to test the new Magnetic Pull drive by absorbing different energy filled asteroids and analysing them.     You find out that the drive can modify the mass and molecular density of everything that it absorbs. After playing with it you find out that you can also launch the modified mass of the absorbed objects out at high velocity. You tweak the drive even further and it creates a small wormhole that teleports you to a different vector coordonate. You get a bit concerned because this uses a small part of your ships energy.     After some successful testing you decide to head back to Earth by using the drive, only to find that your homeworld was destroyed almost completely by three alien races.     One of the remaining headquarters on Earth fills you in on what happened. You decide you want to take revenge on the alien races by using the Magnetic Pull drive to jump to their location in space. Your mission? Destroy everything in sight.      Because we wanted to make each world feel different we filled them with unique enemies. There are three main factions that you will need to battle throughout the game.War Faction     Thought from birth that the only way to survive in life is to mercilessly beat down all who oppose you the war faction's arsenal reflects what it means to stay alive in this world. They are equipped with shields, deadly exploding mines and kamikaze pilots.Tech Faction     More interested in unraveling the mysteries of the universe than fighting, the tech faction has special ways with which to confuse the enemy. They are equipped with ships that can phase, shoot static energy fields and turn invisible.Chaos Faction     Wild and unpredictable the chaos faction strive on everything that doesn't make sense in the universe. Their motto is "We'll find a way to make this work". They are equipped with fast moving ships, special ammo that can temporarily blind you and big lasers.      In your quest for revenge you will have face all three alien races with a split progression. Meaning that you can travel and complete the worlds in any way that you see fit. You will have to kill all the enemies present in each sector in order to progress.     You will have access to 2 different gamemodes, story and arcade.     In Story mode you will need take out each sector of enemies step by step while also learning the truth behind what really happened in the alien invasion back on Earth. You will have unlimited continues for each sector in case you die.     Arcade mode is more challenging, you start out with 3 lives and have to go as far as you can with them while also trying to get the highest score. After finishing it, either by winning or running out of lives, you will be prompted to save your score for the rankings page.      After working hard for a few months we are very close to finishing the development of the Arcade mode. We managed to get this far by implementing our own machanics, but we realised that if we wanted to make this game a unique experience we need to invest some money in custom soundtracks and visuals. We will also need to use some of this money to finish up the story and to market the game to a bigger audience.                              Like what you see but you don’t feel like you can contribute? Have no worries, you can still help by following us on social media and spreading the word about our project!

story:
The Game

You are an agent with the CIA. You've been trained in all manner of influence and trickery, but you've ended up with a cushy desk job--running a fast food restaurant and funneling the money to a secret base hidden underneath.

We are providing what the mobile game world sorely lacks: a narrative focus. There are plenty of idle games out there, but the sole thing motivating the player for further progress is just to unlock bigger and shinier buildings! We want to give players a real reason to keep playing.

We're a new studio, and we are pouring our hearts and souls into making this a game that will give rewarding, memorable experiences while also being available to play for only a few minutes at a time.

 

 

The World

The concept for the game came from a very simple observation. There's a small Kentucky Fried Chicken in a small town, and it never had any customers. We're talking about a restaurant right across the street from the biggest grocery store in town. Prime real estate. 

And yet, no one was there. So sparse was their customer base, that it was worth talking about if you saw a car go through the drive-thru.

It begs the question: If no one is ever spending money there, how does it stay open?

But stay open it did. For years, and years, and years...

So, what if there was some other way that such an operation kept its doors open? What if it was okay for the business to be operating at a loss, year after year?

What if it was...a dummy corporation? A front? A facade? Cover?

For what? Why, a secret government base, of course!

This underground nerve center could serve as a hub for all kinds of operations. Influencing the locals in the town, training government agents, smuggling drugs or weapons, testing experimental technology that the public isn't supposed to know about, psychological warfare...

The list is as wide as your own imagination.

Dummy Corporation is a thought experiment, then. What if there were secret government installations scattered across the United States, up to all kinds of mischief, right under our noses? How much of the chaos in today's world could be traced back to such operations? We hope you will enjoy exploring these questions with us.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The gaming industry is dominated by titans that think they can charge outrageous amounts up-front, and then sell you additional character skins, weapons, and individual missions at an additional cost.

Here at Human Action Studios, our core philosophy is respect for our players. That's why we have pledged to make a free game, with a few inexpensive ways to get make progress more quickly. If you ever feel like you're being scammed or taken advantage of, we've failed.

The flip side is that we want to involve our community in the development process as much as possible. That's why every reward tier over $5 gets you into the private Facebook group where were are developing the game. You'll see every update as it happens, and get to voice your opinion. That keeps us accountable to the people who helped us make the game a reality--not to a board of shareholders.

There are also several ways to take an even more active role in the development of the game, but these are extremely limited in number!



The Team

Luke was first introduced to an NES at age 3, and has been a gamer ever since. From Contra, Super Marios Bros. 3, and Zoda’s Revenge: Startropics II, this passion progressed to Deus Ex, Half-Life, Fallout, and Starcraft. The narrative potential of video games have always captivated him. Luke now seeks to unite an entrepreneurial spirit with his love for games.

Mark’s childhood consisted of titles such as Third Age, Underground 2, & Heroes of Might & Magic 3. Out of this, a love for games was born and a dream to make them. Now, after a decade of playing video games and 4 years of formal education in Game Art & Design, he’s ready to make that dream a reality with Dummy Corporation.

Darien is a gaming entrepreneur, freelance writer, and indie game developer from Alaska, where he owns and runs a successful tabletop gaming store and venue. His writings, on a variety of topics, have appeared in a variety of publications, including The Zeroth Position, Libertarian Gaming, Libertarian Nerds, and LewRockwell.com.

Aaron Kline earned his BM in composition at Texas Christian University and his MM in composition at Central Michigan University. He spent three years as a band director in Alvord ISD, where he led the High School band to their first sweepstakes in school history. He recently started his Doctorate of Musical Arts in Composition at TCU. He has composed for band, marching band, jazz band, orchestra, vocalists, and chamber ensembles. He is looking forward to exploring electronic mediums of composition in this project.

Ryan is a lifetime gamer, playing primarily RPGs and RTSs. He also has a passion for developing games and other software. Born and raised in Southern California, he got his degree in Video Game Art & Design and then worked at Rockstar San Diego for several years as an environment artist for titles like Red Dead Redemption. He is very excited to be a part of this development team at Human Action Studios!

Clay Davis is a graphic designer/illustrator of 20 years. His work ranges from rock concert posters to international industrial manufacturers and most recently, video games. He lives in the North Central Texas region with his family of 3 humans and one cat.

 

 

Why Trust Us?

You may have asked yourself, "Why would I want to fund a mobile game?"

That's fair. Some mobile games are very forgettable. But by staying accountable to the fans through crowdfunding, the final game is going to be something memorable and unique. After all, what other free mobile game lets you...

...run a fast food restaurant with a ridiculous amount of upgrades for your menu?

...smuggle weapons, topple foreign dictators, spread propaganda, and more?

...see how the media spins what is really going on?

...be at the center of an unfolding narrative, all hidden from the public eye?

...seamlessly transition from an above-ground world to an underground one, changing the interface, soundtrack, and feel of the game?

The main goal has always been, simply, to make a fun game. But we also want to shake things up! Dummy Corporation will be a game unlike any other on the Google Play Store/App Store.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

This game started out as a lined notebook with several pages of concept notes, scripting for the game's introduction, interface sketches, and other ideas. But about six months ago, we made a decision to make this game a reality.

Since then, we've been spending as much time as we can on it. Everyone on the team has a day job, so this has been a passion project from Day 1. It's been the difference between going to sleep at 9 PM and going to sleep at 2 AM. The difference between relaxing a little each day, and working for a dream that might never materialize.

So what risks are we taking? We're risking that all of our time and energy could be for nothing.

But beyond that, this is our first game. We are an indie studio, and there will certainly be surprises along the way.

Unexpected expenses, delays, integration issues, bug fixes, testing, more bug fixes...

We still have a long road ahead. But with your generosity, we will be able to meet these challenges as they arrive and deliver the game we are all envisioning.

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with your friends. Join the mailing list. Post on Facebook. Tweet.

Human Action Studios is a small team of only 6 people.

You, the community, are our marketing team, our publisher, and our lifeline.

story:
A difficult 16-bit Metroidvania game with Action / RPG and Horror elements. Meet hell in pixels.


Play the demonstration. Click on the image
 


 Have fun playing and if you like it consider
 backing our project by donating any value






" Someone had to be the sacrifice. For the rescue of that one who got lost. However, something wrong happened, and he lost it all. In a totally dark world... He'll have to fight... For his own life. Here, there's no mercy. Survive?
This won't be so easy. "

“The Crown Stones: Mirrah” is a Metroidvania-styled retro game which has great influence from old games like “Castlevania”, “Demon’s Crest”, “Blackthorne”, among others retrogames that have always inspired us. However, it has different mechanics as well as some elements from new generation games, like “Dark Souls” for example, game that inspires us a lot by its difficulty and dense atmosphere.
 

World of "The Crown Stones: Mirrah"


     The Crown Stones: Mirrah is set in the astral underworld, where the negative energies are found and horror turns into unimaginable ways. In the history of "Mirrah" there will be 7 different levels, with progression of horror and fear. Each level will represent different kinds of hell, showing its inhabitants and its prisons. The player starts at level 1 (purple) and needs to go down until the lowest level, passing through various difficulties in these tenebrous environments and facing enemies more and more monstrous. In the last level, the most obscure of all, your mission will take form.



            

            Level 01 - Valley of the Disoriented
  Level 02 - Prisons of the Soul
          Level 03 - Swamp of the Suicidals
        Level 04 - Labyrinth of the Dead
        Level 05 - The Mountain of Vices
  Level 06 - Darkness Fortress
Level 07 - Abyss of the Soul
 

Gameplay

  • With a fast and fluid gameplay, the game has a back and forth dodge system, so the player can use this mechanic to pass through obstacles, escape or to face enemies.
     
  • The game also has the system of climbing platforms in some points which will make exploration and strategy easier.
     
  • With a stealth mode, the player can hide from enemies to attack them, flee or sneak through some places.
     
  • We also have the system called “Rage”! A bar which fills as the player eliminates enemies, his fury increases and he can use it to land heavier and stronger attacks (in the complete game, “Rage” will also use chakra attacks! Each level will unlock a different chakra power and there will be special abilities for each active chakra.
     

Features
 

In this dark universe there are different types of enemies, from the simplest to the most bizarre and terrifying. Each of them relying on unique features and abilities.


 

  • Evolution based on the seven chakras. Each activated chakra will unlock new abilities.

  • Progressive horror. The game becomes darker with the progress of levels.

  • Implicit and explicit content besides many mysteries to be unveiled.

  • Wide range of weapons and items to use.

  • Secret characters and scenarios.

  • Use of karma as the game’s currency.
     

History
 

Legend has it that Nephalins (offspring of an angel and a woman) were responsible for the evolution of knowledge in human beings, creating initiatory orders. In the center of all these orders there is the order of Nephalins, an order founded only by these beings.

The Nephalins’ Order received a message which was about a brother imprisoned in the Umbral Planes, the place where is the worst spirits that have passed through Earth. After many researches to verify the veracity of the facts, this information was right, forcing the order to create a rescue mission. However the spiritual world only can be accessed through two ways: - Astral projection (Transiting through dreams) or through death where the physical body is completely separated from the astral body. Killing a member of the order was off the charts for that rescue. Every day many members were trying the astral projection, with no avail. For they were quickly noticed and attacked by being different from the others, so all of their attempts were frustrated. After considering a lot, they decided to take a drastic measure: Find the worst member of the order and cause him a lot of damage so he can enter into a NDE (Near-Death Experience) state, and then his astral body would be separated from the physical body during the mission and he would take the imprisoned Nephalin back to the upper astral planes.

The protagonist of this journey, Rivail Kuth, was chosen to realize this mission. However, due to his troubled trip through these planes, Rivail completely lost his memory, making the mission harder to be accomplished. 

    

Music


With more than ten years of musical production experience (besides 10 years playing with bands), Ingo Duarte has joined the team with a clear sight concerning the sound to be explored in the project: Rich symphonic sonorities, mixed with analog synthesizers and references to the 16-bit consoles era. The alchemy resulting from these elements conveys the weight and density of the world of the dead.
Website Ingo Duarte : https://www.lemniscarte.com/

                               Click on the link below and listen to some of our songs

https://lemniscarte.bandcamp.com/album/the-crow...


Platform
 

Currently under development for PC, a version for consoles is in the plans (PS4, Switch, Xbox One), which will depend mainly on achieving a good popularity in our debut in the market.

          

           
 

With Greenlight approved, we have our space in Steam. 
Click below and learn more
 


Minimum System Requirements

 

Processor - Intel Pentium /Amd Athlon X4. Or above
2 GB RAM Minimum Graphic Card Nvidia GT 520


        Why a Crowdfunding and why a flexible Campaign?
 

All of us involved in the production of The Crown Stones have our financial issues, so we can’t devote our fully attention to the project as we really like, but with the help of a successful crowdfunding we will be able to continue and complete the project. At the moment we can’t focus 100% on the project, we are dependent of the support to have more time and attention to it. The more resources we have, the better our game will be and the faster it will be released. Crowdfunding was the best way we found to raise funds to develop the complete project and still present everyone who believes in us.


We opted for the flexible campaign because, even if we can get a low resource it will help us a lot. We will develop "The Crown Stones: Mirrah" at all costs, we believe in the project and our potential, but we need financial recourse even if it is minimal. With 10k or less, we guarantee the production of at least 3 TCS levels. For us to be able to complete all of our plan and the 7 levels then we will need a bigger budget. We are counting on you!

 

What you get

Extra Goals


Studio and Team
 

Frater Studio is a Brazilian independent game developer studio that was created by directors Fabiano Silva and Murilo Franco in May 2016. Since then it has been in constant grow and in constantly improving in all its production areas, gaining more experience and evolving daily. Incessantly seeking to be better in all areas, we always combine the fun, quality and information factors in a way that pleases everyone

                             The team of the project " The Crown Stones Mirrah" is formed by :

Murilo Franco - Director / Work in conceptual arts, Level Design e Game Design.
murilofpande@hotmail.com -  https://www.facebook.com/lMourii

Fabiano Silva  - Director / Works in the executive part, script and history of the game.
fabianoderf@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/fabianoderf

Harsh Raghav - Main Artist and animator. Member of the project since October 2016
ragthed@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/RageTheD

Jatin Rathor - Programmer. Member of the project since October 2016
jaurat12@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/Jaurat404

Ingo Duarte - Musical artist, works every sound part of the project. Member of the project since May 2017.
contact@lemniscarte.com - www.lemniscarte.com

           

Special Thanks to Freelancers 


Junki Sakuraba ( Portraits )
https://www.facebook.com/sakurabajunki/
https://junkisakuraba.deviantart.com/

Mário Santos ( Logo of game and tilesets ) 
https://twitter.com/Emppixel


Contacts
 

E-mail : contato@thecrownstonesgame.com

Website : http://www.thecrownstonesgame.com/

Facebook (The Crown Stones) 
https://www.facebook.com/TheCrownStones/?fref=ts

Twiiter 
https://twitter.com/thecrownstones

After considering a lot, they decided to take a drastic measure: Find the worst member of the order and cause him a lot of damage so he can enter into a NDE (Near-Death Experience) state, and then his astral body would be separated from the physical body during the mission and he would take the imprisoned Nephalin back to the upper astral planes.The protagonist of this journey, Rivail Kuth, was chosen to realize this mission. However, due to his troubled trip through these planes, Rivail completely lost his memory, making the mission harder to be accomplished.     MusicWith more than ten years of musical production experience (besides 10 years playing with bands), Ingo Duarte has joined the team with a clear sight concerning the sound to be explored in the project: Rich symphonic sonorities, mixed with analog synthesizers and references to the 16-bit consoles era. The alchemy resulting from these elements conveys the weight and density of the world of the dead.Website Ingo Duarte : https://www.lemniscarte.com/                               Click on the link below and listen to some of our songshttps://lemniscarte.bandcamp.com/album/the-crow...
Platform Currently under development for PC, a version for consoles is in the plans (PS4, Switch, Xbox One), which will depend mainly on achieving a good popularity in our debut in the market.                      With Greenlight approved, we have our space in Steam. Click below and learn more 
Minimum System Requirements Processor - Intel Pentium /Amd Athlon X4. Or above2 GB RAM Minimum Graphic Card Nvidia GT 520
        Why a Crowdfunding and why a flexible Campaign? All of us involved in the production of The Crown Stones have our financial issues, so we can’t devote our fully attention to the project as we really like, but with the help of a successful crowdfunding we will be able to continue and complete the project. At the moment we can’t focus 100% on the project, we are dependent of the support to have more time and attention to it. The more resources we have, the better our game will be and the faster it will be released. Crowdfunding was the best way we found to raise funds to develop the complete project and still present everyone who believes in us.We opted for the flexible campaign because, even if we can get a low resource it will help us a lot. We will develop "The Crown Stones: Mirrah" at all costs, we believe in the project and our potential, but we need financial recourse even if it is minimal. With 10k or less, we guarantee the production of at least 3 TCS levels. For us to be able to complete all of our plan and the 7 levels then we will need a bigger budget. We are counting on you! What you get
Extra Goals

Studio and Team Frater Studio is a Brazilian independent game developer studio that was created by directors Fabiano Silva and Murilo Franco in May 2016. Since then it has been in constant grow and in constantly improving in all its production areas, gaining more experience and evolving daily. Incessantly seeking to be better in all areas, we always combine the fun, quality and information factors in a way that pleases everyone                             The team of the project " The Crown Stones Mirrah" is formed by :Murilo Franco - Director / Work in conceptual arts, Level Design e Game Design.murilofpande@hotmail.com -  https://www.facebook.com/lMouriiFabiano Silva  - Director / Works in the executive part, script and history of the game.fabianoderf@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/fabianoderfHarsh Raghav - Main Artist and animator. Member of the project since October 2016ragthed@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/RageTheDJatin Rathor - Programmer. Member of the project since October 2016jaurat12@gmail.com - https://www.facebook.com/Jaurat404Ingo Duarte - Musical artist, works every sound part of the project. Member of the project since May 2017.contact@lemniscarte.com - www.lemniscarte.com           Special Thanks to Freelancers Junki Sakuraba ( Portraits )https://www.facebook.com/sakurabajunki/https://junkisakuraba.deviantart.com/Mário Santos ( Logo of game and tilesets ) https://twitter.com/Emppixel
Contacts E-mail : contato@thecrownstonesgame.comWebsite : http://www.thecrownstonesgame.com/Facebook (The Crown Stones) https://www.facebook.com/TheCrownStones/?fref=tsTwiiter https://twitter.com/thecrownstones

story:
*Please note all media is a WIP and is currently in development.

What is Jack Jones?

The Adventures Of Jack Jones, is a action / adventure cinematic platformer, where you take control of Jack, a young man on a quest to find his parents. His adventure takes him to an uncharted island in the Philippine Sea. Where he uncovers the dark truth about this mysterious island and it's inhabitants. What perils await our hero?

  • 2.5D & 3rd Person platforming action.
  • Full original soundtrack
  • Industry professional voice actors (Full spoken dialog)
  • A family friendly rich cartoon cinematic adventure.
  • PC / Consoles (VR Port)
  • and much more!

 

Who Am I? & What You Get for your support.

I am a team of one and recently released my other VR titles: David Slade Mysteries Case Files & Dr Zaney's Insane Labs for the Oculus Quest.

So what do I need! Plain and simple I need HELP! I would like to be able to hire a couple artists / animators to lift the pressure off of my shoulders so I can focus on core functionality and game play.

For your support you also get the following (depending on tier), Check it out!

  • Pre-Order copy of the PC Desktop version of the game. (Steam Key)
  • Pre-Order App Lab / Oculus Quest version once released at a Discounted price!
  • Additional titles such as: Case Files and / or Dr Zaney's Insane Labs
  • As well as access to my PC catalog games I created for the PC!
  • and more!

 

Stretch Goals

With your support I can shift focus on what's important, such as making a great and engaging game for you all to enjoy! Extended levels, Additional play areas, more baddies and much much more! Buy Hey check out these stretch goals:

$6000+ Extra levels in each zone.

$8000+ Additional areas / environments for you to explore.

$10,000+ Additional baddies to combat spread across the islands zones.

$20,000+ A cinematic short film telling Jacks story (45 mins+)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

No money? No worries! You can still help by sharing the link to this campaign on your social media! Any and ALL help is so greatly appreciated! So thank you!

story:
Enter The Chalkboard...

I  Started Chalk Board Game Reviews so I could have the best of both worlds: It was a way for me to focus my creativity, and to enjoy my favorite hobby, playing games. Since I have started last year it has evolved into something special.   I have produced over 100 videos on the site!  We have series like ChalX-Wing and Beeroshima Hex.  We now have a podcast.  There is a cost involved though.  I have invested a lot in the channel, here's why:

  • I appreciate good audio and visual quality

  • I prefer well written and filmed overviews

Check out the 3 levels of audio from camera mic, to sound recorder, and then background noise removal (my pellet stove)

If you watch a video from when I started to where I am at now you will see the difference in quality.  I have a hard time watching the old stuff and wonder "how did I get any followers?"  Which brings me to you.  If it wasn't for YOU, my audience, I would not be doing this at all.  I would love all of YOU to be a part of The Chalk.

My First Chalkboard Review: 

Current Content:


"Your Name Here"

We have been putting out a lot of content! Come be a part of it!

  • Be a part of The Chalk!  Grab this chance to get your name on the chalkboard for the next year.  It will be seen in a new credit roll at the end of every video!  If you do not want your name public I put down whatever you want (as long as it is not vulgar:)
  • The goal of $1200 will help us cover expenses, to keep producing content, buy equipment to improve quality and efficiency, give us more time to work on videos, and help us get to conventions to further promote the channel and podcast

If we fund 100% here is what will happen:


ChalX-Wing Season 2

  • More ChalX-Wing!  When we reach our goal we will produce a new season of ChalX-Wing (12 episodes for the next season)
  No Ads!
  • I will disable all ads on the YouTube channel

New Series!

  • I will create a new series called "5 minute Overview/Refresher" It will be just like the segments of our reviews that show the details of a game.  I plan on producing more of these even if there is no review attached. Examples:



This Just IN...

The fine folks at Tasty Minstrel Games, Portal Games, Stonemaier Games, & Stronghold Games are donating product to give away if the campaign succeeds.  Check the update page for details!


The Result

If we don't fund will I stop? No. I enjoy making the content.  It does take up a lot of time.  I have a family and a job as well.  Certainly I would love for this to be my main source of income,  I am a realist though.  But here are some benefits:

  • Funding The Chalk will help spread the board game hobby
  • Knowing that people like you care enough to donate will drive me further to keep creating.
  • You will feel like a part of something special!

Risks & Challanges

Since it will be my 2nd year, I am not sending out promos or trinkets.  There really is no risk putting names on the chalkboard (except a hand cramp maybe) and there is plenty of chalk on hand :) So as long as nothing disastrous happens this should all work out!  There is a lot that goes into a ChalX-wing episode, we have done 12 already.. what's 12 more?
